John started his business in 1999 and meanwhile has employed seven people who work hand-in-hand with him. His business is doing well since it’s located on a busy street. Through his business, he has been able to provide for his family and also provide employment to other people.

With this loan of $450 from PEMCI, John intents to increase his stock and improve his bakery. His clients come from as far as Uganda. The demand for his products is high and we are confident of his ability to service the loan. Worthy of support from Kiva partners.

loans.use: Baker / Hotelier

loans.name: Cesar Heriberto

texts.en:
Cesar is married and has two young children of 2 and 4 years old. He lost his job five years ago and due to the lack of employment in the country, it was very hard to find work. In need to support his family, he decided to start his own business of selling fruit and vegetables at the market. Soon after he started selling fruit cocktails and they were quite successful with his clients, now he sells seasonal fruits, fortunately he has done well with the sale of his products.

Now, Carlos needs a loan of $1200.00 that he will use to buy wholesale seasonal fruit, which will allow him to have a good selection and to obtain better profits. He promises to repay over a period of 6 to 12 months. Cesar wants his business to grow in order to provide a better quality of life for his family. You can help to his dream come true. Support him!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad, hace cinco años quedó desempleado y ante la falta de empleo del país le fue muy difícil encontrar un trabajo, así que ante la necesidad de obtener el sustento para su familia, decidió emprender su negocio con la venta de fruta y verduras en el mercado, poco después también ofreció también cóctel de frutas y contó con la aceptación y gusto sus cliente, ahora se dedica a la neta de frutas de temporada y afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien con las ventas de sus productos.

En estos momentos, César necesita de un préstamo por $1,200 dólares que destinará a la compra de fruta de temporada por mayoreo, esto le permitirá tener mejor surtido su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. César desea hacer crecer su negocio para ofrecerle a su familia una mejora calidad de vida, tú puedes contribuir a la realización de este sueño, decídete y apóyalo.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Vui

texts.en: Vui's family has 3 members. The parents are very old (73 & 72 years old). Their daughter, Vui,  is 34 and works as a day laborer. They have a debt of $250 with a bank for the poor for their cow. Their average income is $10 per month per person. Vui wants to borrow $ 75 to sell green dragon fruit to get more income to support her family. She plans to repay the loan over the space of 5 months.

loans.use: selling green dragon fruit

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim Phok, 34, and her husband, 33, live in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with their two children who are both students. The couple has a business selling clothes and grocery products, from which they earn US$6.50 a day. Yim Phok has applied for a loan of US$700, because she would like to increase the size of her inventory in order to more effectively meet the demand from her clients.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes and grocery items for sale

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en:
E. Rafail has been engaged in this business for 3 years. He is from Corat settlement of Sumgayit City, situated in the eastern part of the Azerbaijan Republic. He is married and the father of three children.  He has his own small shop. This 27-year-old man is the only breadwinner in family. With this business he earns little money. This money is currently enough for only some of his family's basic needs. He has difficulty in covering all family needs. 
He needs $500. With this loan he will expand his business by  buying other types of food. He'll be improving his family living condition. He wants increase number of his clients. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: With this loan he will expand his business by buying other sorts of food.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is a very vivacious, outgoing person. She took me all over town visiting the other clients. When it came to visiting Frisita Nakieya we had to get on a boda boda (motorbike) to reach Frisita’s still. (That’s right; still, as in moonshine.) So, Carol gets us a boda boda driver and tells me to hop on. Then she tells me to squeeze up tight to the driver - real tight. And with one more big push she climbs on behind me, riding side saddle! Between the driver and Carol, I was as happy and as bubbly as a slice of hot cheese in a grilled cheese sandwich. We went for 45 minutes on a dirt trail through the hills with views of Lake Victoria that brought tears to your eyes. Man, this is what traveling is all about! But this is a story of Carol and her business.

Carol owns a hair salon called Mama Emannuel’s Beauty Salon. As I indicated before, she is a classy, well-dressed lady with a heck of a spirit. She has been operating her salon for 8 years and for the past 10 years has been bringing her upbeat attitude to her lending group. At 32 years old, she is married with 5 children. Her dreams are to educate her children so that they can go to the university and to enlarge her business. For now, she plans to use her loan to buy more braids, weaves, shampoos and chemicals for her business. She brings a joy to the people around her.

loans.use: Carol plans to use her loan to buy more braids, weaves, shampoos and chemicals for her hair salon.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia is married with two children and she’s thirty eight years old. She had been running her business for three years before she found out about the loan program.  One of the challenges she had was not having enough money to buy the supplies she needed to make her business profitable.  And then she joined the program and got her 1st loan of $750ST and used it to buy all of the supplies she needed for running her business. The business is now making profits!  She is excited and says that she has the need for another smaller loan.  She sells her chips at the school during the week days and delivers them to the hospital at night time. She also sells them in the market on weekends days. She sells each for one tala(dollar) but she makes one hundred per day.  She is very excited and wants to keep her business growing.

loans.use: Buy ingredients needed to grow her chips business

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale O. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in the Mushin Area of Lagos State. She sells provisions and drinks; she has been in her business since 1997. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Cirila's Group

texts.es:
Cirila and Lidia both belong to the Banco Comunal Emprendedoras. In their Banco Comunal they have learned to invest and save money, and to support their children.

Cirila, 49-year-old, is a single mother of a 28-year-old daughter. Cirila buys cattle in the different towns and fairs of the Ayacucho region and then she sells it in the Sunday' animals fair of Ayacucho.

Lidia, 28-year-old, lives with her partner and has a 2-year-old son. Lidia and her husband have a car which they use as a taxi cab and to locally transport students.

Cirila and Lidia are askiing for loans of 800 soles and 600 soles respectively in order to buy cattle and to repair a car.

They will use their savings to improve the capital of their business and to build their houses. Cirila and Lidia's dreams are to improve their business, build a house, provide education to their children, and to have their own houses.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Cirila y Lidia pertenecen al Banco Comunal Emprendedoras hace 8 meses, en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a como invertir su dinero, como atender a los hijos y a ahorrar.

Cirila es madre soltera, tiene 49 años y 1 hija de 28 años, Cirila compra ganado en los diferentes pueblos y ferias de la región de Ayacucho, para luego venderlo en la feria dominical de animales de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Mientras que Lidia es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 1 hijos de 2 años, Lidia junto a su esposo tienen un carro, con el cual hacen taxi y movilidad local a estudiantes.

Cirila y Lidia necesitan préstamos de 800 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno y para la reparación de su carro.

Sus ahorros serán para incrementar el capital de sus negocios y para la construcción de su casa. Los sueños de Cirila y Lidia son mejorar su negocio, mejorar su casa, que sus hijos estudien y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Cirila and Lidia are asking for loans of 800 soles and 600 soles respectively in order to buy cattle and to repair a car.

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es:
Señora Eva is a very enterprising and hard-working woman. She makes a living by selling shoes, food, and clothing that she makes herself, depending on the needs and preferences of her customers. Doña Eva started her business with the goal of supporting her husband economically, and in this way, obtaining more income that would help solve their family expenses in a big way.

Doña Eva has 3 school-aged children. Her husband works in an upholstery business. Both work on their own, and until today, their businesses have grown positively. With effort, both have managed to take good care of their family and have improved their quality of life at the same time. One of her big dreams is to grow her business and obtain better equipment. Doña Eva needs this loan to invest in merchandise that she will later offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Eva es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de zapatos, comida y ropa que ella misma elabora en dependencia de las necesidades y gustos de su clientela. Doña Eva inició su negocio con el fin de apoyar a su esposo económicamente y de esa forma lograr mayores ingresos que ayudarían de gran manera a solventar los gastos familiares.

Doña Eva tiene 3 hijos en edad estudiantil. Su esposo se dedica al negocio de la tapicería, ambos trabajan por cuenta propia y hasta hoy sus negocios han ido creciendo positivamente. Con el esfuerzo de ambos han logrado sacar adelante a su familia y a la vez han mejorado su nivel de vida. Uno de sus grandes sueños es lograr que su negocio crezca y de esa manera obtener mayores utilidades, doña Eva necesita de préstamo para invertirlos en mercadería que posteriormente ofrecerán a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes to offer to her customers

loans.name: Ambica

texts.en:
Mrs. Ambica K. is 35 years old and lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati with her husband and two children. Her husband name is Kapil K. and he works in private office. Her son is studying in grade 8 and daughter is studying in grade 5. The economic condition of her family was not good because her husband's income is not enough to fulfill family needs.
So Mrs. K. started goat farming 3 years ago. At present she has 4 goats. She sells goats’ milk in the local market daily in the morning and in the evening. Now she wants to buy a few more goats to meet the increasing demand for milk. So she is requesting for a $450 loan to buy more baby goats for her business.

loans.use: To buy baby goats

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom B., 50, and her husband, Mr. Savuth Sor, 51, live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both children are married, and one lives in the family home.

Mrs. Mom has been selling vegetables for twelve years. She buys tomatoes, corn, and bananas from the farmers in the village for resale at Phnom Penh. Beside selling vegetables, she also raises pigs at home. Mr. Savuth has been driving a motor taxi for over twenty years and also assists his wife with her business. Currently, he wants to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one, but does not have enough funds. Mrs. Mom is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband so he can continue driving a motor taxi and also carry vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one to operate a motor taxi.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is twenty eight years old . She is married with two children in school. She has been trading rice and fresh tomatoes for five years. Her experience in trading has made her one of the most successful traders in the market. She considers the loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar and cartons of vegetable and palm oil. Francisca belongs to the community group called ‘Living Faith Trust Group’. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral  and provide peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar and cartons of vegetable and palm oil.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. N. is 40 years old. She is married with four children who are currently in school. She sells babies clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles, and plastic chairs in the local market. She wants to use the loan to buy more baby items in order to earn more income to provide her children with good education. 

She is a member of the Jesus and Mary Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, and detergents.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoà  tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 2002. Gia đình sống gần chợ trung tâm của huyện nên rất thuận lợi cho việc buôn bán. Trong suốt thời tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị đều vay vốn để buôn bán gà, vịt. Công việc kinh doanh  của chị cho thu nhập từ 100 đến 120ngìn đồng/ngày. Ngoài  thời gian buôn bán tại chợ chị cùng chồng và các con còn chăn nuôi thêm tại nhà vì thế cuộc sống của gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển.   Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh gà, vịt.
texts.en:
Mrs Hoà participates in TYM fund since 2002. Her family lives near the market in the centre of the district so it is favorable for business. She has always invested all her TYM loans in poultry business (retails). She makes about 100.000 - 120.000 VND a day. She, her husband and her children also raise poultry at home. This is why their living condition keeps improving. This time she is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 VND to continue investing in her poultry business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto  Antonio C. tiene la edad de 48 años de edad habita en el sector de la Borgoña, Ticuantepe con su esposa Rosa Emilia Ortiz  ama de casa que a la vez le ayuda a su marido en el campo cortando piña y dándole mantenimiento a la misma, ellos tienen a cargo 2 hijos, una adolescente de 17 años y otra de 19 años que también apoyan a sus padres en las tierras cultivadas. Este señor tiene 20 años de trabajar en sus tierras y necesita apoyo para darle mantenimiento a la producción ya que no consta con recursos para poder ejercer dicha actividad. Por lo cual necesita C$ 8,000.00 córdobas pagando el monto en un año.
texts.en:
Roberto Antonio C. is 48 years old and lives in the Borgoña district of Ticuantepe with his wife Rosa Emilia Ortiz. Rosa is a housekeeper who also helps Roberto cut and prepare pineapple in the field. Together they have two daughters, ages 17 and 19. They also help their parents in the fields. Roberto has been a farmer for 20 years. He needs support to maintain his production, seeing he currently does not have sufficient resources. For this reason, he needs a loan of 8,000 Nicaraguan córdobas [about US$ 425], which will be paid back in one year.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for growing pineapple

loans.name: I Nengah Wenda

texts.id: I Nengah Wenda adalah seorang petani tulen yang hampir seluruh penghasilannya selama ini di dapat dari hasil bertani. Sejak  menikah laki-laki yang hanya mengenyam bangku sekolah SMP ini langsung terjun menggarap tanah yang di wariskan kepadanya. Berbagai tanaman telah dia coba dan kembangkan dilahanya. Ada yang berhasil dan juga kadang ada yang gagal. Keahlianya dalam bercocok tanam sebenarnya tidak perlu diragukanlagi karena I Nengah Wenda banyak belajar dari pengalaman yang pernah dia terapkan . Begitu juga halnya dalam menanam sayur sayuran dan cabai. Tanam ini sudah sering Dia tanam bahkan hampir setiap musim kemarau dimana sawahnya tak cukup air untuk menanam padi tanaman ini selalu menjadi pilihan sambil menunggu musim hujan turun . nSaat ini I Nengah Wenda bermaksud untuk menanami lahanya dengan tanaman sayur kacang panjang lagi, namun terbentur oleh modal yang dimiliki tak cukup karena sekarang harga barang-barang naik. Untuk itu I Nengah Wenda kembali mengajukan pinjaman ke Dinari dengan sistem pengembalian diakhir perioda dan jangka waktu selama 6 bulan. Pinjaman ini akan di pergunakan untuk membeli bibit kacang, pupuk, obat-obatan dan untuk membayar tenaga kerja yang diajak untuk mengolah tanah maupun memetik hasil panen nanti.    n n
texts.en:
I Nengah Wenda is a very hardworking farmer. He only finished middle school education and farming is the only source of his earnings. He started working on the land inherited to him after he got married. He tried to plant various kinds of crops, some of them were successful, some others are not. I Nengah Wenda developed his farming skills mostly through experience. He started with planting chili and vegetables one summer when his field does not obtain sufficient water for rice. At this time, I Nengah Wenda wishes to plant green beans however, he does not have enough funding to buy the seeds due to the ricing prices. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to DINARI to purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticides and to pay contract laborers to help him plant and harvest.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita E. lives in Barangay Paz, Libertad, Antique. She is 35 years of age and married to Mr. Danilo E.. She was blessed with 5 children. Margarita worked as a housemaid in Manila for almost 3 years to send her children to school. Her husband had no permanent job, so her family was very poor during that time.

Her dream is to have a business buying dried fish and selling it in the market of Pandan. She plans to purchase a pump boat for her husband to use in fishing. She also plans to have a motorcycle to use when buying and selling the fish. She dreams that her children will finish their studies and find stable jobs someday.

She joined ASHI because she wants to have a business with the support of her husband to earn more for the expenses and needs of the family. This is also a way to change their way of living. She desires a loan amounting to P5,000.00 for this business.

loans.use: To fund a fish vending business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora  Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos menores de edad a quienes mantiene económicamente. 
Con su primer préstamo de S/.300 aumentó su capital de inversión para comprar prendas de vestir para venderlas en su puesto de trabajo. Nos cuenta que se desempeña como docente y que su esposo es transportista.
Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más prendas de vestir y productos que venderá en las fiesta de navidad.
Paulina desea continuar trabajando para aumentar sus ganancias y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paulina is a member of the communal bank "Victor Echave" in the district, province and region of Puno. She is 33 years old, married, and has two young dependent children. She used her first 300 soles loan to buy articles of clothing to sell where she works. She is a teacher and her husband works as a commerce carrier. With this 3,000 soles loan, which will be repaid in four payments, she will buy more articles of clothing and other products to sell during the Christmas holidays. Paulina wishes to keep working to increase her income and cover her family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing and other products

loans.name: Gbènan Bernadette

texts.fr: Agée de 47 ans dame A. Gbènan bernadette, originaire de SO-Ava du département de l'atlantique au sud du Benin. Elle est mariée à MEHOU Mathias ouvrier à l'hotel 15 Janvier. Elle s'est spécialisée depuis près de 9 ans dans la distribution de plastiques en Gros et de la revente de quelques articles divers qu'elle distribut. Pour couvrir la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle sollicite un crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. Gbènan Bernadette A., age 47, is from SO-Ava in Atlantique County, in southern Benin. She is married to Mr. Mathias MEHOU, a worker at the Hotel 15 Janvier. For almost nine years, she has been specializing in the wholesale distribution of plastic ware and the retail sale of various items she distributes. To meet the burgeoning demands of her customers, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic goods in Nigeria

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. sells used clothing at Bantama near Elmina. Joyce has received a junior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a translator at the Elmina court. Joyce started selling used clothing not too long ago. She has no financial responsibilities since her husband takes care of all the financial expenses of the family. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her custumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the expansion of the her trade.

loans.use: Increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Hatun Ayllu De Aqchapa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Hatún Ayllu D. Aqchapa que significa Gran Familia D. Aqchapa en quechua, inicia su cuarto ciclo con  15 socias, todas las socias son D. L. misma comunidad, las actividades principales son L. agricultura D. verduras, hortalizas y crianza D. animales.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta cereales, animales menores, abarrotes en general, comida, medicina natural, tara y también se dedican a L. agricultura y crianza D. animales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles,  haciendo un total D. 9,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. trigo, cebada, azúcar, arroz, medicinas, abono, remedio, animales y para el pago D. peones

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales, mejorar sus negocios, mejorar sus viviendas.
texts.en:
The Community Bank “Hatún Ayllu D. Aqchapa”, which means “the Big Family of Aqchapa” in Quechua, begins its 4th loan cycle with 15 members. All of the members are from the same community and they mainly work in agriculture, growing vegetables and produce, and raising animals. The members all have different jobs like selling grains, small animals, groceries, prepared food, natural medicine and tara powder and they also work in agriculture and raise animals. Each members needs a different loan amount, some need 300 soles, others 600 soles. The total loan amount for the group is 9,600 soles. The loans will be used to buy wheat, barley, sugar, rice, medicine, fertilizer, animals and will also be used to help pay the farm workers. The group’s dreams incluD. seeing their children study and become professionals, improving their businesses and improving their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat, barley, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon S. was born in 1953; she now lives in Chen village in Takeo province. She is a chicken breeder. She is a widow with two children; one works in a garment factory and the other is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice. On the plantation, that child faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer, to buy gasoline to pump water, or to hire laborers to work on the field during the dry season. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Phon S. decided to request a loan for him. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline and to hire laborers

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
Amgalan J. lives with her husband and two teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her oldest son is a student in a local university and the youngest son is attending high school.

Amgalan has a small retail business that sells unprocessed animal products such as wool and cashmere. She buys unprocessed animal products from local herders and brings them to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to sell for a profit.

She started the business in 2000 with 450,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,500 MNT) of capital, which has now increased to 4,500,000 MNT. She pays her oldest son's tuition from her profit. She is now planning how to afford her son's tuition for the next academic year. She requests a loan to purchase more unprocessed wool and cashmere from Arhanghay's local herders.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wool and cashmere

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel Ponce, tiene la edad de 39 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos de 15,17 y 20 años, los tres estudian, su negocio es la venta de comida ambulante tiene once años en las venta que inicio con capital propio y prestamos en micro financieras, sus metas es terminar de hacer su casa y apoyar a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro. Con este préstamo lo quiere para invertir en el negocio de la venta de comida, en la compra de granos básicos, verduras, carnes y así poder aumentar sus ventas y poder ofertar a sus clientes un mejor servicio es por eso que a futuro desea un local fijo donde pueda a tender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna Isabel Ponce, 39, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has three children ages 15, 17, and 20. They go to school. She has worked as a traveling food seller for eleven years. She started her business with her own money and micro finance loans. Her goals are to finish her house and support her children so that they have a better future. With this loan she wants to invest in her food selling business by purchasing basic grains, vegetables, and meat. She will then be able to increase her sales and offer better service to her customers. In the future, she would like to have a fixed location where she can tend to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Mary-Rose

texts.en: Mary-Rose is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria  and she sells clothes. Mary-Rose has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Alejandrina junto a su esposo tienen una fabrica de yeso ubicado en su casa, para lo cual cuenta con hornos y con personal que trabaja en el proceso, sus ventas los realiza a las diferentes ferreterías de la ciudad.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra y leña.
Alejandrina sueña con salir adelante con su negocio, vender sus productos fuera de la ciudad y que su ultimo hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu, which means Golden Family. Alejandrina is married and 58 years old. She has 6 children. She and her husband make plaster in their home, where they have ovens and staff to assist them. They sell their product at various hardware stores around the city. Alejandrina needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will use to buy stone and firewood. Alejandrina dreams of improving her business, selling her products outside the city, and watching her youngest son finish his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing stone and firewood.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 50-year-old married man living with his three children. He has been a construction worker since 1989 with a long experience in this sector. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise in order to develop his work and to be able to satisfy the demand of the market.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to develop his work

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam D. R. is from the village of Purok 9B, Kiwalan Iligan City. She is 20 years old. Meriam is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Meriam owns & operates a business peddling ice cream bars with the help of their family owned motor in the local community. Meriam is just starting this business.

In 2009, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used for motor vehicle repair. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Meriam from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair their motor vehicle

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Lillian Auma

texts.en:
Lillian is 26 years old. She has a business selling fresh fruit, including paw paw (papaya), avocado, bananas, and oranges. She buys the fruit at a market and sells it at a different market in town.

Lillian will use her loan money to buy more fruit for her shop. She is also considering buying clothes or vegetables to sell, if they will bring in good money. She will use the proceeds to support her three children and the four neighboring orphans for whom she cares. Whatever Lillian brings home she shares with these vulnerable children. Lillian is also a community health worker. This means that she visits sick people in her community and counsels their caregivers.

Kiva partner K-MET, the NGO giving this loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional microfinance institution. Rather, it is a development organization focused on raising health standards in Kenya. Many of the loan recipients from this organization are volunteer community healthcare workers like Lillian. For more information about K-MET, see the partner link on the lower right side of this web page.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D. est une femme de 25 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Depuis 2004 elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara foulbé 2. Depuis son adhésion dans ledit Banc Villageois elle développe un petit commerce de vente d'huile de palme et de produits halieutiques. A domicile, elle a aménagé une case qui lui sert de boutique. Cette activité lui procure des ressources financières qui lui permettent de soutenir son mari en participant à la nourriture et la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Maïmouna D. is a 25-year-old woman, married, and the mother of two children. Since 2004, she has been a member of Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2. Since joining the aforementioned organization, she has been developing a small business selling palm oil and seafood products. At home, she has fixed up a hut serving as a store. This business brings in the financial resources enabling her to support her husband by helping to feed and look after the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her capital to grow her business

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Antonio G. se dedica en el departamento de Masaya a su actividad de elaboración y venta de sandalias típicas nicaragüenses siendo comercializadas por él mismo en su establecimiento donde muchos clientes llegan a comprarle el producto.

Para llevar a cabo esta actividad, el señor Oscar requiere de la compra de material prima como lo es el cuero, hilo, hule, agujas, hebillas, entre otros. Para esto acude a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera continuar comercializándolos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Antonio G. works in the Masaya province making and selling typical Nicaraguan sandals. He sells these at his own place of business where many customers go to purchase them. To carry out this activity, Oscar needs to buy raw materials like leather, thread, rubber, needles, and buckles among other things. To do this, he has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan in order to buy these products and in this way continue selling sandals at his place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for making footwear

loans.name: Victoria Jenny

texts.es: La señora jenny se encuentra en su quinta secuencia de su credito individual dentro de la institucion,  durate todo el tiempo que trabajo junto a la institucion demostro ser una persona trabajadora y con ganas de superacion.  La actividad economica que realiza es la venta de comida en un pequeño local ubicado en la Plaza El Condor. Ella vive conjuntamente con el esposo y sus dos hijos, don Frenando Arias el esposo cuenta con un trabajo fijo con el cual ayuda con los gastos familiares.  La señora Jenny invertira el prestamo en la compra de insumos para su negocio es decir arroz, fideo y algunos otros alimentos que se pudieran comprar por cantidad para si poder disminuir costos y generar mayor ganancia, ademas comprara un pequeño refrigerador.

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de un pequeño refrigerador a medio uso.

loans.name: Damiola

texts.en: Damiola sells bags of garri(cassava flakes) in wholesale to her customers.She has been in this business for long.she is  hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business above poverty. the demands for her bags of garri is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old and married with two grown children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling vegetables in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $175 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou V., 23 years of age, sells mung beans and fish in her village, earning a net income of Php1,700 a month. Because that income is not sufficient for the needs of her family, she is requesting a loan of Php8,000 from Kiva lenders to buy more mung beans and fish so as to increase her income.

Marilou is married to Romeo, and they are blessed with a two-year-old child. The family resides in Culalabat, Cauayan City, a rural area. This entrepreneur aspires to uplift their living conditions for the welfare of their child, and now saves little by little for his education.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable and fish vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Evans Moguche

texts.en: Evans Moguche M., 25, has been selling household items (mali mali) to locals for the last two years. His business challenges are the decreased demand of late and low stock turnover. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more plastics, combs, wallets, nail cutters and plates. His goal for the future is to sell household items wholesale. Evans has a self-employed wife and three children between the ages of 3 and 7 years old. In addition to their businesses, this couple does small-scale farming. Evans describes himself as aggressive, motivated and development-oriented.

loans.use: To buy more plastics, combs, wallets, nail cutters and plates

loans.name: Olga Mario

texts.pt:
Olga Mário M. nasceu no Distrito de Chokwe, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 31 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos e 1 enteado de 14, 12, 5 e 2 anos de idade, onde os 2 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu do Distrito de Chokwe para cidade da Matola devido a guerra de destabilização em 1983 com os seus pais. Em 1999 saiu com seus pais para Boane afim de fixar sua própria residência, onde vivem actualmente. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 20 anos, aprendeu esta actividade com sua mãe na Matola quando tinha 10 anos de idade e faz cerca de 10horas por dia. Não possui nenhum empregado, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através das autoridades comunitárias durante os encontros de mobilização. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (feijão, ovos, farinha e outros) para aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt e 11.000.00mt para Habitação e comercio.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhores condições de habilidade a sua família.
texts.en:
Olga Mário was born in the District of Chokwe, in the Gaza Province, in the South of Mozambique. She is 31 years old, married and the mother of 3 children and one stepson who are 14, 12, 5 and 2 years old. The two oldest are in school. She only went to school until the 6th grade due to her parents lack of financial resources. She owns the house where she lives with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left the Chokwe District to go to Matola with her parents due to the destabilization war of 1983. In 1999, she left with her parents to Boane in order to establish the home where they now live. She has had her own business for over 20 years. She learned the businees from her mother in Matola when she was 10 years old. She works around 10 hours a day. She has no employees and makes around 7.000.00mt a month which goes towards house expenses and savings.

She has never had loans from other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through community leadership during mobilization meetings. This loan, in the amount of 8.000.00mt, is her fourth. She intends to purchase supplies (beans, eggs, flour and others) to increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt and 11.000.00mt and were used in housing and her business.

In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her construction and offer better living conditions to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of vegetable oil and others

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun L. (pictured here), 53 and her husband, Mr. Vanthorn Phon, 55, have been married since 1979 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Thoeun L. has been selling Cambodian cake in her village for one year, while her husband has been raising pigs for three years. She is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to help her husband purchase food for pigs.

loans.use: To purchase pig food.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mr. Leang L. and his wife, Mrs. Nao Soeun, have been married since 1990. They have two children: one son and one daughter, both in school. The family lives in a small village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.
 
Leang has been a TV and radio repairman for more than sixteen years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for more than eight years. He has one previous Kiva loan and now is requesting his second loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school and to expand his house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to school and to expand his house

loans.name: Florajaida's Group

texts.en:
Florajaida R. is from the city of Labo Ozamiz City. She is 66 years old. Florajaida is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Florajaida is widowed and has 3 adult children. Florajaida owns & operates a specialized retail store. She sells a variety of products such as eggs, noodles, salt, sugar, soy sauce and cooking oil to the local community. Florajaida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Florajaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Florajaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Florajaida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Florajaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gina Alexandra

texts.en:
Gina Alexandra, 28 years old and living in a cement house with all the basic services in Guayaquil, has two children, ages seven and six, and stopped working when she had the children to take care of them. Since then, however, her husband left her and she is now a single mother selling sandals to earn an income for her family. One difficulty of her work is protecting her store from thieves.

With the loan Gina will buy women´s and children´s sandals to sell in her store. Over time, she would like to grow her business and sell all types of shoes.

loans.use: To buy women´s and children´s sandals

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda A. has been buying and selling rice and frozen foods for almost three years to supply additional income for her family. She is 41 years old and married with two minor children. She lives in the province of Rizal with her husband, Angelito. He is a laborer who works closely with her. Imelda would like to receive a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to increase her inventory of rice, tocino (sweetened cured pork), hot dogs, ham, skinless chicken, pork, embutido (meat loaf) and other frozen food products. Imelda believes that this loan will help to grow her business and drive increased revenue. Imelda has been a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2005. She is a devoted member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and stable repayments on previous loans. Her long-term goals are to maintain the profitability of her business and support the education of her children. Imelda is hopeful that her buying and selling business ventures will continue to grow and improve the overall standard of living for her entire family. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank approach (GBA) to deliver credit to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models for credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To buy rice, tocino, hot dogs, ham, skinless chicken, pork, embutido and other frozen foods products

loans.name: Sokchan

texts.en:
Sokchan B. is a 27 year old married woman who lives in Ampil Lech village, in Takeo province.  She and her husband, Chantou, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

Aside from farming, Sokchan is a silk weaver.  The extra money helps to support her family.  She decided to ask for a loan to purchase silk for weaving and to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farm.  Sokchan is the mother of two children; one attends school and the other is 3 years old.  Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: Purchase silk for silk weaving and buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farm.

loans.name: Phouk

texts.en:
Mr. Phouk K., who lives in Samraong village in Kandal Province, was born in 1951. He and his wife, Mrs. Sun Heng Ros, are teachers in the local village school, and he also owns a very small piece of land upon which he grows fruit for sale to support his family. Because his family lacks sufficient access to water, Phouk is requesting a loan to dig a well for their use.

Phouk is a father of four children, one of whom is a goldsmith, while the others are enrolled in local public school. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To dig a well for his family’s use

loans.name: Chandani

texts.en:
Chandani is a married woman living with her husband and son in Kekanadura, part of the Matara district of Sri Lanka. She is a hardworking woman, and she helps her husband who makes jewelry. Pictured above is Chandani with her husband and son.

Chandani and her husband have managed the business of jewelry making for four years. She has requested a 40,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase tools as well as gold to help their business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy gold and tools for making jewelry

loans.name: Tenjei

texts.en:
Z. is married and has six children. He is presently retired and, due to ill health, cannot indulge in agricultural activities, which are the main source of income in his community. He has been a GHAPE member since 2004 and has successfully borrowed and repaid four loans. 

With this new loan, he plans to buy a motorcycle taxi for transportation. Given the nature of the roads in his community, motorcycles are the most favorable means of transport. He also plans to repair his pig sty and add one more piglet to his farm. The profits from this loan will be used to provide food to his family and help to pay for the education of his children.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn P. is from the village of Christine, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 26 years old. Jonalyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jonalyn owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals as well as engaging in the food processing business. Jonalyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jonalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be Jonalyn's fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Shahar

texts.en:
Shahar sells fabrics for sewing national dresses.  She started her business 12 years ago. Her husband works as a teacher. His wages are small, and Shahar wanted to give her children abetter quality of life. Thanks to her efforts the business has gone very well. Now Shahar is requesting a loan of 9,000 Somoni. She will use the money to buy more merchandise, since her sales are increasing and she wants to have inventory in stock for all of her clients. With your contribution Shahar will move ahead.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history.  It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy D. is from the village of Santa Cruz. She is 35 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Joy owns and operates a business selling cosmetics but her main source of income is her allotment of 20,000 PHP per month from her husband who is abroad. In 2006, Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. Joy is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials

loans.name: Pedro Benigno

texts.es:
Pedro Benigno T. P. tiene 64 años. Vive en unión libre con sus 6 hijos de 23 hasta 40 años, en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pedro es un socio de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Pedro trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, arroz y cacao. Hace sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para trabajar en los cultivos de verano. Ya tiene el terreno preparado, solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara porque el costo es bajo y podría tener buenos beneficios de su trabajo. Su sueño es tener salud y dar estudios a sus nietos (4 viven con el). Quisiera tener poquito más de dinero. Los únicos problemas que tiene son a veces discusiones animadas con su mujer (son casados hace mas de 40 años)

Le gusta dormir y descansar en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Pedro Benigno T. P. is 64 years old and lives in the canton of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province. He is in a common law marriage and has six children between the ages of 23 and 40.

Pedro is a member of the Recinto San Ramón Communal Bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramos, 12km outside of Ventanas. The group consists of 20 members who engage in short cycle agriculture (growing crops that can be harvested in six months). They are requesting their first loan from Cooperativa San José.

Pedro is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and cacao. He sells his crops in Ventanas every six months.

He is requesting a loan for his summer crops since he has already prepared the land. Pedro plans to buy seeds and compost. He believes the loan will be helpful because it does not cost him much and he will be able to achieve good benefits in his work. His dream is to be healthy and provide an education for his four grandchildren that live with him. Pedro also wants to have a little more money. The only problems he faces are whenever he occasionally gets into heated discussions with his wife. After all, they have been together for more than 40 years.

He enjoys sleeping and relaxing in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & compost for his summer crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wire, ribbon, Resistol (glue), silicon and fabric to make flowers.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea C., 24, is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. C. and her husband are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 2.5 each per day. In addition, C.'s mother weaves traditional Cambodian silk at home. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for the commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s mother appears in the photograph because C. is at the factory.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Kisakye Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en:
N. Robinah belongs to the Kisakye Women’s Group-Mukono. She is 42 years old, hard working, happily married and blessed with five buoyant children. Taking her family responsibilities in stride, Robinah has for the last 18 years been under the financial auspices of her boutique business in Mpunge-Mukono. This above mentioned coupled with her diary farming enterprise has been her family’s dependable means of livelihood.

She set forth on this business with pep talk ideas from a close friend. Robinah was, prior to this, involved in a fishing business that in retrospect she says gave her some of the financial backup to start up this business.  In a week, Robinah says she can make up to $31. 

The experienced stock in trade, she says she has banked on to achieve longevity in this business, has been her exceptional customer care skills and her high spirited entrepreneurial efficacy. Robinah says her major challenge in the course of doing her business has been the lack of sufficient capital to buy more new clothes to resell in her boutique. This, she says, has in many respects affected the growth of her business. She reckons with this loan she will be able to buy more new clothes to resell and as a result make more profit.

loans.use: The purchase of more new clothes to resell at her bontique

loans.name: May

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 42 years of age and a married woman. In order to cover the needs of the family, S. built a small store in front of her house where she sells a few groceries. She has been in this sector for eighteen years and is earning approximately US$ 5 per day. To help support the family, her husband works repairing vehicles in his village. 

S. is blessed with two children who are employed: one is a painter and one sews clothes to earn a living. S. has a child who wants to buy land where she will build a new house to live separately. As she doesn’t have money yet, S. is applying for a loan for her child use to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for her daughter

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira B. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old. Elvira is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of firewood in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elvira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood & working capital

loans.name: Perla Marina

texts.es: Perla Marina tiene 27 años. Es casada vive con su esposo y 2 hijos menores de edad, viven en un reparto muy transitado por clientes. Perla trabaja en la venta de ropa usada en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos, es una joven muy emprendedora y al mismo tiempo bien independiente. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece, se levanta muy temprano desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ya que algunas personas llegan algo noche. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener poder establecer el negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Perla Marina, 27, is married and lives with her husband and two minor children in a neighborhood that is very popular with customers.  Perla sells used clothing.  She has a wide variety of items and is a very enterprising young woman as well as quite independent.

Her store is located in her home where most of her customers come to buy the various items she has on offer.  She rises very early in the morning and is open from 6am until 9pm because several people come by quite late.

She is asking for funds to buy merchandise to increase inventory.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  Her dream is to establish her business in the market.

loans.use: To buy stock inventory for her store.

loans.name: Gabriel Eduardo

texts.es:
Gabriel Eduardo C. C. tiene 24 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Gabriel pertenece a la Ventanilla Casaiche Chilipamba ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería como vacas lecheras y chanchos, esta ventanilla tiene 20 miembros.

Gabriel se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y a la ganadería cría vacas lecheras, las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo fréjol y papa y animales para engordar y después vender. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es ponerse comprar casa y comprar terrenos.
Le gusta jugar fútbol.
texts.en:
Gabriel Eduardo C. C. is 24 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He lives in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolívar. He has 4 children. 

Gabriel belongs to the Casaiche Chilipamba bank, located a half an hour from Guaranda. It is a group that is dedicated to agriculture and cattle, such as dairy cows, and pigs. This bank has 20 members. 

Gabriel grows corn, wheat, beans and potatoes. He raises dairy cows. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and he sells in the wholesale market in the same city.  

He is asking for the loan to buy materials to plant corn, wheat, beans and potatoes as well as animals to fatten up and later sell. The support of the loan will support him financially for his family's needs. His dream is to buy a house and land. He likes to play soccer.

loans.use: Materials to plant corn, wheat, beans and potatoes, as well as animals.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a dairy farmer in Litein Town in the Rift Valley-Kenya, producing milk and selling locally.  He has employed 3 farmhands.

He has applied for this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He believes the income generated will subsidize the meager family income after the demise of his resourceful wife in a road accident.  He hopes to develop his own water source and quality feeds. 

He urges the field officers to enlighten farmers, as lack of information remains the main challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en: Altantuya L. is a 45-year-old single parent. She lives with her two adult children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent with fence, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her youngest daughter attends university while her oldest son helps with her business. Her husband passed away two years ago. Since 2000, Altantuya has been operating a public-transport service with help of her husband, using their own minibus within the city, but in 2008 her husband passed away and her son started to help her by working as a driver of their micro-bus. After many years of owning this business, she has gained much experience and has built a stable operation. For the future, Altantuya hopes to continue to grow her business and plans to build a house in her yard after her daughter's health gets better. She is a modest and honest woman. Her daughter is under very bad health conditions and therefore, Altantuya is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to pay her daughter's medical treatment cost.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's medical treatment cost

loans.name: Nyaruhanda Twimukye Group-Ibanda

texts.en: 28-year-old Gelard A. belongs to the Nyaruhanda Twimukye group-Ibanda. For the past 5 years he has sold bananas in a Mpembwe trading center market. It is a business he says he began after he got capital from his agro-produce sales. The happily married father of 2 says hard work and determination have been attributes he has constantly relied on. This business generates 220,000 shillings for him monthly, and with this loan, he is going to purchase more manure for his banana gardens.

loans.use: To purchase manure for his gardens.

loans.name: Luisa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Luisa de 52 años, siempre quiso darle una buena vida a sus 4 hijos pero cuando se quedo sin trabajo su esposo ellos comenzaron a gastar sus ahorros y ella decidió comprar un pequeño terreno para ubicar una pequeña tienda. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha trabajado en una zona urbana llamada suburbio donde tiene ubicada la tienda y la pequeña papelería. En la actualidad realiza las comprar junto a su esposo en el mercado desde las 06h00am y comienza la atención al público a las 06h45am hasta las 22h00pm. Vende víveres como bebidas, snack, arroz y algunos artículos de papelería.  

Tiene muchas aspiración con su tienda- papelería por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo bisutería, papelería, cuadernos, plumas etc. En el futuro quiere mantener una familia unida y continuar ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: Luisa, age 52, has always wanted to give her 4 children a good life, but when her husband lost his job they started spending their savings and she decided to buy a small plot of land to open a small store. With hard work and dedication she has worked in an urban zone called Suburbio where she has her store and a small stationery store. She currently makes her purchases with her husband in the market at 6:00 am, and the store is open to the public from 6:45 am til 10:00 pm. She sells groceries such as drinks, snacks and rice, and other stationery items. She has many dreams for her store/stationery store, and so she wants to use the loan to buy costume jewelry, notebooks, pens etc. In the future she wants to keep her family together and continue to expand her business.

loans.use: stationery, costume jewelry, notebooks

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells 'kenkey' (balls of fermented maize dough) at Abura.  Ekua has received senior high education.  She is divorced and takes care of three children. She sees to the well-being of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to cook for sale. She plants to invest her profit into her children’s education. 

She is in the process of preparing the 'kenkey' in this photo.

loans.use: to buy more maize to cook for sale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia S. is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 52 years old. Lydia is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Lydia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: James

texts.en: James M. G. is a married man. His wife is a businesswoman and they have one child, aged seven years old, whom they hope to give a quality education up to the university level. His business is located at a busy market in Mombasa.  He owns a fruit sales business. Besides this business, he owns a cafeteria. He has been in the business for the last two years and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more watermelons to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He dreams of becoming a manager of a chain of his own hotels in future. He describes himself as trustworthy and honest.

loans.use: Watermelons

loans.name: Sara Ruth

texts.es: La Sra. Sara Ruth G. G. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia en el negocio de Destace de Cerdo para vender la carne ella ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes les entrega La carne tiene dieciocho  años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, actualmente tiene  dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de los cerdos  y así   invertirle a su negocio y mejorar la condición de  su negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Sara Ruth G. G. is self-employed butchering pigs to sell the meat. She has done this for eighteen years, and has a customer base to whom she delivers the meat. Right now she has two school-aged children. She has had four loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase pigs, thereby investing in her business and improving it. These loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, since in this way she has improved the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase three pigs, corn and firewood. Compra de Tres cerdos, maíz y leña

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Carlos G. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es el negocio de video juegos, el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Sus clientes potenciales son los vecinos de la aldea del Chichicaste y la mayoría de estudiantes que circulan por el lugar, tiene muchos clientes por los juegos actualizados que tiene.

En la actualidad Talo como mas se le conoce en la aldea en donde vive no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para poner a funcionar (2) dos maquinas de video juegos, no estan funcionando por desperfectos y la demanda de sus clientes es bastante, ya que muchos esperan turno para poder jugar.

el credito lo utilizara para hacer la reparación de las dos maquinas y ponerlas a trabajar y así satisfacer la demanda de su clientela, en este tipo de negocio no solo niños juegan si no también personas adultas que les gusta distraerse con este tipo de entretenimiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos G. has an establishment with video games located in his house. His costumers are neighbors of the small village of Chichicaste and students who go around the area. He has a lot of costumers because of the new released games that are available. 

Currently, Talo, as he is better known in the village, does not have the financial resources needed to repair two video game machines that are not functioning properly. The demand from his costumers is high and often they have to wait in line to play. These games are played not only by children in the area but also by adults who enjoy this type of entertainment. 

He is requesting the loan to buy spare parts to fix the two machines and be able to better serve his costumers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for video game machines.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Carlos C. A. le está haciendo falta los pintar las paredes y la colocación del piso del interior de su casa. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora a su vivienda. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como oficial de policía en la ciudad, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
Desea darles seguridad y comodidad a sus tres hijos en la casa.
texts.en: Mr. Carlos C. A. needs to paint the walls of his house and put in flooring inside. He is asking for the loan to buy materials and pay the person who is doing the home improvement. He plans on paying for the loan with a part of his income from his job as a city police officer, which is his family's source of income. He wants to give safety and comfort to his three children in their home.

loans.use: to do interior and exterior finishings on his house.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a 41-year-old business man.  He sells sugarcane for a living.  To supplement his family’s income, he does farming.  He is able to educate his two children with the income from his business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business hence his living standards.  He hopes to become a major supplier of sugarcane in his area in the future.   He has requested  50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to rent a room for storing sugarcane, pay for labor, and add to his stock of sugarcane.

loans.use: to rent a room for storing sugarcane, pay for labor, and buy sugarcane

loans.name: Salveri

texts.en: Salveri is a 30-year-old married man who has one child and rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for three years. He started with working capital of 800,000 shillings and now has 2,500,000 shillings. Salveri's hardships include breakage of goods during transportation. His goal is to stock up 10 million shillings in three years time and to build a house. Salveri requested a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle

loans.name: Lidia Esther

texts.es:
Lidia nació en la ciudad del Huaro, tiene 43 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus 3 hijos. Desde cuatro años trabaja en la Organización Clásica (Clásica se encarga de vender utensilios de cocina).  Ella tiene crédito con  la Asociación Arariwa, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, será para uso personal específicamente para la educación de sus hijos y otra parte utilizara para ahorrar. 

Lidia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante sus hijos y su sueño es que sus hijos se han profesional.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in the city of Huaro. She is 43 years old and she lives in the city of Cusco together with her 3 children. For the past four years she has been employed by Organizacion Clasica (Clasica sells kitchen utensils). She has a loan with Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know she has this financial support. She has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She enjoys being part of her communal bank, named "Templo del Inca", because all of the members are responsible people and very supportive.
