She is thankful to those individuals who will contribute to the loan that she requests.  It will be very useful in the development of her business. She will use her loan for personal expenses, specifically for her children's education and a part will be used for savings. 

Lidia is a fighter and she is an enterprising woman who provides for her children. Her dream is to see her children have a career.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Wilmer de 40 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La bodega de Rosa es la primera en abrirse en su barrio, desde las 5 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y conversar con su cliente, lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para abrir su tienda,  aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo, espera que en adelante su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos, por ello espera de su aporte para concretar sus planes. Este será su décimo segundo crédito con MFP, y siempre ha mostrado ser puntual en sus primeros pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus socias, ya que es muy responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, is a very hardworking and friendly woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband Wilmer, 40, and their four cherished children, who they want to give a better quality of life. Rosa's grocery store is the first to open in her neighborhood - from 5:00am her doors are open to receive customers. They know the variety of merchandise that she has in her store and don't hesitate to buy from her, since they have the security of knowing they'll find what they need. 

What she likes most about her work is selling and talking with her customers. She has been in this business for 20 years and considers the toughest part to be getting up early to open her store, but even so she knows that it's her job and she has to do it. She hopes that in the future her business will grow and bring in more income; for this reason she hopes that the loan will help to solidify her plans. 

This will be her 12th loan with MFP and she has always proven to be punctual in making her payments and expects she will be now, too. In her village bank she is very dear to the rest of her members because she is very responsible. With the 2,000 nuevos soles that she requested, she will buy more products to better stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Rosanna has a shop that sells coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional coconuts.

Rosanna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Rosanna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional coconuts.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia has been in mixed farming for 11 years in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya, producing pineapples, eggs, tea and milk and selling to the local market. She is married with two children, aged 7 and 5 years.

Lydia has made a loan request of 80,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to pay for a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will improve her income and will go into paying for the education of her children. She wants to increase the number of her dairy cows and acquire better machines to make her farming more economical.

Lydia says animal feeds are the greatest challenge in farming. She is, however, grateful to Juhudi for making farm loans.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Colinas De Poteca Group

texts.en:
Mirna, Eloisa and Dimara, all of whom reside in Trojes, Honduras, formed the “Colinas de Poteca” solidarity group in June, 2011. 

Mirna has made a living by running a small convenience shop for the past two years, selling basic food and other household products. To earn additional income Mirna sells Avon cosmetics on the side. 

She is currently requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise for her convenience shop. 

Eloisa sells homemade baked goods for a living and Dimara has a small clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase many assorted items for the general store.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi comes from the village of Ghvankiti, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is 58 years old and lives with his wife, Olga. Givi has a mini-bus and provides transportation services to people living in the Imereti Region. Olga is leading the agricultural business of the family. They have two sheep and sell lambs in the season. Also, the family owns one pig and sells piglets. Domestic animals are sold in Zestaponi, a nearby town. 

Givi requests credit for purchasing a cow. He and Olga will produce cheese and sell it in the Zestaponi market. It will increase the income of the family, which amounts currently to 650 Laris per month. 

Givi and Olga plan to use the increase in income as a result of the purchase of the cow for further expansion of their agro-business.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Celestino, de 50 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa Dominga y de sus 2 jóvenes hijos, que estudian. En armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, y en la actualidad siembra papa, alverjas, maíz y flores de gladiolos en sus chacras. Le gusta mucho la labor de campo porque la realizan todos los miembros de su familia, aunque reconoce que la labor es sacrificada ya que debe vigilar todos sus cultivos, para que no se pierdan por las plagas o los factores climáticos adversos, de esta manera siente que su dedicación es recompensada durante el tiempo de cosecha, pues recoge toda su producción y la vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad a regulares precios. Además paralelamente a su labor agrícola también se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas, toros, carneros, chanchos, que comercializa de vez en cuando en las ferias de la ciudad. Y como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, y también quiere comprar mas animales para continuar con la comercialización, ya que sabe que obtendrá generosas ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Además dice estar satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo comunal porque esta integrado por personas muy responsables. Celestino de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, que esparcirá entre sus cultivos de maíz, alverja y flor de gladiolo que tiene sembrado.
texts.en:
Celestino is 50 years old. He lives in his own house in the company of his wife Dominga and their two adolescent children who are studying. They live in familial harmony in their own house located in the rural community of Cumutay. He has made a living in agriculture since he was very young. He currently plants potatoes, peas, corn and gladiolas on his farm.

He really likes working in the fields because the entire family participates. Although he does recognize the work is sometimes sacrificed because he must tend all of the crops to make sure that they are not lost to pests or adverse climatic factors. In this way he feels that this dedication is validated during the harvest season because he reaps all of his crops and sells them in the wholesale market in his city at regular prices.

In addition to his agricultural work he also makes a living raising animals like cows, bulls, rams and pigs that he sells from time to time in the city’s markets. As an enterprising man, he plans to plant a larger quantity in the future. He also wants to buy more animals to continue selling them as he knows he will make a generous income. 

He belongs to the “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” comunal bank and this is his fifth loan with MFP. He is very appreciative of all of the people that make this loan possible. He also says that he is satisfied with performance of the communal bank because it is made up of very responsible people. Upon receiving this loan Celestino will invest in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers that he will spread among the corn, pea and gladiola plants that he has sown.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Masimba Group

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Ruth (in purple) from Masvingo, a town in south-eastern Zimbabwe. She is married with three children, all attending school. She also cares for three dependents. Ruth runs a retail cross-border business selling stoves, fridges, and clothing. The business has been in operation for 17 years. She says the main challenge faced is meeting market demand due to capital constraints. Ruth has requested a loan of $400 to buy fridges for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to take better care of her dependents and family members. In the future, Ruth plans to own a shop where she can sell her goods.

loans.use: to buy fridges for resale

loans.name: Guey Wod Dobalof 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Guey wod dobal of 1" est composé de cinq femmes toutes mariées.Leur principale activité durant l'hivernage est la culture du petit milet et de l'arachide. Contrairement aux hommes qui marchent des kilométres pour aller aux champs, leurs parcelles de culture sont juste situées à proximité des habitations.Elles partagent ainsi leur temps entrent les taches ménagères et les activités champetres.Toutefois, durant cette période, la seule activité génératrices de revenus est l'emouche ovine.Ainsi, les femmes participent fortement à la prise en charge des besoins de leurs familles et de leurs propres besoins.le chef du groupe (en rouge à droite),est mère de 8 enfants dont 5 fréquentent l'école primaire. Ces derniers l'accompagnent aux champs et l'aident  à engraisser ses moutons qui seront vendus à terme.Le groupe est membre de l'UIMCEC qui lui a octroyé 8 crédits.Les femmes sollicitent aujourd'hui un pret de   500 000F pour l'achat de 10 moutons  et d'aliment bétail. Leur ambition est d'arriver à pratiquer l'embouche bovine.
texts.en:
The "Guey wod dobal of 1" group is made up of 5 married women. Their main activity during the wintertime is the cultivation of millet and groundnuts. Unlike the fields the men work in, which are located several kilometers away, the women's plots of land are situated near the village. The women normally divide their time between doing household chores and working on their allotments. However, at present, the only available money-making activity is sheep fattening. The women therefore find themselves extremely busy taking care of their family's needs, as well as their own.
The group's leader (on the right of the picture, in red) is the mother of 8 children, 5 of whom go to primary school. Her school-age children also accompany her to the fields to help her to fatten the sheep, which will eventually be sold. The "Guey wod dobal of 1" group is a member of UIMCEC and has already been granted 8 loans. The women are now asking for a loan of 500000F with which to buy 10 sheep and some animal feed. Their goal is to successfully carry out sheep fattening.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and some animal feed.

loans.name: Labarhan's Group

texts.en:
Labarhan is the leader of this group.  She is 61 years old and married to a taxi driver.  Labarhan is a retiree and in order to earn money for her livelyhood she breeds cattle.  The family started cattle breeding activity in 1990 with an initial investment of 30,000 soms.  By reselling the cattle after fattening and selling the dairy products, Labarhan earns about 2,600 soms per month.  This profit made it possible to save money and build a house for her son.  With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a cow to increase the number of cattle.  In the near future, Labarhan plans to celebrate her younger son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Protacio

texts.en:
Protacio is married with four children. Protacio is 43 years old and lives in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Protacio sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, he earns 10,000.00 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 10,000.00 PHP to buy piglets.

Protacio has been a member of PMPC for one year.  n the future, Protacio hopes to become a supplier of pork meat in Jimenez town.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for his piggery.

loans.name: Chanvesna

texts.en:
Chanvesna (in the photo) is 30 years old and her husband, Sophal is 40 years old, have been married since 2001 and have two children-one son and one daughter. The family lives in a village along national road number two about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanvesna makes plastic souvenirs such as bracelets and sells them to an NGO, while her husband is a chef; he cooks for a restaurant in Phnom Penh. Chanvesna is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house and buy a motorbike for her brother to drive to work.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house and buy a motorbike for her brother to drive to work.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria, por la necesidad de mejorar en el negocio, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, el cual utilizara en la compra de una plancha para hacer pupusas, y compra de materiales de cocina, como aceite, condimentos, azúcar, para tener en la preparación de la venta.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo, pudo realizar la compra y mejorar en el negocio, su familia por el momento se encuentra bien y con deseos de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Gloria needs to improve her business and so decided to take out a new loan which she will use to buy a hotplate for making pupusas, and cooking supplies such as oil, seasonings and sugar, so that she can prepare her food for sale.

Gloria's previous loan helped her as she was able to make her purchase and improve her business.  Her family are currently well and she is keen to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a hotplate for making pupusas, oil, seasonings and sugar

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans). Mary has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week.  Mary sells her products at the market by means of retail. Mary has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through a night parking car park. The main business challenge(s) for Mary include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and to build rental rooms. Mary lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 30 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is  a single mother with two children. 
Angie has a vegetable vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase fertilizer to grow vegetables. Angie has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to grow vegetables

loans.name: Héctor Roque

texts.es: Héctor es socio del Banco Comunal Alondras, tiene 20 años, es soltero, es conductor de transporte urbano, esta en Finca hace 1 año, los créditos que saca de Finca lo invierte en  la compra de repuestos de su carro, agradece a Finca porque le ayuda en su negocio y además aprendió ahorrar, le gusta las capacitaciones. el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos. Su meta es comprarse otro carro y hacerlo trabajar.
texts.en: Héctor is a member of the “Alondras” (Larks) communal bank; he’s 20 years old, single and an urban transit driver.  He’s been in Finca for a year.  He invests Finca loans in spare parts for his car.  He thanks Finca because it helps him with his business and he also learned how to save; he likes the training.  The loan he’s asking for will be used to buy spare parts.  His goal is to buy another car and put it to work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 48-year-old Illiterate woman who has seven sons and daughters. The oldest son has already gotten married.

Being an illiterate woman has given her the urge to make sure that her sons and daughters finish their studies at school, and for that reason Maryam has now applied for a loan to pay her daughter Azhar's semester fees so she can continue her studies in nursing. 

Azhar who appears in the photo next to her mother, Maryam, is now in her second year and is hoping to work in a Jordanian hospital after graduating.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFONSI est composé de dix-sept personnes qui habitent le même quartier et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupement, du nom de Sidonie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sidonie est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Sidonie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Sidonie est mariée à un certain Joachim. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Sidonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de subvenir aux diverses charges de la famille, Sidonie exerce depuis une quinzaine d’années, la vente de poulets dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Sidonie vend de l’huile de palme. Sidonie s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sidonie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement FIFONSI, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Fifonsi group consists of seventeen people living in the same neighborhood. All lead income-generating activities, and for the first time the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, to raise the level of its business activities.

The representative of the group, named Sidonie, is raising her hand in the picture. Sidonie is 31 years old and lives in Benin.

Sidonie has not attended school. She is married to Joachim. The couple has three children; some attend school and all are their dependents. Sidonie lives together with her ​​husband and children, and the couple shares responsibility for all household expenses.

To deal with various family expenses over the past fifteen years, Sidonie has been selling chickens throughout the region. She also sells palm oil, and gets her supplies in the region.

Sidonie is seeking to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and income. Together with the other members of the Fifonsi group, she is now requesting a first credit loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy cans of vegetable oil and chickens

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca presidenta del Banco comunal “Edén” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Se dedica a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran la artesanía y la repostería. Ya que teje a crochet y pinta diversos artículos, actualmente se encuentra pintando nacimientos (pesebres para navidad). En cuanto al rubro de la repostería se dedica a preparar empanadas.
Ella además Trabaja cuidando un abuelita, algunos días a la semana y también prepara almuerzos, ya que tiene pensionistas. 
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras, principalmente donde los insumos que necesite se encuentren a bajo costo. 
Con el crédito comprará una máquina bordadora.
Sus metas son vivir de los ingresos generados por sus negocios.
Francisca vive sola, su anhelo es poder disfrutar de su casa, ya que por ahora la arrienda y su sueño es comprar una freidora para uno de sus negocios.
Comenta que está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Ya que ha podido incrementar sus ventas e ingresos. Por otro lado, las capacitaciones han sido también un gran aporte para el crecimiento de su negocio. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Francisca is president of the Edén Communal Bank from the city of Valparaíso.

She works in different fields, among which are handicrafts and pastry making.  As she crochets and paints different items, she is currently painting Nativity scenes for Christmas.  As far as the field of pastry making is concerned, she makes empanadas.

She also works taking care of her grandmother a few days a week and she makes prepared lunches because she has lodgers.

She buys her merchandise from different distributors, mainly where the supplies she needs can be found at the lowest price.

She will buy an embroidery machine with this loan.

Her goal is to live off of the income generated by her businesses.

Francisca lives alone and she wants to be able to enjoy her home, as at the moment she is renting.  Her dream is to buy a fryer for one of her businesses.

She tells us that she is very happy and thankful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has offered her to invest in her business, as she has been able to increase her sales and her income.  Furthermore, the training she has received has contributed greatly to her business' growth.

Valparaíso is located 120 km. northeast of Santiago.  It is the region's capital and it is also the seat of the country's legislative power.  It is the nation's biggest port and it offers a great variety of beautiful, picturesque places, such as the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Hilda Idalia

texts.es:
Hilda, vive con su esposo y una hija de 10 años de edad, ella instalo una tienda en su hogar para mantener una actividad económica, que le ayudara a generar ingresos para los gastos familiares, tiene 23 años de existir el negocio, la heredo de sus padres.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio: harina, pastas, aceite, boquitas, galletas, dulces, gaseosas, para incrementar el inventario y mejorar la atención que brinda a los clientes.
Ella quiere mejorar poco a poco el negocio, fortaleciéndolo con la inversión de este préstamo, para mejorar y darle vida por más tiempo.
texts.en:
Hilda lives with her husband and 10 year old daughter. She installed a store in her home in order to have a business that would help her generate income for household expenses. The business has been in existence for 23 years and she inherited it from her parents. 

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business: flour, pasta, oil, snacks, cookies, sweets and soft drinks in order to increase her inventory and improve service to her customers.

Hilda wants to expand her business little by little by first improving it with an investment from this loan so that she can infuse life into it to gain more time.

loans.use: to buy flour, pasta, oil, snacks, cookies, sweets and soft drinks.

loans.name: Munkhbat

texts.en:
Borrower Munkhbat is 38 years old married woman and lives with his family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. She has three children and all of them are attend high, secondary school. She supports her family by operating fast food with special help with her spouse and children. 

She is requesting a 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase food products to make fast food and to sell.

loans.use: to purchase food products in order to make meals and to sell

loans.name: Lhanghoi B Group

texts.en:
Nengboi is 40 years old married woman and is a mother to two children (a son and a daughter). She is the representative of the group “LHANGHOI B” and also the featured borrower with her hand raise in the picture. Her husband is a farmer.
Nengboi  has already taken loans from WSDS and she is very happy and thankful for their generosity  .She engage herself in selling second hand garments and with the profit she use it for family expenses and pay for her children educational fees. But the income she gets is not sufficient for her family.
Nengboi applies for the loan so that she could buy yarns for weaving traditional wrap around skirts and sell them. With the profit she wants to support her children and wants them to get the best education. She is looking forward for the loan with high hopes for her children.
Likewise the rest of the members are also engage in activities like piggery and weaving and are looking forward for the loan to start their respective income generating activities.

loans.use: to buy colorful and different textures of yarns for weaving traditional wrap around skirts.

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.en:
Rafiatou A. was born in Sokodé in 1970. She is married, the mother of five children, and the guardian of a girl who she employs in the home. Her business consists of selling fresh tomatoes in her neighborhood. Her household has known enough hardship, since her husband, who has no professional training, is farming under very hard conditions. Rafiatou herself must therefore work hard to meet the needs of her kids (food, education). This responsibility requires substantial funds, and so she is requesting financial support to grow her small business. Despite being illiterate, she has good management sense.

Mrs. A. is requesting a loan of $850 to buy up tomatoes where they are grown, in order to sell them in quantity. This will allow her to increase the size of her business and to clear a substantial profit and thus meet the demands now put upon her at home.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Rafiatou est née en 1970 à Sokodé. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle a une autre fille à sa charge qu’elle emploie comme domestique. Son activité consiste à vendre de la tomate fraîche dans son quartier. Son ménage connaît assez de difficultés car son mari qui n’a aucune formation professionnelle cultive la terre dans des conditions très pénibles. Rafiatou est alors obligée de travailler durement pour satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants (nourriture, scolarisation). Cette responsabilité demande des moyens importants et elle demande un appui financier pour augmenter son petit commerce. Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle a un bon sens de gestion.

Madame A. Rafiatou sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’approvisionner dans les localités de production de tomate et venir vendre en gros. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter la taille de son activité et dégager un revenu substantiel afin de faire face aux exigences qui se posent à elle désormais dans son foyer

loans.use: Buying and selling tomatoes

loans.name: Ondina

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Orlandina. My occupation is the selling of used clothing and the framing of photographs and paintings. I've been in this line of work for some years now. With the income I've been able to help cover family expenses. Thanks to this business we have improved our family income and achieved a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Orlandina, mi actividad principal es la venta de ropa usada y enmarcado de de fotografia y cuadros decorativos, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de activida, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, gracias a este negocio hemos mejorado nuestro ingreso familiar logrando asi un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: Buy American-style clothing and molding for picture framing.

loans.name: Ca

texts.en: The quilt group was set up in June, 2006, and Miss Ca is the leader of the group. The group has 21 members who used to be jobless, and who don’t have any land for cultivation. They gather to make the quilts by hand at Miss Ca’s house. They then sell them to Vietnam-Quilts (www.vietnam-quilts.org). Average income is $40 per member/month from the quilt making business, which has helped to improve their living situation. However, Miss Ca ‘s house is very small, with not enough place for the women to make quilts of a high quality, so Miss Ca wants to borrow a loan of $400 so that she can extend the production space. She will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Develop the quilt-making workshop.

loans.name: Clara Salvador

texts.pt:
Clara is married with 2 children. She joined FDM in October of 2006. With an initial loan of approx. 125 dollars, her business grew, and with the profits, she is purchasing conventional material for the construction of a house. She now asks for a loan of 575 dollars to invest in the purchase of clothing.

Translated from Portuguese by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Vive maritalmente, tem 2 filhos, entrou para o FDM em Outubro de 2006, com um emprestimo de 3.000mts, o seu negocio foi desenvolvendo e com os lucros esta a comprar material convencional para a construcao de uma casa. Tomou um emprestimo de 15.000mts, em 10/07/07.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of clothing

loans.name: Beatriz Fabião

texts.pt:
Beatriz Fabião M. M. is a 46-year-old married mother of 5 who lives in the George Dimitrov area of Maputo. She is a seamstress and runs her business out of her home. She entered the program in December of 2006 with an initial loan amount of 6,000 MT (meticais). She has paid back her previous loans and is now going into her third cycle for a loan of 10,000 MT to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz Fabião M. M. tem 46 anos de idade, é casada, mãe de 5 filhos e vive no bairro George Dimitrov em Maputo. É Costureira e tem o seu negócio na sua residência. Entrou para o programa em Dezembro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Comportou-se bem nos empréstimos anteriores e vai para om terceiro ciclo e pretende um empréstimo de 10.000MT para pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: "I will invest the fund into foodstuffs and honey business," says Joy O., who lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children. She has been in this business since 2007 and needs the loan of $400 to buy more foodstuff and honey for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and honey

loans.name: Bacharou

texts.fr:
Mr. Bacharou O. has been a livestock trader for the last 10 years. He is 42 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He buys livestock (poultry, goats, sheep etc…) in the surrounding villages and sells them to the butchers in his town. This business brings in a substantial income allowing him to provide for the needs of his family. This loan will allow him to increase his year end stock in order to cope with the needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mr Bacharou O. est commerçant de bétail depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est agé de 42 ans , marié et père de 2 enfants. Il achète les bêtes (volailles, chèvres , moutons etc..) dans les villages environnants et les revends au x bouchers de la localité . Cette activité lui procure un revenu substantiel qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de la famiille. Le présent emprunt lui permet d'augmenter son stock de fin d'année afin de faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 additional animals for resale

loans.name: Thu Hang

texts.vi:
Ms. Hằng, 35 year old, divorced, raises a daughter by herself. She is a seamstress. At evening, she makes extra living by selling barbecue chicken feet. She would like to borrow money for buying material. She’s never taken out a loan from Binh Minh and this is the first time. The repayment plan is convenient for her.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hằng, 35 tuổi, đã có chồng và 1 cô con gái. Tuy nhiên chị đã ly dị, hiện tại chị nuôi con một mình. Thu nhập hàng ngày của chị là làm may, tối chị lại bán chân gà nướng. Chị vay vốn về mua thêm vải may cho khách. Chị chưa tham gia vay vốn ở đây, tuy nhiên, lần này, chị lại tham gia vay vốn của chương trình tài chính Binh minh vì chị thấy nó rất thuận tiện trong việc hòan trả.

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Danelia

texts.es:
Daniela Ramirez is a woman business owner with her own convenience store located in the city the of León, specifically in the village of El Sauce.

For two years she has been earning her living in her own convenience store, a store she has stocked little by little with a growing variety of products over the years. Mrs. Ramirez currently faces the need to invest in the purchase of her products. Since she has few resources she wisely turns to Ceprodel for loans which allow her to improve her economic situation and move ahead toward fulfilling her dreams of being an important merchant in the village of El Sauce.

Mrs. Rosales also needs to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, juices and water. In order to fill all of these needs she has turned to Ceprodel. Ceprodel has not denied her requests but has provided her with loans she has been wise about investing in the purchase of her products and in savings for improvements to her home. Her credit record is 8 loans over a year and a half.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Danelia Ramirez es una dama poseedora de un negocio propio de pulpería ubicado en la ciudad de León específicamente en el pueblo de El Sauce.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a tener su propia pulpería la cual la ha venido surtiendo de productos poco a poco a medida que van transcurriendo los años. Una necesidad que atraviesa la señora R. es que necesita invertir en la compra de sus productos y además de ser de escasos recursos, muy sabiamente acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan mejorar su condición económica y así salir adelante para cumplir sus sueños de ser una gran comerciante en el pueblo de El Sauce.

Otra necesidad de la señora Rosales es que debe invertir en la compra de las gaseosas, jugos y agua. Para suplir todas estas necesidades ha recurrido a Ceprodel quien no le ha negado su petición sino que le ha otorgado créditos que los ha sabido invertir en la compra de sus productos y ahorro para la remodelación de su hogar. Su record crediticio es de 8 créditos desde hace un año y medio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Eourn

texts.en: Cambodia is mostly agricultural, and most Cambodians are farmers. Mrs. Eourn K. dedicates herself as a farmer in the Kandal province; she is 57 years old and she is married with a child who works in a garment factory, where she earns about $2 a day. Mrs. Eourn earns only $1.50 a day. Mr. Toch Chan, Eourn's husband, is a fisherman and makes an income of about $4 a day. She is now asking for a loan to hire a laborer to plow her rice field, and purchase more fertilizer to support the field.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the field and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Pann

texts.en:
Mrs. Pann M. is 57 years old and lives in Or Soursdey Village, Kompong Thom Province. M. sells groceries and earns about $2.33 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chan Samon, is 71 years old. He repairs motorcycles and bicycles, earning about $2.16 per day. They have five children, three of whom are married and two are single.

Because of the family's increasing expenses, M. sends one of her sons to work as a laborer outside the country and another one works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.

M. requests a loan of $700 to purchase grocery stock to sell, especially before Khmer New Year. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle. M. hopes this loan will help her support her family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock to sell and a motorcycle

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget A. is 35 years old; she lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 3 children. She learned to sell clothes from her sister and started selling clothes in 1994. She is requesting for a loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more clothes for sale. She has been a LAPO client for 8 years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sales

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel B. sells provisions. He is married, but his wife's income from selling fish is not sufficient for Samuel and his three children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase her profits.

He is asking for additional capital in order to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula is 53 years old. She wasn’t able to go to school. She married and lives with her husband. Together they own their own home, which is located in Chimbo center, in Cuturapi district in Yunguyo province. For 10 years Ursula has owned a small store where she sells sugar, gas, beer, soft drinks and sweets. She also sells cows and pigs in Chacachaca.

Ursula is a member of the Central Proreso Community Bank, where she had an initial loan of 300 soles (about US $105). She used the loan to pigs which since then have been sold. With this loan of 1,000 soles (about $375), which will be paid back in 4 months, Ursula plans to buy rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks and candies – this will increase the merchandise in her store.

Ursula has learned to make her payments responsibly and she is very thankful because her prior loan helped her expand her business and increase her income at the same time. Ursula’s biggest hope is for her children in Lima to do well, work hard and get ahead. She would like to buy more livestock, expand her business further and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Ursula tiene 53 años D. edad, no pudo estudiar, se casó y vive con su esposo, la casa que tienen es propia y se ubica en el centro poblado D. Chimbo, Distrito D. Cuturapi , provincia D. Yunguyo. Tiene una pequeña tienda donD. venD. azúcar, gas , cerveza, gaseosas, dulces, desD. hace 10 años. También se dedica a la venta D. vacas y chanchos, ganado que venD. en Chacachaca.

Pertenece al Banco Comunal " Central progreso" donD. tuvo un crédito inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que compró dos chanchos los cuales ya los vendió. Con este crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas y golosinas, incrementando D. esa manera su mercadería.

Ella aprendió es a ser responsable en sus pagos y está muy agradecida porque le ayudó a incrementar su negocio y a la vez sus ingresos económicos. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es que sus hijos que están en Lima, se encuentren bien, trabajen y salgan adelante. Le gustaría comprar mas ganado y incrementar su negocio y su ingreso económico.

loans.use: Purchase of various products

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura is a member of the Communal Bank of Azucenas.

Maura is 48 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. On Saturdays and Sundays Maura sells food in the fair of the Americas and her daughter usually helps her out. On Fridays, Maura travels to the fair where sells fruits, vegetables and she also buys cereals which subsequently she grinds and sells at the markets of Ayacucho. Maura uses her car to transport all of her merchandise. In addition to this commercial activities, Ms Maura also has plantations in the community of Santa Bárbara, where she harvest the products and then sells them to other merchants.

Maura needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in repairing her car and purchasing various vegetables and fruits.

Maura’s dreams are to offer her daughters a good education, expand her business and buy a newer car.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Maura es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Maura los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica en la feria de las Américas para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hija, actividad que realiza ambulatoriamente. Además Maura días viernes viaja a la feria de donde vende frutas, verduras y de las ferias compra cereales que posteriormente lo manda moler y lo vende en los mercados de Ayacucho, el transporte de su mercadería lo realiza con su carro, También Maura tiene sus plantaciones de tara, tuna, molle en la comunidad de Santa Bárbara de donde cosechas los productos y lo comercializa a los intermediarios.

Maura necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su carro y también en la compra de verduras variadas y frutas.

Los sueños de Maura es brindar una buena educación a sus hijas, ampliar su negocios y comprar un carro mas moderno.

loans.use: Maura needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in repairing her car and purchasing  various vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr:
Frigoriste de profession, monsieur M. Kokouvi est né le 31 décembre 1963 à Togblékopé dans la préfecture de Golfe. Il est marié et père de 6 enfants. Il exerce l’activité de vente de graviers depuis plus de 22 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter du gravier, le laver puis l’exposer pour la vente. Il est le premier à commencer cette activité dans sa localité et à plusieurs clients qui viennent de part et d’autres de la capitale. 
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 7 camions de gravier afin de procéder à son lavage pour pouvoir vendre et gagner beaucoup de bénéfice. Avec ce bénéfice il pourra supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Refrigerationist by profession, Mr. Kokouvi M. was born on December 31, 1963 in Togblékopé in the Gulf Prefecture. He is married and the father of 6 children. He has been selling gravel for more than 22 years. His business consists in buying gravel, washing it, then putting it up for sale. He was the first one to begin this business in his area so he has a lot of customers who come from his own locality and others from the capital.

This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy 7 truckloads of gravel that he will then wash and sell at a good profit. With this income he will be able to pay the school fees of his children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of gravel for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Men Phat's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten members in Prey Sak Village, Kampong Chhang Province form a village bank, whose president is Mrs. Men P.. She and her husband, Mr. Keo Koeurn, are farmers who grow rice on a hectare of land. They have a child who is attending the local school. Mrs. Men P.'s family currently live in poor housing conditions, but she cannot afford to build a new house. Hence, Mrs. Men P. is asking for a loan to build a new house to improve her family's living conditions.

All the members in the village bank loan have end-of-term loans and they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace S. is married and has 3 dependants. She has received no formal education. Grace sells yams to local consumers at Praso market in Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband works at the press. Grace uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and other utility bills. Grace will use the loan to purchase more yams for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to increase her capital base to enable her increase the quantity of yams she sells.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to purchase more yams for sale.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta D. is a resident of Brgy. Poblacion Norte, Sitio Igcaputol, Tobias, Fornier, Antique, and is married to Roberto D.. They were blessed with eight children, but only seven are still living. Antonieta, or nanay "Anto", currently has a small sari-sari store that augments her family's daily needs. With a small capital investment from ASHI, she managed to invest in her business in order not to be a problem for her loan group or for the center. 

Nanay “Anto” is the deputy center chief of her center. She is a very good member as well as a leader to her co-members. She is always willing to support the center chief for the goodness of the center. Nanay “Anto” is a very industrious woman because she does not want her past experiences to be experienced by her children or grandchildren. She came from a very poor family, and that is why she works hard to get out of poverty. She is also dedicated and determined to fulfill her responsibility as a member and as a resident of their Brgy. She performs very well so that, through ASHI, she can achieve all of her aspirations and dreams in life.

In the end, Nanay “Anto” will be a successful businesswoman if she has enough capital to be used in her small Sari-sari store. She believes that if she achieves her dreams, then she will help others to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: Variety Store

loans.name: Viviana Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” distrito, provincia  y departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 2 hijos estudiantes a los que mantiene económicamente. 

Con su primer préstamo de S/.300 compró materiales para confeccionar artesanías y compró artesanías para vender en su puesto de trabajo. Nos cuenta que vive en casa de sus padres junto con 6 personas de su familia.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más mercadería para vender en su puesto de artesanías.

Viviana desea seguir trabajando para apoyar a sus hijos y que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the “Víctor Echave” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 43 years old, single, and mother of two school-aged children who she supports economically. With the first loan for S/.300 she materials to make artisan products and she bought artisan products to sell in her stand. She tells us that she lives in her parents’ home along with 6 people from her family. With this loan for S/.1,200, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy more merchandise to sell in her artisan stand. Viviana wishes to continue working in order to support her children so that they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy artisan products

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean S. is 59 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She earns a living as a tailor, providing her service to neighbors, sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. From her business, she can earn an average of US$ 4 per day. She is a widow and the mother of two children. All are daughters and employed.  One daughter is working in Malaysia and the other daughter lives with her and makes her living growing potatoes to sale. S. is applying for a loan to add with her savings to purchase farm machinery. Her daughter will use the machine and also rent it to other farmers. This way she can earn extra income.

loans.use: To purchase farm machinery

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine M. is a single parent and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Josephine sells phone snap cards and also prepares food for sale at Akotobinsin near Elmina, which she started not too long ago. Josephine uses her income to pay for the child's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses . Josephine will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more phone credit cards and also ingredients for the food preparation in larger quantities for sale to her ever increasing costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine plans to reinvest back for the expansion of  her trade.

loans.use: Josephine will use the loan to increase her capital to buy more phone credit cards and also ingredients for the food preparation in larger quantities for sale to her ever increasing costumers.

loans.name: Mrs. Kunthea Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank group, which consists of twelve people, is located in Preaek Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kunthea H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate. She decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds for her plantation.  She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Seng Thuch, is a recycling collector who gathers wastes such as empty bottles, cans, plastics and so on to re-sell in a recycling factory. Mrs. Kunthea H. is 37 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Mr. Sophany L. did not attend the loan meeting but her husband did, so she is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her plantation.

loans.name: Avei

texts.en: Avei F., 23, is married with one child.  She has many years of experience in the homemade restaurant business. She sells to the villagers and public five days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Avei’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase ingredients and equipment needed to run and upgrade the standard of her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipment for her restaurant

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An. She is married and has three young children. To make a living, C. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, C. joined TYM Fund (a Kiva partner) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 2000000 VND, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Hilaria Sabina

texts.es: La señora Hilaria Sabina con residencia en el cantón Nimapa del departamento de Totonicapan ella cuenta con su pequeño taller en donde trabajan diez persona, en la elaboracion de playeras, mochilas,gorras otros. ellas las entrega directamente a los clientes en Guatemala, San Francisco el Alto, con el taller que lo ha tenido mas de quince años les ha permitido darle educacion a sus hijos y que los hijos se estan especializando para diseñar nuevos productos y estar en la moda del Joven. Con el credito que solicita le permitira comprar  materia prima.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilary Sabina is a resident of the canton Nimapa in the department of Totonicapan. She has a small workshop where ten people work, they manufacture shirts, backpacks, hats, and other things. They deliver the products directly to customers in Guatemala, San Francisco el Alto. The workshop she has had for more than 15 years has enabled her to provide education to her children. Her children are specializing in designing new products that are in fashion with youth. The loan requested will allow her to buy raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1974 à Sikasso ville, Monsieur  Drissa Traoré  réside avec son épouse dans la grande famille traditionnelle élargie  Wayerma II, un des populaires de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Drissa Traoré opta pour le commerce de vêtements et plus précisément de la friperie  apprise  auprès de son père qui est un vieux vendeur de la ville. Il mène cette activité depuis plus de trente  ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux  ans . Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Son prêt précédent a été remboursé par anticipation.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, un  ballon de maillot et un et demi (1 et ½) ballon de chaussettes. Les vêtements sont achetées sur place auprès des grossistes de la ville et revendus en détail au comptant et à crédit.à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1974 in Sikasso City, Mr. Drissa Traoré resides with his wife in a large traditional extended family in Wayerma II, a working-class district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He opted for commerce in clothing, more precisely in second-hand clothing, a business he learned from his father, who is an elderly vendor in the city. He has been in this business for over 30 years and is much in demand by his customers for the quality of his goods To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, Drissa decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. He is on his second individual loan. His preceding loan was repaid ahead of schedule. With this loan, he intends to buy a ball of jerseys and one and a half balls of shoes. The clothing is purchased locally from city wholesalers and is resold at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of women and men. With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment his working capital, to help with family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the town of Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old. Lilia is widowed and has four grown children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to put into savings as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: M. Zubaida is married and has two children. Her husband works as a baker. Zubaida began working seventeen years ago making dresses for women. Her mother sent her to an arts college and when she finished college she was given a sewing machine. From a very young age, she loved to sew. Therefore, Zubaida decided that she would continue with this line of work when she got older. Zubaida’s customers come to her because she provides both quality and low prices. She and her husband take turns going to wholesalers to purchase things like fabric, thread, and utensils. Zubaida is on her second loan with IMON International. Her first loan went well as she was able to invest in buttons and fabrics. She and her family appreciate your support in helping her to improve her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Khom Crech Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan which consists of sixteen people is located in Tranh village in Kandal province. Mrs. Khom C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members.

Mrs. Khom C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to produce rice on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to cultivate rice on her field. Her husband, Mr. Huot Phoeun, is a hardworking man. Mrs. Khom C. has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is a farmer who helps with his parents’ work. 

Ten members in this group loan are end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those having EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To finance the cultivation of rice on her field

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen A. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through senior high.

Stephen sells secondhand clothes in the central market of Hohoe, which he has done since 2004. He uses all his income solely to pay for the financial as well as the clothing needs of his children.

Stephen will use the loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Stephen plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Sara Isabel

texts.en:
Sara is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are 5 and 2 years-old. Her 5-year-old goes to public school and Sara still looks after her other son.

Sara studied in school until she was 15 but then left because she didn’t like it. She worked for five years in different shops selling different things. She became pregnant and stopped working but a year ago she decided to begin selling clothes to her neighbors. She has ten consistent clients.

Since joining FINCA Perú, Sara says that FINCA has been a great help by making it possible to invest in clothes to buy and teaching her how to save. Sara needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy clothes in bulk to sell. Her dream is to have a place in the market where she can sell clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Accroître la taille de son entreprise

loans.name: Gbatima Group

texts.en:
Sarah J. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Gbatima. She is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, aged between 9 and 17 years old and in 6th to 10th grade. Sarah dropped out of school at 5th grade due to poverty. She and her family live in Siaza town, Virginia, and sell in the Banjour Market, north of the Liberian capital, Monrovia.

Sarah buys food ingredients and sells them to the residents of Siaza town, Virginia. She has been running her business for five years and has been grateful to the business for helping her and her family. Sarah's difficulty is the competition at the market as there are many vendors selling the same goods as she does. However, she talks to her customers in a good manner, and this encourages them to buy from her.

Sarah is requesting a loan to buy more food ingredients, such as tins of oil, seasoning, pepper and bags of rice, to improve her business. She is hoping to establish a bigger shop in the future in order to make enough profit to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients such as tins of oil, seasoning, pepper and bags of rice

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan B. is the leader of her group in Kampala. She is 63 years old with 5 children.

Joan is a hard working lady with a 16-year-old crafts shop in Crafts Africa on Buganda Road, where she sells art and crafts. Her customers are mostly foreigners along with some community people. She caters to grandchildren and cousins as well. 

She needs a loan to buy more crafts, although she makes some of them herself. The loan will also help her to look after her home. 

Joan is grateful for her lending group because she is able to access loans through it and it teaches its members the disciplines of saving and teamwork.

loans.use: To buy more crafts to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Sarim Kong Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan consists of sixteen people who all live in Damnak Trayueng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarim K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Tuon Kha, is a farmer who owns a piece of land he uses to cultivate rice. Since Mrs. Sarim K.’s pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding, and would use the rest of loan to buy fertilizers to support the rice field. Mrs. Sarim K. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and to buy fertilizers to support the rice field

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 37-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Basel has operated a butcher shop since 1999. Basel is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase livestock for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. 

Basel is speciA. in his work because he runs a clean shop. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and he had experience in the area. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by having his own livestock.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his work.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim B. is married and has three children. He has received a high school education. Ibrahim sells secondhand clothes (used clothes) for men at Jukwa Market near Abura, which he has been doing for the past ten years. His wife is a trader. Ibrahim uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. Ibrahim will use the loan to purchase secondhand clothes for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ibrahim plans to invest in his children’s education and to build a house.

loans.use: Purchase secondhand clothes

loans.name: Mounirath

texts.fr: Z. Mounirath est née en 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mounirath vit depuis 8 ans environs à Hlacomey à Cotonou. Mariée à HOUESSOU Mondja, un couturier, Mounirath est mère de deux enfants. Seulement un enfant est scolarisé ; le second ne l’est pas encore. Mounirath vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Mounirath n’a pas été à l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Mounirath vend des pâtes dentifrices de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Mounirath s’approvisionne. Mounirath exerce cette activité depuis environs 6 ans. Mounirath a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Mounirath sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mounirath Z. was born in 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living for approximately eight years in the neighborhood of Hlacomey in Cotonou. She is married to Mondja Houessou, a tailor, and is the mother of two children. Only one of them attends school, while the other is still too young. Mounirath lives with her children and her husband. The couple provides together for the family. Mounirath did not attend school.

Mounirath hawks toothpaste to make a living for herself and her children. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for about six years. She got once a loan from Alidé and repaid it on schedule. She came now to Alidé and applied for a second loan to boost her activity level and better meet the demand from her customers.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toothpaste

loans.name: Ivy Aura

texts.en:
Ivy Aura C. is from the village of PANDUMA, TUKURAN ZAMBOANGA DEL SUR. She is 24 years old. Ivy Aura is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ivy Aura owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling shampoo, candies,some snacks, toothpaste, soap (bath and laundry), sugar, etc., in the local community. Ivy Aura has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ivy Aura joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivy Aura is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Ivy Aura from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria T. is from the village of Mambajao , Camiguin province. She is 49 years old. Victoria is married and has five adult children. Victoria owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Victoria has successfully repaid her first loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Victoria is requesting a second loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen Y. is from the city of San Antonio, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from operating motor transport services. Helen has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to repair the existing vehicle to improve service. This loan will be the 14th loan Helen has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the existing vehicle to improve services

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es:
la sra. Yecenia G. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el barrio Santa Lucia frente a la Iglesia Casa Pastoral, Alauca El Paraiso. 
Yecenia se dedica a la venta de carne de res y cerdo, tiene su negocio hace varios años.
en estos momentos necesita el credito para comprar mas carne al por mayor para tener bajos costos de compra y mayores ganancias.
Yecenia dice sentirse muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo cada dia que pasa, las carnes son muy vendidas en esta zona, sus mayores dias de ventas son los fines de semana.
con este credito saldra adelante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Yecenia G. is 37 years old, she lives in the neighborhood of Santa Lucia.Yecenia sells red meat and pork, she has had her business for several years. She currently needs this loan to buy more meat wholesale to have lower purchasing costs and higher earnings. Yecenia says that she feels very happy because her business is growing with every day that passes, the meats sell well in this area. Her best days for sales are the weekends. With this loan she will get ahead with her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy red meat and pork

loans.name: Mrs. Noav Peang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for ten people who live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Noav P. is the village bank president, and was selected by all the members of the team.  They will each use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Noav P. and her husband, Mr. Vanney Toem, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for selling to support their family living. Although they try to work hard in their field, they do not earn enough income. Thus, in order to improve the living conditions for their family, Mrs. Sopha Koem has decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding to start a new business. This couple has two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the other is enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 36 years old and is married with one child who is 6 years old. Beatha is known in the business of selling new clothes, mainly clothes for children. She has been in this business for about twelve years and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Beatha is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through adding a variety of styles such as men’s and women’s clothes. With this loan she has a vision of purchasing large bales for wholesaling and retailing at the same time so that her revenue can be much increased.

If successful, Beatha hopes to continue building a secure future for her family and, additionally, she will help the people from her community by creating jobs for them.

loans.use: To add a variety of styles such as men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina A. started her vegetable buying and selling business in 2005.  That same year she joined ASHI in order to receive a loan to finance the growth of her business.  For a number of consecutive years she has received loans from Kiva partner ASHI and she is again requesting a loan in order to be able to increase the volume and turnover of her sales. She works hard and invests emotionally and financially in her business in order to make it successful. Despite the failures and challenges she has encountered, she has never thought of giving up her dreams and has become strong instead in order to continue her fight against poverty. Through the support of her loving husband who died several years ago, her business has grown and she now has larger profits which she uses to support her two children, aged 14 and 19 years old. 

Catalina tries to save some money out of her profits because she plans to purchase a motorcycle for a transportation business which will be managed by her eldest son who did not want to pursue his education in college. He will then have his own source of income and will not just depend on her. Along with that aspiration, she also wants to support the education of her youngest child until she graduates from college and has her own career.

loans.use: To purchase bulk volumes of vegetables.

loans.name: Kamaamia Ole

texts.en:
Kamaamia Ole P. is 26 years old and married to Noonku P.. He is a father of two school-aged children.
Kamaamia is a wheat farmer and has his own piece of land. He has been in this business for the last two years. He learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be Kamaamia's second loan.
