He is planning to farm ten acres of wheat, which does very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make with this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat output. His future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land where he can be plant wheat on a large scale and attain financial independence.
Kamaamia believes he is hardworking and, having the right resources at his disposal, can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for the wheat that is already planted

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza produce salteñas (turnovers) hechas con carne de vaca y con carne de pollo y las vende; su esposo es transportista, de esta manera consiguen sus  ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, zona villa Tunari.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de insumos, como ser carne de vaca y de pollo, papa, harina, huevos, etc., para la elaboración de salteñas.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, pero dado el carácter social del mismo y el análisis financiero, Esperanza tiene la oportunidad de aplicar para dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Esperanza produces “salteñas” (turnovers) made of beef and chicken and sells them. Her husband works as a carrier, so both of their incomes are used to cover their family’s expenses. Their home is located in the city of El Alto, Villa Tunari District.

This loan will be used to buy supplies such as beef, chicken, potatoes, flour, eggs, and other items used for making turnovers. Esperanza is requesting her first loan from IMPRO. Given her social character and the financial analysis, she is eligible to apply for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making turnovers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary J. is 25 years old and is married.  Her husband is a driver. They have one child who  does not yet go to school. Mary is currently in the business of selling fish and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and bags of onions to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to build a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil and bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra A. is a 48-year old, married, and supports her family by operating 3 business ventures. She is a Avon Franchise Dealer,  a Natasha Dealer and has a Fuller Life businesses.  She lives in , Brgy. Guiwang, Alcoy, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Avon Franchise Dealer , Natasha Dealer and Fuller Life businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average income of Php10,000. 

Alejandra is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she could directly purchase Avon products.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of Php16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Alejandra aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her three businesses

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: En 2000 cette femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de  produits d’alimentation générale, elle s’approvisionne dans les divers marchés locaux de Lomé, son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire toute sa clientèle, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  3 cartons de beurre, 6 cartons de sardine, 6 cartons de lait PEAK, 4 sacs de riz, 6 cartons de tomates et 6 cartons de savons BF. Elle a déjà obtenu chez WAGES un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Elle est Mariée et a une personne à sa charge
texts.en:
In 2000 this woman started a grocery business. She buys her stock in various neighborhood markets in Lome, but not in enough quantity to keep up with customer demand. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy three packages of butter, six packages of sardines, six packages of Peak milk, four bags of rice, six packages of tomatoes and six of BF soaps. She has fully repaid one previous loan from WAGES. She is married and has one dependent.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: María Felícita

texts.es:
María Felicita es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Cultambo del distrito de San José, una zona eminentemente agrícola situada en la provincia de Pacasmayo, región La Libertad, ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su domicilio, ella adquiere su mercadería en la capital de su región (la ciudad de Trujillo) y la ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos, para asegurarse la demanda de sus clientes también trabaja en base a pedidos. Este negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ya que los ingresos que percibe como obrero no son suficientes para mantenerlos.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas mercadería para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan sacar a su familia adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ella ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir adelante con su negocio para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y respetada.
texts.en:
María Felicita is 32 years old and the mother. She lives with her family in the Cutambo sector, within the San Jose district. Cutambo is mainly an agricultural zone, situated within the Pacasmayo province, in the La Libertad region, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells men’s and women’s clothing in a small shop located within her home. She buys her merchandise in the region’s capital (city of Trujillo) and offers it for sale to her neighbors and acquaintances. In order to ensure that she meets her customers’ needs, she also takes orders. This business allows her to help her husband with the family expenses, because the money he earns as a laborer is not enough to sustain them. María wants to expand her business by buying more merchandise to increase her sales and her income. This will permit her to move her family ahead. In order to meet her objective, she has seen fit to request her first loan of 700 PEN ($250) through Edpyme Alternativa. She is a very hard working and responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to move ahead with her business in order to improve her family’s quality of life. She is very well known and respected within her zone.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

location.town: Cultambo - San José - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Paula Lorgia

texts.es: La  Sra. Paula Lorgia P. P.    ella es comerciante se dedica al negocio  de abarrotes ella tiene veinte y cuatros  años de dedicarse a ese negocio, Ha tenido  trece créditos con CEPRODEL y todos los ha realizado para ampliar y mejorar su negocio  en mercadería
texts.en:
Paula is a merchant who sells groceries. She has dedicated herself to her business for 24 years. Paula has had 13 loans with CEPRODEL and all were used to expand and improve her merchandising business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de granos basicos

loans.name: Sam Aul's Group

texts.en:
A group of four people in Andoung Kien village of Takeo province has selected Mrs. Sam Aul L. as their leader. The group members will use their portion of the loan to support their respective businesses. 

Mrs. Sam Aul L. is a tailor in the local village, and she earns enough money to support her family. She wants to expand her tailoring business, which is going on well. So to improve her business, Mrs. Sam Aul L. is seeking a loan to buy fabric to design clothes for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Nang Be, is a motor bicycle repairman, and is also a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice for sale to support his family. The couple does not have a child.

loans.use: To buy fabric to design clothes for her customers

loans.name: Nsasa Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
L. Derrick, 62, began his dairy farming business in Nsasa-Mukono with much motivation plus help from friends and family. This smile-up-his-sleeve gentleman has a sparky sense of humor, which has struck a chord with many of his customers. His milk is in high favor with many people in his locality
Derrick belongs to Nsasa development group in Mukono. He is a happily married man with nine children. Only one of his children is in school as the majority of his children have chosen to follow him into business. Derrick makes as much as 49,000 UGX per week. With this loan he is anticipating buying cattle feed. He was a government employee before venturing into business, and is a very hardworking and determined man.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle feed

loans.name: Marito

texts.en:
Marito T. is from the village of Sabangan, Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 57 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Marito provides motorela or habal-habal transportation services to local community members. He is just starting this business.

In 2006, Marito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase materials needed to provide service and is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Marito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the his business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Bat-Erdene B. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, 20, is a university student while his youngest son, 15, attends a local high school. His wife sells farm supplies for livestock in the central city of province. Bat-Erdene operates a timber trading business in his town. He started his business in 2004 with 1,500,000 MNT of working capital which was used to purchase a vehicle. Over years of operation, he has built a stable and successful operation and his working capital has grown to 4,000,000 MNT. He purchases his timber from Bulgan province and sells it back to the local town for profit. He has gained much experience and also has a wide range of customer both in Arhangai and Bayanhongor provinces. He is a modest and hardworking man. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy more timber and logs in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To buy more timber and logs

loans.name: Rosas De San Jose Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “ROSAS DE SAN JOSÉ” está iniciando su primer ciclo, en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes, todas mujeres.  Las señoras  se reunirán cada dos semanas, eligieron cancelar el crédito en diez cuotas, es decir aproximadamente cinco meses.  Las socias consideran que durante este tiempo tendrán la oportunidad de conocerse mejor.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta,  una tesorera y una secretaria de actas.

La señora  Reveca es una mujer joven de 26 años de edad, soltera, asumió el cargo de presidenta con la convicción de que su trabajo será eficiente, su asociación la considera una persona responsable y con el carácter que se requiere para un cargo de este tipo.
Con respecto a su negocio, ella confecciona deportivos y chamarras, realiza sus ventas en su mismo domicilio.  Está en este negocio desde hace seis años, por lo que se la observa segura y con deseos de mejorar.  Este primer crédito fue de Bs 1000.-, este dinero está destinado para la compra de materia prima.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, tenemos: tienda surtida, inicio en costura, confección de deportivos, bordado de enaguas, tienda y carnicería, carpintería,   y venta de comida.
texts.en:
The communal association “ROSAS DE SAN JOSÉ”  is beginning their first loan cycle with the Centro Focal de Los Andes.  The group is composed of 10 ten members, all women.  The ladies meet every other week.  They chose to pay off the loan in ten payments; that is to say, approximately five months.  The associates consider that during this time they will have a better opportunity to be known.  The managing board is composed of the president, a treasurer and a secretary of minutes.  

Señorita Reveca, a 26-year-old, single young woman, is assuming the job of president with the conviction that her work will be efficient.  Her association considers her a responsible person with the character that is required for a charge of this type.  With regard to her business, she makes sportswear and jackets.  She carries out her sales in her residence.  She has been in this business for six years, for which she has become secure with desires to improve.  This first credit is for 1000 Bs (native currency)  This money is destined for the purchase of material for making sportswear and jackets.  

With regard to the business that the remainder of members of the association pursue, these include a supply store, a dressmaking shop, making sportswear, embroidering petticoats, a butcher shop, a carpentry shop and a grocery store.

loans.use: Cloth

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 


Marilu tiene 35 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tienen dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena, piedra chancada y yeso. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Marilu es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que saca a delante a su familia. Con su próximo préstamo, Marilu que espera recibir $ 800 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va 
 

Marilu se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the Communal Bank “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United), which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She lives in the same city. Cusco is a charming city that dates back to the times of the Incas and served as a base for the ancient Incan empire.

Marilu is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Her business involves selling construction materials such as sand, gravel, and plaster. She has been in business for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Marilu is a hardworking and responsible woman who wants to move her family forward. With her next loan, she hopes to receive $800 USD to expand her business and purchase construction materials such as blocks, bricks, sand, gravel, and other products.

Marilu is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase blocks, bricks, sand, gravel, and other products to sell

loans.name: Las Amigas Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Las Amigas Luchadoras esta formado por tres mujeres vecinas de la ciudad de Nacaome, se conocen muy bien. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
 
la señora Zonia Elizabeth M. P. vive en union libre con el señor Policarpo Moreno Cruz y se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda en donde vende telas, ropa de hombre y de mujer, utensilios de cocina, ventiladores, perfumes entre otra variedad de articulos de uso personal y para el hogar.
su negocio tiene el nombre de bodeguita LA GANGA.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
 
la señora Lidia Ester C. C. esta casada y se dedica a la venta de refrescos y jugos al por mayor, tiene un deposito de refrescos.
tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año y medio y tiene de vivir en esta ciudad hace 5 años. 
Su esposo vive y trabaja en los estados unidos y le manda remesas mensuales para apoyarla con los gastos de su familia.
Lidia utilizara el credito para la compra de refrescos y jugos al por mayor.

la señora Luz Estela M. D. esta casada y tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, perfumes, tintes, carteras, sandalias, zapatos, mochilas escolares etc. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio y  de vivir en Nacaome 12 años.
texts.en:
The 'Las Amigas Luchadoras' communal bank is made up of three neighbors from the town of Nacaome who know each other very well.  Below we detail the different business activities that they carry out:

Mrs Zonia Elizabeth M. P. lives with her common-law husband Policarpo Moreno Cruz.  She has a store where she sells fabric, men's and women's clothes, cooking utensils, fans, perfumes and a variety of other personal use products and articles for the home.  Her business is called “La Ganga” (The Bargain).  She will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.

Mrs Lidia Ester C. C. is married and sells soft drinks and juice wholesale.  She has a soft drink warehouse.  She has had her business for one and a half years and she has lived in the city for 5 years.  Her husband lives and works in the United States and sends her monthly remittances to support her with family expenses.  Lidia will use her loan to buy soft drinks and juice whole sale.

Mrs Luz Estela M. D. is married and has 2 children.  She sells new clothes, perfumes, dyes, purses, sandals, shoes, school backpacks, etc.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  She has been in this business for 3 years and has lived in Nacaome for 12 years.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juice, clothes, perfumes, fabrics, articles for the home, fans, purses, sandals and backpacks

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Christine has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Christine hopes to study tailoring.   Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her computer skills.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La Sra. Liz G. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, compañia Tajy Loma, ubicada a unos 7  Km. de la ciudad, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres.
Se dedica al comercio (venta ambulante) hace más de 2 años, pues, en su casa tejen frazadas y colchas y ella aprovecha para comercializarlas. 
Actualmente cuenta con negocio propio y  realiza sus ventas por la zona de la gran Asunción. Cabe destacar que tiene un hermano mayor de edad quien es a la vez su compañero de trabajo. 
Cuenta con más de 60 clientes.
El préstamo le sirve para comprar mayor cantidad de hilos y facilitar a sus familiares para la producción y así le resulta disminuir su costo de mercaderías. También compra Sábanas, Colchas, Hamacas para colocarlas. Ella sueña con tener su propia casa y la única manera de lograr es aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Liz G. lives in the Tajy Loma residential development of Carapeguá, some 7km from the city.    She is 21 years old and lives with her parents.

Liz works as an itinerant street vendor.  She has been doing this for more than two years.  In her home she also knits blankets and bedspreads which she sells.

She currently has her own business and makes her sales in the Gran Asunción area.  We should point out that she has an older brother who works with her.  Liz has more than 60 customers.

This loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of threads to give to her family members so that they can help with production.  This will reduce the cost of her merchandise.  Liz also buys sheets, bedspreads and hammocks to sell.  She dreams of owning her own home and the only way to achieve this is to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (sheets, bedspreads, hammocks, blankets and footwear)

loans.name: Faifua

texts.en:
Faifua L. is 37 and married with four children between two and 15. She has had a business selling baked goods for the past three years and  needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked goods for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business —estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week — to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Faifua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faifua's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a widow taking care of three children. She has been through senior high school.  Grace has been cooking food for sale at Abura for some time using her income for the well-being of her family and home. She will use the loan to purchase food items to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to build a cafeteria.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles R. is 23 years old and married with one child. He is a farmer from Rukungiri. He has a farm in Mabungo where for the past seven years he has been growing bananas to sell in Mabungo’s trade center. He is also involved in the sale of coffee and has a bar where he sells beers and soft drinks. He attributes his monthly income of 200,000 UGX to hard work and commitment.

Charles needs a loan to buy fertilizer for his plantation to increase output.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his plantation

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita D. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 55 years old. Erlita is widowed and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Erlita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like rice cakes, fruit salad, cheese cakes, cassava cakes in the local community. Erlita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Erlita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients, like flour and eggs, needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients, like flour and eggs, needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tents, crockery, and table covers for catering business

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 10 hijos (1 independiente), la señora realizo estudios de educación primaria incompleto. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo utilizó en su negocio de venta de tejidos y cierres.
En la actualidad requerirá de un nuevo préstamo por la suma S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de tres sacos de cierres de todo tamaño para prendas de vestir (casacas), telas, cinco aguayos y llicllas (telares), para luego venderlos.  La señora trabaja sola, su esposos es veterinario.
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  son las ganancias del ahorro.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Lujan” which is located in the District of Tinicachi, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno. She is 51 years old, in a common law marriage, and has ten children (one of whom is independent). Sra. Felicitas was not able to complete her elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for seven years. Her first loan of 300 PEN was used for her business of selling fabrics and zippers. At the moment, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 3000 PEN to invest in the purchase three bags of zippers of all sizes for making jackets. She will also buy fabrics, five multi-colored cloths, and shawls for eventual resale. Felicitas works alone and her husband is a veterinarian by profession. Her dream is to have more capital to improve her business. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank is the interest she earns from her savings.

loans.use: To purchase three bags of zippers, fabrics, five multi-colored cloths, and shawls for resale.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Efrain M. vive en la zona de Viloma localidad ubicada en Sipe-Sipe a 25 Km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, se encuentra casado pero aun o tiene hijos.

EL señor Efrain tiene multiples actividades agricolas, siembra maiz, flores, alfalfa y otros, tambien tiene un criadero de chancchos, pero en particular se esta dedicando al criar conejos, esto gracias a una aayuda que estan recibiendo donde ellos deben tener mas de 60 conejos y el proyecto les ayudara en la construccion de los criaderos pero deben cancelar una contraparte, para poder cancelar esta contraparte el señor Efrain y muchos comunarios solicitan el credito

El señor Efrain tiene 2 años de experiencia en la cria y venta de conejos, estos se reproducen casi cada 2 meses, tiempo que es adecuado para poderlos vender. En cuanto al mercado para este producto los entregan directamente a una granja que se encarga de distribuirlos a toda la ciudad de Cochabamba, si bien no es un producto muy comercial, si tiene buen mercado.
texts.en:
Efrain M. lives in the Viloma zone of Sipe-Sipe, located 25 Km. from the city of Cochabamba.  He is married, but does not yet have any children.

Efrain undertakes multiple agricultural activities, such as planting corn, flowers, alfalfa, and other items.   He also raises pigs, but is particularly dedicating himself to raising rabbits.  He is doing this thanks to some help he is receiving where he must have more than 60 rabbits, and the project will then assist him in building rabbit pens.  However, they must cancel an opposing party’s credit, and to do this, Efrain and other members of the cooperative bank are seeking a loan.

Efrain has 2 years of experience in raising and selling rabbits, which reproduce almost every 2 months, a period of time that is adequate to be able to sell them.  As far as the market for this product, they deliver them directly to a farm that distributes them throughout the entire city of Cochabamba.  Therefore, although it’s not a very commercial type of product, there is a good market for it.

loans.use: to build pens for rabbits that he is raising.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K., 36 years old, is married and the mother of three children aged between 4 and 16 years old. She is a business lady operating a retail shop, which she has been doing for the last five years. 

She learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This marks her first loan, which she is planning to use to expand her business. Her retail shop is situated on a strategic point in the town and she hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business. 

Her hopes and dream is to become a great business lady. She is an energetic woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying sugar, rice and beverages

loans.name: Apollo Benjamin

texts.en:
G. Apollo Benjamin is an individual client from Jinja. He is 58 years old and married with 5 children.

Apollo has a modern digital studio on Iganga Road, Jinja where by he develops and prints photos as well as sells photo frames and film. He has been in the business for 5 years and is able to generate 120,000 daily. He started this business after retiring from employment with the electricity company and is very happy about the move he made. His dream is to be able to expand his photography business. As a client of Pearl, he hopes to buy photography materials like film and frames for the business.

loans.use: To buy photography materials like film and picture frames for his studio.

loans.name: Abigail Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Abigail decidieron ponerle así porque así se llama la hija de una de las integrantes del grupo y porque les pareció un bonito nombre. Este grupo esta integrado por 10 personas de la cuales la mayoría tiene un negocio y 3 personas piensan iniciar un negocio para apoyar  a sus familias. A continuación mencionare a las personas que integran este grupo: Isaac (Venta de antojitos), Adelina e Ivett (Venta de calzado), Yanet, Guadalupe y Marcelina (Venta de ropa), Guadalupe y Minerva (Venta de cosméticos), Andrés (Venta de abarrotes), Yolanda (Venta de ropa típica).

Yolanda es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella una joven soltera que se dedica al bordado y tejido, realiza blusas, fundas para botellas, servilletas, cinturones, entre otros.
Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar hilos de estambre de diferentes colores, hilos de seda de diferentes colores ya que es la herramienta principal para elaborar sus productos y como en esta ocasión tiene un pedido que entregar y le hace falta dinero para comprar algunos materiales. Ella tiene 4 años con este negocio, sus productos los ofrece con sus amistades y familiares  y solo cuando le hacen un pedido para una boda, bautizo, primera comunión, cumpleaños o quince años ella vende sus productos ya que es cuando mas le encargan mercancía.

Para ella este negocio es muy importante ya que con el puede solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres.
Yolanda esta muy contenta con este préstamo porque con ello va a poder realizar sus productos para realizar su pedido y con ello podrá obtener ganancias.
Su meta es engrandecer su negocio y aprender a realizar otras cosas nuevas para así tener variedad en sus productos.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Abigail and they decided on this name because that is the name of a daughter of one of the members of the group and because they thought the name was pretty. this group is made up of 10 individuals. The majority have their own business and 3 are thinking about starting a business to support their families. Here we will list the members of the group: 

Isaac: fast food sales
Adelina and Ivett: shoe sales
Yanet, Guadalupe, and Marcelina: clothing sales
Guadalupe and Minerva: cosmetics sales
Andres: grocery store
Yolanda: traditional clothing

Yolanda is a member of the group. She is a young, single woman who embroiders and knits blouses, bottle covers, napkins, belts, and other items. 

She requests a loan to purchase yarn in various colors an silk threads of different colors. This is the material that she uses to make her products. At this time she has an order but she doesn't have the money to purchase some materials. She has 4 years in the business, selling her products to her friends and family. She only sells for special occasions, such as weddings, baptisms, first communions, birthdays, and sweet sixteen parties. She sells her products then because that is when the orders are the largest.

This business is very important because through it she is able to cover her personal expenses and to help her parents. 

Yolanda is very happy with this loan because with it she will be able to purchase the products she needs to fill her order, and to earn her pay.

Her goal is to expand her business and to learn to make new things to add variety to her products.

loans.use: to purchase colored threads and fabrics to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Abel de 48 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El negocio de Tania es la costura, su trabajo es muy solicitado en su barrio, ya que es la única que realiza esta actividad. Ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y ahora tiene su propio taller, donde atiende con mucha paciencia a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es terminar los trabajos que le encargan, lleva 3 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que trabajar todo el día cuando tiene un pedido muy grande y es que ella es muy responsable y sabe que cualquier tardanza podría afectar su reputación. Espera que su negocio sea más conocido y así pueda crecer más, para esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro y sin descanso. Por tal espera de su apoyo para que le ayuden a crecer en su negocio. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, y por tal se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Además no quiere causar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y apreciada. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará una maquina remalladora nueva, de esta manera espera incrementar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Tania is 34 years old.  She is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 48 year-old Abel, and her three beloved children who she would like to provide with a better future.

Tania has a sewing business.  Her work is very much in demand in her neighborhood since she is the only person who is engaged in this business.  She learned the trade at a very young age from her mother and now has her own workshop where she serves her customers with a lot of patience.  What she most enjoys about her business is finishing off the jobs that people have placed with her.  She has been in this business for three years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to work all day long when she has very large orders.  However, Tania is a very responsible woman and she knows that any delay could damage her reputation.  She hopes that her business will become more well known and that it will therefore be able to grow more.  She is prepared to work very hard and without rest in order to achieve this.  She hopes she can count on your support to help her grow in her business.

This will be Tania's sixth loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She doesn't want to cause problems for the members of her community bank where she is a very well-liked and valued member.  Tania will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy a new overlock sewing machine (serger).  In this way, she hopes to increase her production and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine (serger)

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en: Luyen was born in 1972. She is married and has two children, a daughter and a son. She lives in Dai Bi village. Her husband is a builder. Ms. Luyen is a farmer. Not only does she grow rice, but she also raises fish and chickens. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2004. The last cycL., she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for her fish and chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for her fish and chickens

loans.name: Servando

texts.en: Servando, 40 years old, is married and lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has 6 children. His oldest child is 21 years old while his youngest is 12. He is a fisherman and has been working in this business for 20 years. His average income is PHP 5,000 per month. Servando is requesting a loan to support his family's livelihood. The loan will help him buy fishnets and baits. In the future, Servando hopes to send his children to college. He believes also that through God’s provision, he will be able to raise his family well.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and bait

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha es una emprendedora que desde hace 4 años tiene su propio negocio donde le ofrece a su comunidad productos de la canasta familiar y otros productos, trabaja en su tienda de lunes a viernes de 7:00 a.m. a 10:00 p.m. y los fines de semana hasta las 2:00 de la madrugada ya que es un buen horario para realizar ventas de licor y otros productos. 

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la des sus 2 hijos, y para ello sabe que debe procurar tener una microempresa que le agrade a sus clientes y al resto de la comunidad, por lo que se preocupa por brindar un buen servicio y tener los productos necesarios que hacen parte de la canasta familiar y por este motivo es que hoy en día Marta solicita un préstamo con el cual puedo comprar el surtido de contado y obtener un descuento generoso que le genere mas utilidades a sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marta is an entrepreneur who has been in business for four years.  She has a grocery store and offers her community products required for daily consumption and other items.  Her store is open from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and on weekends until 2:00 a.m., which is a good time to sell liquor and other products.

Her greatest goal is to improve her two children's lifestyle and her own.  In order to do this she knows she must have a small business that is popular with her customers and the rest of the community.  She makes an effort to provide the best service possible and have on hand the necessary products for daily consumption.  Martha is requesting a loan to buy a variety of products in cash and obtain a significant discount so her profits will increase.

loans.use: To buy varied products for her store.

loans.name: Djromahuton 14 Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON 14 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amis et qui appartiennent à une même association d'artisans au Bénin. Le représentant du groupe, Yves Magloire (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est marié à une couturière du nom de Bernadette. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et un autre enfant à charge. Yves Magloire et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges du ménage. Yves Magloire a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Yves Magloire est un brodeur qui a son atelier installé dans une ville du Bénin. Il y a près de treize ans que Yves Magloire exerce cette activité, qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. La clientèle de Yves Magloire s'agrandit de plus en plus, et Yves Magloire a besoin d'une autre machine qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à leur demande dans un bref délai. Pour ce faire, Yves Magloire sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe DJROMAHUTON 14, un premier crédit. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The Djromahuton 14 group comprises three people who are friends and belong to the same craftsman association in Benin. The group representative, Yves Magloire (with the raised hand in the photo), is 40 years old and married to a seamstress named Bernadette. The couple have three children, all of whom are in school, and an additional child in their care. Yves Magloire and his wife live together with their children and provide for the family together. Yves Magloire ended his studies at the secondary level. He is an embroiderer and has established his own workshop in a city in Benin. For close to 13 years, he has run this business, which provides him with an income to help meet his needs and those of his family. His clientele is steadily increasing, and Yves Magloire needs another machine that will allow him to better respond to their demands quickly. To do this, he is seeking a first loan along with the other members of his Djromahuton 14 group. This loan will allow them to better respond to the demands of their customers and generate higher profits.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with a 20-year-old child. She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. Josefina and her husband are farmers who cultivate land where they grow rice, corn, and pineapples. She also manages their sari-sari (retail) business. Josefina does her best to improve their businesses and support her family.

Josefina is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, seed and other farm inputs. She hopes that their businesses will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, and farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saidou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un enseignant qui a démarré sa carrière il y'a 34 ans.Il a servi dans cinq régions du pays et est aujourd'hui directeur de l'école primaire de sa localité.Il est marié et père de sept enfants. Ne pouvant plus supporter les dépenses de location, il a entamé la contruction de sa maison.Il sollicite un pret de 500 000F pour l'achat de ciment, de matériel électrique et de paiement de la main d'oeuvre.Son ambition est de terminer sa maison et d'encadrer ses enfants.
texts.en: This borrower is a teacher who began his career 34 years ago. He has served in five different regions of the country and now is the principal of the primary school in his locality. He is married and the father of seven children. Being unable to continue putting up with the expense of renting, he began building a house. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 500,000 francs to buy cement, electrical goods, and pay for labor. His ambition is to finish his house and settle his children there.

loans.use: to buy cement, electrical material, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a nurse. In 2000, he opened a store where he sells medical and first aid supplies. He has more than 20 years' experience in nursing and patient care and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area. 

Said is 45 years old, married and has two children, who both work. He is from Iraq. 

Said decided to apply for a $2,100 loan in order to make a showcase and a digital ads board. He is aiming to gain more profit. This will give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a showcase and a digital ads board.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a married woman with two boys, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition from other poultry operators. She dreams of purchasing a plot to build real estate (rental) houses in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and medicine for the chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and medicine for the chicks.

loans.name: Hulkarkhon's Group

texts.en:
Hulkarkhon, 42, is a leader of this group. She’s been gathering rich harvest of potatoes every fall season for the past six years. Throughout these years agricultural products have been unstable due to many reasons , including potatoes, which are highly consumed in local cuisine. These ups and downs hit thousands of farmers including Hulkarkhon who faced financial losses. Nevertheless, recent two years brought fixed high price for potatoes, which pushed the growth of supply. It is the high time to gather crops, however some final touches need to be made. This necessity motivated Hulkarkhon to apply for a loan. She feels lucky to have this land, which was received during privatization in 1990s, because it feeds her big family of 6 people. A monthly income of 3 000 soms has allowed her to make major repairing in the house. Hulakarkhon requests the loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizers. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.es: La socia Ricardina está solicitando otro préstamo para abastecerse su almacén de mercadería y desea comprar alimentos no perecibles como por ejemplo fideos, arroz, azúcar, conservas, aceite, chocolates, galletas, leche evaporada, harina de trigo, avena y lentejas. El anterior crédito a la socia le ayudo en el negocio y pudo preparar más platos de comida por lo tanto tuvo mayores ventas y obtuvo buenas ganancias de la cuales lo destino para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ricardina requests a subsequent loan to supply her inventory with merchandise. She wants to purchase non-perishable foods such as pastas, rice, sugar, preserves, cooking oil, chocolate, cookies, canned milk, wheat flour, oatmeal, and lentils. The previous loan helped her in her business and she was able to prepare more food which translated into increased sales and profits.

Her earnings were put towards the nutrition and education of her children. She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase non-perishable food items.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man aged 54 years and is blessed with three children, who are in school. He has been running a retail shop for the last five years to make a living. He also does farming for more income. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. Patrick has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, and rice for resale. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, and rice

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 24 years old and single.  He does motorbike transport to earn a living.  He has been in this business for two years.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been inspired to work hard in his business.  He has also been trained in business management skills.  He hopes to expand his business and employ people.

Simon has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ydiolita

texts.es:
La Sra. Ydiolita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, del  Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años.

Desde muy pequeña tuvo afición por los negocios, se dedicaba a la venta de chupetes (helado de hielo). Por iniciativa de su mamá decide dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, verduras y otros productos  de consumo diario para el ama de casa, instalándose en su propia casa. Su negocio inicia con un capital de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. En las noches se dedica a la venta de anticucho, juanes (platos típicos). Actualmente se encuentra muy animada en su negocio y satisfecha por haber incrementado más sus productos de primera necesidad haciéndose de muy buena clientela por sus vecinos, familiares, clientes fijos y transeúntes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles,  surtirá y comprará  productos para su negocio como: sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, aceite en litros  leche en cajas, paquetes de fideos, javas de huevos, gaseosas en paquetes y otros productos para atender las necesidades y mantener contenta a su clientela. 
Ydiolita es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio mayorista en la venta de abarrotes y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Ydiolita belongs to Amor y Paz Communal Bank, in the Moyobamba district, province of Moyobamba and department of San Martín.  She is 29 years old and a single mother with a four-year-old child.

From a very young age she was fond of business.  She worked selling ice pops.  On her mother's initiative she decided to work selling groceries, vegetables, and other products of daily consumption for the housewife, and she set herself up in her own home.  She started her business with 300 PEN in capital.  

At night she works selling "anticuchos" [kebabs of beef heart] and "juanes" [a type of tamal filled with rice], traditional dishes.  Currently she is very motivated in her business and satisfied for having increased her household necessities, so gaining herself a very good clientele in her neighbors, family members, steady customers, and passers-by.

With this loan of 1,200 PEN she will supply her business with products such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, liters of oil, boxes of milk, packages of vermicelli, cartons of eggs, flats of soda, and other products to take care of the needs of her customers and keep them happy.

Ydiolita is a hard-working woman and a fighter.  Her dream is to have a business selling groceries wholesale.  She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to be able to realize their dreams.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar, liters of oil, boxes of milk, and packages of vermicelli.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Dionisia; la socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 4 hijos ,la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de carpinteria,ella junto con su esposo realizano trabajos como mesas,sillas,puertas y ventanas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de carpinteria.La socia solicita el credito para comprar madera,lacas y pinturas para el negocio de carpinteria. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 55 years old, is married, and has four children.  She continues to work in carpentry with her husband.  Together they build things like tables, chairs, doors, and windows.  She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and wants to improve and expand the business.  She is asking for this loan to buy lumber, lacquers, and paints.

She is grateful for the support given her and she promises to be disciplined about making her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector came to the United States in 2003 with the dream of starting his own company. Back in his native Ecuador, he was in the fishing industry for over 20 years and so he wanted to start a business in his area of expertise. With that, he decided to import seafood from Ecuador to South Florida. It took him almost 4 years to plan the business, from creating distribution partnerships to developing operations. He started the business a year and a half ago and it has been growing since then. Hector’s son lives in Ecuador and manages logistics, including purchasing in bulk and shipping for sale and distribution in the United States. Hector is very proud to say he is a business owner and wants to expand to new markets. He hopes to someday distribute nationally and leave behind a legacy for his family.

This is Hector’s second loan with Accion USA. He will use it to purchase shrimp and fish in bulk and have it shipped to the United States. Now that the slow season has been over for a few months, this loan will help Hector stock up the inventory he needs to jump-start expansion of his clientele base.

loans.use: To purchase and import seafood from Ecuador.

loans.name: Fifonsi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI est formé de trois  personnes qui sont issues de la même famille. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Pauline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Pauline est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Romuald. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pauline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a six ans, Pauline vend des produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante, et aussi à son domicile. Pauline achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Pauline désire obtenir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The FIFONSI group consists of three people from the same family. The group’s representative is Pauline, the lady whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the group’s third time seeking financial support from ALIDé to bolster their activity. 

Pauline is 32 years old and married to a man named Romuald. The couple have three dependent children, all in school. Pauline did not go to school. She started selling cosmetic products six years ago from her home and door-to-door. She buys her merchandise in Benin. 

In order to replenish her stock and better meet customer demand, Pauline is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of FIFONSI. Both previous loans were correctly repaid

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Promiseland is a one-year-old store run by 60-year-old Delia in San Antonio. The store is home to Crafts Corner, one entity of the store where Delia creates handmade items such as headbands for babies and children, decorated knit hats and other accessories. She uses her time wisely and works on these crafts while business is slow in the mornings. During heavy business times, she uses these crafts to ease customers into conversation; thereafter she educates them about the other half of her business where she sells reshaping garments, created by a family-owned business and orthopedists to improve people’s back, posture and help lose weight. She also sells various natural ingredient cleansers. 

Delia works in a separate part of Wonderland of the Americas Mall similar to an indoor flea market where she is in competition with major businesses. The section of the mall is closed Monday and Tuesday so, in July 2011, she started to sell her crafts at stores to market her business. She said she has to work other venues on her days off for additional income. In the past, Delia has worked as an independent agent of Mary Kay but has never sold as much product as she does now. It has always been a passion for Delia to own her own store, she said. Though she does craft shows, she feels that owning a storefront makes her business more credible. 

She initially entered the profession to educate people about health. Delia said some people are possibly not taught but, “When we’re younger, we don’t pay too much attention to what’s important such as which nutritional products are good for you and important.” As part of a solution, she came up with the idea for her store. Most recently, she employs herself, but as a part of the multi-level business with Ayrss’ reshaping garment, she sometimes has multiple people in her store to help talk about the product and conduct fittings. 

Delia will use the loan to purchase more products and supplies. She said this will help her generate more business as she’s also been looking for two mobile carrying cases: one to showcase her crafts, the other for the nutritional products and reshaping garments as often as she can. The ones she is interested in are five feet tall and have wheels. Without the loan, she feels she would not be able to enjoy the convenience of going out as much as she does to sell her crafts.

loans.use: To pay for more health products and supplies.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida.

Ella tiene 8 años de administrar su propio negocio de sala de belleza. Ella comenta que aprendió este oficio debido a que no pudo seguir estudiando y decidió sacar un curso de cosmetología y con el apoyo de su compañero de vida instalo su sala de belleza. Antes Ana solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa.

Para comprar los materiales que necesita en su negocio, se traslada a una ciudad del oriente del país en autobús durante una hora, ya que hay unos 35 kilómetros de su casa a la ciudad, ella va a comprar ahí por que le dan mejores precios. Ana sale muy temprano a realizar las compras para regresar a atender su negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes.

Ana solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar tintes, descolorantes, alicates, agujas de crocho, guantes, cremas spray, tijeras, entre otros más y la otra parte para cancelar otro crédito a la Fundación. Con la inversión dispondrá de mayor cantidad de productos para atender a sus clientes y brindarles un mejor servicio obteniendo mayores ingresos para ella y su familia, ya que ayudara a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Ana planea contar con un mejor establecimiento y más surtido, contratar a una persona para que le ayude a prestar un mejor servicio, pues por el momento solo ella trabaja en el local.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 years old. She lives with her common-law husband.

She has had 8 years of experience in running her own business, a beauty salon. She comments that she learned this trade because she could not continue going to school and decided to take a course in cosmetology. With the help of her husband, she set up her beauty shop. Before, Ana only carried out household duties in her home.

To buy the materials that she needs in her business, she travels by bus to a city in the eastern part of the country. The trip takes an hour, since it is about 35 kilometers from her house to the city. She goes there to make her purchases because they give her better prices there. Ana leaves very early to make her purchases so that she can come back and tend to her business, since she has many customers.

Ana is applying to Fudación Campo for a loan to buy dyes, bleaches, pliers, crochet hooks, gloves, spray creams, and scissors, among other items, and also to pay back another loan from the foundation. With the investment, she will have a greater quantity of products at her disposal, so that she tend to her customers and offer them better service, obtaining a greater income for her and her family, since she will help her husband with the household expenses.

Ana plans to have a better and more well-stocked shop and to hire a person to help her give better service, since at this time she works alone in the shop.

loans.use: to buy dyes, bleaches, pliers, crochet hooks, gloves, spray creams, and scissors, among other items, and to pay back another loan from the foundation

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Maricel has a pigpen where she sells grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy pig feed, such as Purina, Pigrolac and Unifeeds.
Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Education, no one can think of a better gift to give to his children to make sure they can benefit from a brighter future.
A 34-year-old father of three, who has been working as a security with a limited monthly salary to provide his family with the necessary living needs.
He is his family's sole breadwinner since his wife doesn't work, instead she takes good care of her beloved family members.
Since Ali's income is designed to cover his family's daily living needs, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children school tuition fees making sure he can provide them with a better education and brighter future.
Ali's dream is to see his children doctors in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his children school tuition fees to make sure he can provide his children with a better education and brighter future

loans.name: Ablavi Ahoéfa

texts.en:
29 years old, Mrs. Ablavi Ahoéfa A. is a single mother of two children. She currently works part time in an organization but her monthly revenue is very minimal and is not enough to address the needs of her and her two children. She has therefore decided to open a side business, and was able to obtain a $400 credit in order to partner with her sister in law and open a little general food store. Today, she would like to start by buying frozen products since the demand is great in the community. Her finances being limited, she is soliciting a loan in order to realize her project. She is asking for a $900 loan in order to buy a freezer and to buy and sell frozen products.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 29 ans, Madame A. Ablavi Ahoéfa est célibataire et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle travaille actuellement en tant qu’agent temporaire dans une société de la place mais son revenu mensuel est très dérisoire et n’arrive pas à couvrir ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Elle décida alors d’associer une activité parallèle. C’est ainsi qu’elle réussit à obtenir un crédit de $400 et s’associe à sa belle sœur pour ouvrir une petite boutique d’alimentation générale. Aujourd’hui, elle veut commencer la vente des produits congelés dans la boutique car la demande est devenue importante dans la localité. Mais ses moyens financiers étant limités, elle sollicite un appui financier pour réaliser ce projet. Le crédit de $900 qu’elle sollicite va permettre d’acheter un congélateur, et de disposer d’un fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des produits congelés.

loans.use: Buy a freezer and frozen food products.

loans.name: Silvia Rafaela

texts.en:
Silvia began selling accessories for babies 6 years ago, because sometimes her husband's business didn't do so well, and he couldn't bring home enough money to cover all the family's expenses. She has 2 daughters who are in University and she would like to see them finish their studies. The income Silvia earns goes to her daughters' University expenses. Now, she needs a $250 loan, which she'll use to buy more merchandise, offer her clients more variety, and to generate more income.

You can help this family assisting the growth of Silvia's business. Be an important part of her and her family's achievements. They need your support and love and are sincerely thankful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Silvia inició con la venta de accesorios para bebé desde hace seis años, porque a su esposo en ocasiones no le iba bien con su negocio, y no conseguía los recursos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. Ella tiene dos hijas que actualmente estudian en la universidad, Silvia desea que ellas puedan terminar sus estudios y el ingreso que ella obtiene de sus ventas lo utilizan con este fin. Ahora ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares con los que incrementará sus productos, para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad y obtener mayores ingresos.

Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, puedes colaborar al crecimiento de este negocio, sé parte importante en los logros de Silvia y su familia, ellos necesitan de tu apoyo y cariño y agradecen sinceramente tu generosidad

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti is a 23 year old mother and is married with one girl who attends elementary school. Her husband Andi is a fisherman, earning about $2.50 in a day. To supplement her husband's income, Siti makes and sells fisherman's nets. She can make one fisherman's net in a day.  Siti needs a loan of $100. With this loan she can buy more materials, thus her working capital will get bigger and will enable her to double her income eventually. She really wants to have more income so that she can have a better life. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola is married and has two daughters, ages 2 and 17. Her husband is a laborer and the salary he receives is too little to cover the basic necessities of the family and the education expenses of the older daughter. This is the reason why Fabiola started her own business selling groceries one year ago. The good service she offers and the good quality of the products she sells have helped increase the number of her customers and made her business grow.

With the increased demand, now Fabiola needs a loan for $925, which she will will use to remodel her store to have a bigger space and to offer better service to her customers. She promises to repay this amount in 6 months. Be an important part of the growth of this business by deciding to support Fabiola.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Fabiola es casada y tiene dos hijas, de 2 y 17 años de edad. Su esposo es obrero y el salario que recibe es muy poco para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y los gastos de la educación de su hija mayor, esta es la razón por la que Fabiola inició su propio negocio con al venta de abarrotes hace un año, el buen servicio que ofrece y la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa le han ayudado a incrementar su número de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Con el incremento en la demanda que ha tenido, ahora Fabiola necesita de un préstamo de $925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su tienda para tener un lugar más amplio y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo pienses más y decídete a ayudar a Fabiola.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti J. is 35 years old and is married. She sells rice, cooking oil, eggs and noodles, usually earning $33 per day. Her husband Oman is a motorbike taxi driver, so his income is not fixed. She needs a $100 loan to improve her shop and hopes that this will earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gladys Clara

texts.es:
Gladys is much admired as a good mother, an example of a hardworker with a lot of courage. She suffered a great deal when her husband left her, though he did come back to her and she decided to give him another chance. They grow bananas, coffee and pineapple, which they sell in the city of Huancayo after they harvest. THey are now looking to expand their sales in the capital as well. This expansion of their business motivates them, and they are dedicating more time to the cultivation and care of their products, while stil taking care of their home and their two sons. One of their sons has decided to attend the university of Huancayo, which makes his parents very proud.

Gladys wants to grow and improve the production of their crops, but they need fertilizers which cost a lot of money during the planting season. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $300 to be able to buy the necessary materials to make her harvest abundant and of the highest quality, better positioning them to sell in the capital. They count on your kind support so they may realize their goals and grow the business.

Doña Gladys es una admirable madre de familia que siempre dio ejemplo de trabajo y coraje a pesar de las adversidades y desengaños que sufrió a consecuencia del abandono de su esposo, quién regreso muy arrepentido y ella ha decidió darle una oportunidad más.Se dedican al cultivo de plátanos, café y piña en su gran extensión de terrenos que después de cosecharlos los llevan a comercializar a la ciudad de Huancayo y ahora con miras de repartirlos también en la ciudad capital.Este nuevo proyecto la anima a seguir esforzándose y ha dedicarle más tiempo a la siembra y al cuidado de sus productos, sin descuidar el cuidado de su casa y de sus pequeños dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos la llena de mucho orgullo porque a pesar de las carencias decidió forjarse un mejor futuro en la universidad de Huancayo.De manera que, doña Gladys, desea incrementar y mejorar la producción de sus frutas pero requiere de abonos y fertilizantes los cuales en esta época de masiva siembra son muy costosos y es por ello su solicitud de 300 dólares, para la compra abonos con el fin de que su cosecha sea abundante y de calidad y que puedan ser apetecibles y agradables para su comercialización y pueda ser un buen comienzo para la transportación de sus productos para la capital. Contamos con su tal gentil contribución para hacer realidad los anhelos de comercialización de doña Gladys.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS SUCH AS FERTILIZER TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF THEIR CROPS, HELPING THEM GROW THEIR BUSINESS AND EXPAND THEIR SALES.

loans.name: Magnolia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magnolia belongs to the Mujeres Virtuosas communal bank, and lives in the district of Callería, department of Ucayali. She is 44 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a salesman, but his income was not enough so Magnolia, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, put up a small store to sell shoes and sandals at the entrance to Market No. 2 in her city.

Currently her business is growing, and now she sells stockings, shoes and sandals. In the mornings she takes care of her housework and after taking care of her children, leaves to go to her business.

With another loan from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 50 pairs of shoes, 10 dozen sandals of all kinds and 10 dozen stockings, since now that the Christmas holidays are coming she has many requests from her customers.

Magnolia is very pleased because her business is going well, and this is an important achievement for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Magnolia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano 11 de Julio 147, del distrito Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero el ingreso que tiene no les alcanza, es así que Magnolia, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos decide poner una pequeña tienda de venta de zapatos y sandalias en la puerta del mercado Nº 2 de nuestra ciudad.

En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido, ahora vende medias, zapatos y sandalias. Por las mañanas se dedica a las labores de su casa, después de atender a sus hijos, sale con destino hacia su negocio. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 50 pares de zapatos, 10 docenas de sandalias en todos los modelos y 10 docenas de medias, ya que se acercan las fiestas navideñas y tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes. Magnolia está muy contenta porque le va bien en su negocio, y es un logro muy importante para ella y para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of footwear in bulk.

loans.name: Anak Agung Kadek

texts.id:
In order to have the necessities of day to day life, A. and her family run a small store. A.'s husband is a farmer whose work is never steady. If he is not called off on a new work assignment, he spends his time tending to the garden that he inherited from his parents. In her store, A. sells items necessary in the day-to-day lives of the people in her area. These items include small snacks, various types of sweet drinks and other traditional foods. Starting with only 500,000 Rupiah of her own savings, A. was brave enough to start her own business. She had the courage to start it because her family did not have a steady flow of work. Due to her perseverance, her business continues to grow. Each week she must purchase more goods to replenish her inventory. Her business currently brings in 20,000 to 30,000 Rupiah per day. A. would now like to borrow capitol to improve the condition of her shop and offer more items to her customers so she can increase her profits.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Untuk mencukupi kebutuhan sehari –hari A. bersama keluarganya hanya mengandalkan usaha warungnya. Suaminya adalah seorang petani yang pekerjannya tidak tetap. Kalau ada yang menyuruh barulah ia bekerja sedang waktu tidak ada pekerjaan hanyalah menggarap kebun warisan dari orang tuanya. Barang-barang yang dijualnya A. seperti barang keperluan sehari-hari yang diperlukan oleh masyarakat sekitar seperti makanan ringan, aneka macam minuman ringan dan makanan tradisional lainnya. Dengan modal awal hanya Rp. 500.000.- yang diambil dari tabungannya, A. memberanikan diri untuk memulai usaha ini karena dulunya didalam keluarganya tidak memiliki usaha yang tetap. Dengan ketekunannya sehingga kini usahanya semakin berkembang. Dalam satu minggu A. harus berbelanja untuk melengkapi barang daganganya yang sudah berkurang. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat sekitar Rp. 20.000,- sampai Rp. 30.000,- setiap hari. Dan saat ini A. membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha untuk memperbaiki kondisi warungnya dan menambah kelengkapannya agar keuntungan yang didapat pun bertambah.

loans.use: to improve the condition of her shop and increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora F. is a very hard-working women, who for the past twenty years has dedicated herself to the sale of fruits in the town of Villanueva in the beautiful municipality of Chinandega in Nicaragua. She is a woman of happy and humble character. She established her building with capital obtained from her long-term savings.

She is now the mother of a young son for whom she has the duty to provide education. Her dearest wish is that her son can be educated to be a professional and won’t suffer as she considers she suffered from a very young age with heavy work.

It’s necessary to state that Maria Auxiliadora F. currently doesn’t have a permanent business site, so sells her products in Villanueva park. For this reason she approached CEPRODEL in order to become a beneficiary of credits which she will be able to invest in the purchase of stock and also in the improvement of her business area.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Auxiliadora F. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de frutas en la ciudad de Villanueva de la bella ciudad de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Se caracteriza por ser una dama muy alegre y humilde. Su negocio lo comenzó con un capital obtenidos por medio de sus ahorros de largo tiempo.

Actualmente es madre de un hijo el cual tiene el deber de brindarle educación ya que es menor de edad. Su mayor anhelo es que su hijo se prepare para poder ser profesional y no sufrir como ella considera que sufrió desde muy joven con trabajos muy pesados.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Maria Auxiliadora F. actualmente no posee un local propio por lo que vende sus productos en el parque de Villanueva. Por esta razón es que acuda a CEPRODEL para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan invertir en la compra de los productos y además en el mejoramiento de su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase fruits
