loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mas que Vencedoras está ubicado en la ciudad de Azogues capital de la provincia del  Cañar, a 50 km de la ciudad  se encuentran las ruinas de Ingapirca uno de los sitios más turísticos y  visitados del Ecuador tanto por turistas nacinales como extranjeros, Azogues y Cañar son famosos por su artesanía, especialmente por la manufacturación de los sombreros de paja toquilla y sus productos cerámicos, su gente es cordial y muy amable como nuestras socias que cada día trabajan para dar un mejor presente y futuro a los miembros de  sus familias.

 Martha vive en la comunidad de Zhizhiquin con  su esposo que  trabaja en el aserradero de su propiedad  y con sus cuatro hijos  de 13, 11, 8 y 5 años todos estudiantes de primaria y secundaria, juntos han logrado cimentar su casa propia a base de  mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.

La señora Martha ayuda a su esposo en el aserradero hace trece años y también se dedica a  los quehaceres del hogar y cuidado de una vaca que posee. Se enteró de los beneficios de la institución por una amiga del banco comunal y ya lleva diez ciclos como socia,  los créditos le han beneficiado para el crecimiento de su negocio y con el nuevo préstamo solicitado   va a comprar madera para tener un stock adecuado para sus clientes, su sueño es incrementar  su negocio  cada día más.
texts.en:
The Mas que Vencedoras (More than Winners) Community Bank is located in the city of Azogues, capital of the province of Cañar. Fifty kilometers from the city are the ruins of Ingapirca, one of the most visited tourist sites for natives and foreigners in Ecuador. Azogues and Cañar are famous for its craftwork, especially for making straw hats and ceramic products. The people are cordial and very kind, including the community bank members who work hard every day to provide a better present and future to their family. Martha lives in the community of Zhizhiquin with her husband, who works at a sawmill they own, and their four children, ages 13, 11, 8 and 5, who are all in school. Together they have been able to build their own home through a lot of hard work and sacrifice. Martha has helped her husband at the sawmill for the past three years and also dedicates herself to household chores and caring for a cow they own. She heard about the benefits of community banks from a friend who was a member, and has since taken out 10 loans, which has helped her grown her business. With the new loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase wood so she has an adequate supply for her customers. Her dream is to grow her business every day.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to have a sufficient supply

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
These four people, who make up this group loan, live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sovann P. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. She and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Eth, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they grow vegetables to sell to support their family.

In the vegetable field, they have some problems because their field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve their vegetable production, Mrs. Sovann P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

Mrs. Sovann P. has five children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, and the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Madlene

texts.en:
Madlene, who has eight years of experience as a beautician, is a single woman, 35 years old, living with her parents.

Madlene opened a beauty salon in her home in 2005 and started receiving clients. She offers all kinds of beauty services: make up, manicure, pedicure, wax, laser, etc.

Madlene has already taken her first loan and she's very pleased with her decision to take another loan from Ameen. Over the course of her loan term, she has consistently repaid on-time and she has even repaid the full loan amount earlier than her scheduled end date.

Today, Madlene is requesting $1,200 to buy a new laser machine, very modern, so as to be always up-to-date in her market and to introduce all the new equipment for her customers.

In the future, Madlene would like to open a formal beauty salon for women.

loans.use: To buy a new laser machine

loans.name: Bulgamaa

texts.en:
Bulgamaa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent. Bulgamaa operates a dairy product trading business in her town. She sells a variety of diary products, including milk, curds and yogurt, at the local Hasu trading center. 

Bulgamaa started her business in 1991 with working capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~  36 USD), and she has steadily expanded her business since that time. Today her working capital has grown to 550,000 tugrugs (~  400 USD). She has gained valuable experience as a businesswoman and has a loyal customer base. Her husband supports her business and both of them are very hard-working people. 

Bulgamaa makes an effort to communicate effectively with others. She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: 18.04.024 Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Dung N. T.ị (63) is a 33-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Dung is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 024 Quảng Hưng.
Dung is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Dung owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for saL.. Dung has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a monT. from these activities.
In 2008, Dung joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dung has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her fourT. from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Dung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group
1. Hoàng T.ị Tâm (64) is a 25-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 2. Lê T.ị Khuyên (65) is a 39-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Dung N. T.ị (63) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở T.ành phố Thanh Hóa. Dung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các T.ành viên. Mặc dù mỗi T.ành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các T.ành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính T.ức của nhóm vay này là 024 Quảng Hưng (024 Quảng Hưng). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương T.ức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Dung T.ực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Dung kiếm được khoảng 1500000 VND. Vào 2008, Dung đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có T.ể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Dung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4T. khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Hoàng T.ị Tâm (64) là 25 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực T.ực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán T.ức ăn. 2. Lê T.ị Khuyên (65) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông T.ôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được T.ông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có T.ể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch T.ủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục T.ông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp T.ông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Fredrick Ouma

texts.en:
Fredrick Ouma A. is a sugar cane farmer in Migori. Besides that, he is also a matatu driver on the Kisumu Migori route. Fredrick started farming in 2005, to help in sustaining his family. He is 32 years old, a husband and the father of two children. 

With a dream of buying a piece of land, where he will build his home and raise livestock for economic stability, Fredrick wishes to expand his business to be able to be able to save enough money.

He wishes to obtain a loan worth Ksh. 50,000, which will be used in the farming business.

loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 38-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two small children (ages 6 months and 3 and a half years). He has over 13 years of experience running a clothing shop. He sells clothes for women and children. He says that he is proud of the high quality of his work. He believes his honesty and experience working in the sales field since he was young have helped distinguish him. His main customers are friends and neighbors. 

He is requesting a loan of US$ 1500 from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua. He plans to purchase new merchandise for his store. In the future, he would like to make more wholesale purchases to reduce costs and increase his profits. This will be his first loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married with four children and three of them go to school. The last born is three months old.  She also takes care of her late brother's children. She owns and resides in a four-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   

Cissy owns a bar in Nabweru in Kawempe Division. Formerly she had restaurant, but changed her business enterprise to a bar four months ago. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and local gin.  She works seven days week. She is hoping to own a fully stocked bar in the future.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Gakuwebwa - Mono Womens Group-Lugazi

texts.en: Farming is a reliable but often neglected means of extricating improvised people out of poverty. It can be used in many ways to get oneself out of narrow circumstances. This reality in today’s Uganda, where everybody is looking for a white collar job, has not sunk in fully. It goes without saying that Farming, has from time in memorial, been the backbone of most business in Uganda. Many families subsisted on it to start other businesses, educate their children and to make ends meet. One individual who did not gloss over this reality is one high spirited 38 year married mother of 4, who goes by the name of A. Harriet. With enough savings from her farming business, she began a retail shop 10 years ago in Buikwe-Lugazi.  For a person who describes herself as a hard worker, it is no surprise that her business has made progress through the course of the last 10 years. In a month, she has been making profits that have consistently totaled up to 600,000 shillings. Like any other business person who aims at making more profits, she is taking a long view with plans of transforming into a wholesale business. She is optimistic that with this loan coming her way and with an additional source of income coming through her rental business, she will be able to make ends meet. With it, she is planning on purchasing more retail stock like sugar, basins, cups, rice, beans, soap, etc that she will be able to resell to earn more profits.

loans.use: Purchasing more retail items like sugar, basins, cups, rice, etc that she will resell

loans.name: Mrs. Sameam Horm Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-one people live in Pou Preah Sang village, Takeo province and they are made up a village bank president. Mrs. Sameam H. is a bank president who was born in 1962, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied ways to support her businesses. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family while her husband, Mr. Saren Laut, is a Khmer cake maker. Through this activity, both them support three children, one of who is a tailor, while the others are studying in local public school. Her problem is that her child’s sew is too old to use. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Sameam H. is applying for a loan to buy a new sewing machine to instead the old one and rest of the loan she buys some piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita L. is from the village of Tipan. She is 51 years old and is married with six adult children. Tita owns and operates a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Tita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Tita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Tiessiri 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Tièssiri  2 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et  en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Madoudiarrabougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et tous les deux prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  KAFOUNE S. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environ 1 hectare petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 35.000FCFA environ en fin de   campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Tièssiri 2 group are married women on average 38 years old with three children. Most live in polygamous families in Madoudiarrabougou, one of the villages belonging to the Dioïla Prefecture in the Koulikoro region, part of the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to better organise their winter activities. Their cash crops are millet, peanuts and beans. This is their third farming loan and the two preceding ones have been duly repaid. With this new loan Kafoune S. intends to buy seeds and fertilizer, small farming equipment and pay labor costs in relation to ploughing and weeding, to cultivate approximately 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of millet and peanuts. After harvesting the crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to both men and women customers. She hopes to reach earnings of about 35,000 FCFA by the end of the farming season.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor costs (weeding), seeds, fertilizer and small farming equipment

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng K. is 39 years old and lives in Phnom Penh province, where she has owns a small house in which she lives with her family. She works for a milk company and earns a salary of about $100 a month. Her husband works with her at the same location. The couple has a young child who is enrolled in school. Seng K.'s house is old and in need of repairs. She is applying for a $500 loan from Kiva’s field partner HKL to improve and repair her house.

loans.use: To improve and repair her house

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen lives in a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. 
She is a widow, lost her husband few years ago as a result of heart failure. 
She is the mother of a son who does embroidery works. He couldn’t get an education due to poor financial condition of his family and his parents sent him to embroidery school in his teen age. Now he is an expert in embroidery and operates his business from his home. He has started his own embroider business 8 years ago. 
Yasmeen does sewing. She spends her time in doing sewing for her neighborhood clients. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan amount he will buy embroidery material such as beads, color thread and clothes in bulk quantity to offer his services to larger client base. 
Yasmeen is hopeful with the loan investment her son will be able to expand his business and makes his income double in size. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 5th loan cycle. In previous loan years she never missed any meeting and paid her installments on time. 
Note: “In the photo, a lady who is raising her hand is Yasmeen and the male who is working is her son”.

loans.use: To buy embroider material for embroider business

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria A. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Joweria has a tailoring business, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Joweria has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more materials to make clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joweria hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Joweria hopes to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make clothes

loans.name: Ekoue

texts.fr: ekoué folly bébé est un homme de 52 ans, il fait comme activité le rebobinage. il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité, il doit exécuté des travaux pour ses clients mais il manque de matériel raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 18 kg de fil émaillé.il est célibataire et c'est avec ce commerce qu'il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Ekoué is 52 years old and single. His business is a motor rewind service and he has over ten years experience. This business helps him to support his family. He is requesting a loan from WAGES, as at the moment he is facing a very high demand and would have a lot of work, but he does not have enough material. With this loan he will buy 18 kg of enamelled wire.

loans.use: Purchase of enamelled wire

loans.name: Milena Yasmina

texts.es: La señora Milena Yasmina desde hace 6 años, ella tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, este negocio empezó primeramente como una necesidad de obtener mejores ingresos ya que el salario de su compañero de vida no llenaba la necesidad familiar, por lo que decidió ayudarle a su esposo dedicándose a la venta de variedad de productos. Luego ella noto que el negocio era rentable, por lo que ha continuado siempre con el mismo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de ropa, trajes, perfumes y cremas. Su sueño es comprar un tramo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Milena Yasmina is 31 years old. She has been married for six years and has three small children. The lady sells general merchandise.

She first started her business in response to a need for higher income as the salary of her life partner did not meet family needs. She then decided to help her husband by selling a variety of products. Afterwards she noticed that the business was profitable, so she continued in the same manner.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of clothes, dresses, perfumes and beauty creams. Her dream is to buy a stand in the market.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
El  Sr Maximiliano  está casado con la señora María, quien se dedica a la venta comida, él se dedica a la reparación de autos,  cuyo trabajo  le genera  un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposa  e hijos  están  saliendo adelante con esmero y dedicación.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas como gatos para diferentes tipos de vehículos, y otros.
texts.en:
Sr. Maximiliano is married to Sra. María, who sells food. He repairs automobiles and is able to generate a good income from this type of work.

With the help of his wife and children, Maximiliano is able to move forward with great care and dedication. Today he is a successful businessman with many customers because he provides good service.

Maximiliano is requesting this loan to buy equipment, such as automobile jacks for different types of vehicles, and other supplies.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for his work

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Elle a 37 ans et est mariée. Elle a un enfant.  Pour contribuer au foyer, elle fait la vente de produits d’alimentation générale.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local d’agoe.  Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle espère augmenter son commerce. elle contribue aux charges de sa famille avec son revenu
texts.en: She is 37 years old and married. She has one child. To contribute to the household budget, she sells general food products. She toscks up at the big market in Lomé and resells at the local market in Agoe. With this new loan, she hopes to expand her business. She contributes to the family expenses thanks to her revenues.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Claudio, de 54 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Faustina de 47 años y sus 2 menores hijos Linder de 27 y Guido de 22 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Cuando era niño, los padres de Claudio le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café, cacao y hojas de coca, para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plagas. Desea con muchas ganas, comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Claudio is 54 and a very friendly and hardworking man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Faustina, 47, and their two youngest children; Linder, 27, and Guido, 22, to whom they wish to bring a better quality of life.  When he was a boy, Claudio's parents taught him everything he needed to know about farming, and little by little, over time, he took charge of his parents' fields.  Now he has vast crop fields where he harvests coffee, cacao, and coca leaves to sell at the San Francisco city market.  

What Claudio likes best about his job is cultivating his fields because that's what feeds the family.  He's been doing this for 35 years and finds that the hardest part is protecting the crops from pests.  He would very much like to buy a car to transport his products.  This will be his sixth loan with MFP; he has always been very punctual with his payments and hope to be with this one, too.  In his village bank he is very supportive of the rest of the members.  He plans to use his 3000 soles to buy more fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Solaua

texts.en:
Solaua T., age 58, is a farmer. She plants and harvests bananas for sale. Solaua has three years of experience in this business. Solaua is requesting a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand her business. She and her husband have five children between the ages of 18 and 26.

In 2008, Solaua joined SPBD. This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Solaua's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital for his taxi business

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Chhorn C. makes a living working in construction in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He has been working in this job since 2002. He usually generates a profit of about $3.33 each day to help support his family. He has a life partner in his wife, who is a mat seller. The couple has six children, three of whom are employed in different paying jobs. Chhorn C. would like a loan of $900 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. He will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land that he can farm and rent to other farmers

loans.name: Thouch

texts.en:
Thouch S. L. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Her husband shares the responsibility of supporting the family by working as a building worker. 

Thouch S. L. has been in the farming business since 1995. She owns a plot of farmland that she inherited from her parents. She is going to use her loan to add to her current savings to buy a plot of farmland that is in a good location for farming.

loans.use: To buy a new plot of farmland

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 51 años de edad y es casada. Viven en Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 6 años, cuenta con una pequeña bodega situada en su domicilio donde vende víveres y artículos de primera necesidad. Se encuentra casi 30 minutos del pueblo de Olmos. Por la lejanía, el negocio de Santos es una de las pocas bodegas en su región. Por ende cuenta con una clientela establecida y fiel y logra una buena margen de ganancia. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería como arroz, azúcar, y aceite. Con la inversión de su crédito, podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida para ella y su esposo. 

Ha tenido otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual. Se ha visto que ha crecido su negocio porque cuando comenzaba solo vendía gaseosas y golosinas. Ahora está comercializando arroz, azúcar, aceites, fideos, leches, etc. Santos se siente satisfecha por la confianza que los prestamistas de Kiva y Edpyme Alternativa han depositado en ella.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old and married.  She lives in Olmos, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For 6 years, Santos has had a small grocery store located in her home where she sells food products and essentials.  She is located almost 30 minutes from the village of Olmos.  Owing to this distance, Santos' business is one of the few grocery stores in her region.  Consequently, she has an established and loyal customer base and manages to make a good profit margin.  She would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise such as rice, sugar and oil.  By investing her loan, she will increase her income and improve her own and her husband's quality of life.

Santos has had previous loans which she has repaid punctually.  It is clear that her business has grown because when she started she only sold soda and candies.  Now she sells rice, sugar, oil, noodles, milk, etc.  Santos feels satisfied with the trust that Kiva lenders and Edpyme Alternativa have placed in her.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, es una mujer soltera de 47 años. Vive en compañía de su madre anciana, en su departamento que la construyó en su terreno heredado por sus padres. 

Ella es profesora de profesión, trabaja en un colegio particular y también con niños especiales. Dicta clases a niños de 5  a 6 años de edad, y muchos de sus alumnos, carecen de compresión. En vista de ello, se puso en realizar trabajos didácticos de corrupum, para el mayor entendimiento de sus clases. Desde entonces los vende, a precios muy asequibles, con la sola finalidad de que le cubran el  material invertido, ya que además realizar estos trabajaos didácticos que le llenan de mucha complacencia y se entretiene mucho. Por ello no, ahora que ya empezó las clases académicas, requiere contar con materiales de corrumpum, micro poroso y tecno Ford, para hacer siluetas similares como nos muestra en la foto,  y de ese modo reforzar sus clases. Y, para más adelante piensa dedicarse a la pintura acrílica, por ello piensa estudiar cursos de pintura. 

Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas como en el anterior ciclo. Además menciona “que está muy contenta de pertenecer a su grupo sólido y que todos son responsables.”

Con el dinero del crédito que solicita, comprará  materiales de corrumpum, micro poroso, tecno Ford, plumones y entre otras cosas, necesarias para realizar sus siluetas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single 47-year old woman who lives with her elderly mother in an apartment that she built on land inherited from her parents.

She is a teacher by profession in a private school and she also works with special needs children.  She gives classes to 5 and 6 year old children and many of her students lack ability to comprehend.  Because of this she began to create teaching materials for them to better understand their classes. Since then she started selling the figures at reasonable prices with the goal of covering the cost of the materials.  This work gives her a lot of satisfaction and entertains her. Now that classes have started she needs micro porous corrospum and styrofoam to make similar figures such as those shown in our photo to reinforce her classes.  In the future she hopes to be able to work with acrylic paints and take painting classes.

This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to make the payments as she did in the previous cycle.  Besides, she mentions that she is very happy belonging to a united group where all the members are responsible.

With the loan money she will buy micro porous corrospum, styrofoam, felt-tipped markers and more that are needed to make the figures.

loans.use: To buy micro porous corrospum (a micro-porous material similar to plastic), styrofoam, felt-tipped markers, and more

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: Félix Pedro tiene 45 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la ofrecer el servicio de mecánico. Hace más de 27 años, que tiene este medio de vida, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, Félix ha sido un padre muy abnegado y que disfruta de su actividad y de brindarles a sus clientes el mejor servicio. El motivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de repuestos para vehículos, herramientas, llantas, vidrios entre otros productos que son necesarios para brindar un buen servicio.
texts.en: Felix Pedro is 45 years old and has 2 dependent children.  He has a business where he works as a mechanic.  He has made his living this way for more than 27 years, since he has always been concerned about providing his family with the income needed for their household.  Felix has been a selfless father, and he enjoys his work, providing his customers with the best possible service.  He is taking this loan to purchase automotive parts, tools, tires, and automotive glass, among other items, that he needs to provide the best service.

loans.use: to buy auto parts, tools, tires, auto glass, and other products that he needs to provide good service

loans.name: Sunrise Business Membership Group

texts.en:
Shadreck N. is the leader of Sunrise Business Membership Group. He is 43 years old and married with a three-year-old child. He also takes care of four other dependants. He is an agro-dealer who sells agricultural products; he also operates a grocery store in Masvingo. He has been running this business for five years with two employees. Transport challenges and unstable prices are the major difficulties in his business. 

Shadreck intends to increase his grocery store stock with the loan requested through MicroKing. He believes that the loan will be a major working capital injection in the business that should lead to increased profitability and ultimately help improve the family’s welfare. He has been borrowing from MicroKing for some time and believes that the conditions to access a loan are not tight as compared to other banks.

Note: In the picture, the gentleman in the front row is Shadreck N..

loans.use: to increase his grocery store stock levels.

loans.name: Flor Violeta

texts.es:
En el departamento del Cusco, capital Cusco conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América", se reúnen cada treinta días las socias del Banco Comunal “Todos Unidos” en la oficinas central de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú.

En este Banco Comunal conocimos a la señora Flor Violeta, tiene 36 años de edad y vive feliz con su pareja. Desde hace 12 años que Flor Violeta y su pareja Washington tienen una pequeña imprenta en un local alquilado y el local tiene como nombre particular “D’ Gráficos”. Ellos tienen cuatro personas que ayudan en el trabajo de la imprenta. Flor Violeta en el Banco Comunal tiene varios años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos está creciendo día a día su negocio. En esta oportunidad Flor Violeta requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo papel y tintes. Su sueño de Flor Violeta es tener un su propio local y comprar una maquina offset.
texts.en:
Every thirty days the members of the communal bank "Todos Unidos" (Everyone United) meet in the central offices of the Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Perú. The department of Cusco, whose capital is the city of Cusco, has been known for many years as the "Architectural Capital of America".

In this communal bank, we meet Flor Violeta. She is 36 years old and lives happily with her partner. For 12 years Flor Violeta and her partner, Washington, have run a small printing press in a rented shop. The shop is called "D’ Gráficos" (D' Graphics). They have four people that work in the printing shop. Flor Violeta has been a member of the communal bank for a few years and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she is growing her business daily. This time, Flor Violeta needs the loan to purchase more inputs, such as paper and ink. Her dream is to own the shop location and to buy an offset printing machine.

loans.use: purchase more inputs, such as paper and toner.

loans.name: Llerlith

texts.es: Llerlith, de 32 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Gilbert de 33 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Ángel de 7 y Bill de 3 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El puesto de comida de Llerlith es uno de los más concurridos en la ciudad de Pucallpa, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es cocinar, por eso lo hace con mucho esmero. Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto de comida para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por ello pide de su apoyo para cumplir con tal propósito. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo espera cumplir en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita y junto a sus ahorros comprará un motocarro, él cual manejará su esposo.
texts.en: Llerlith, 32, is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She and her husband, Gilbert, 33, and their two children--Angel, 7, and Bill, 3--live with her parents.  Her children are very dear to hear and what she most wants in the world is to give them a better quality of life.  She operates a food sales business and her food stall is one of the busiest in the city of Pucallpa.  Her customers come to her over and over to enjoy the delicious meals that she prepares for them.  She has always liked to cook, from the time she was a young girl, and she's good at it so putting her skills to work building a business makes her very happy.  She has operated the business for 5 years and what she most likes about it is cooking, something she does with great care.  She wants to grow her business and provide a better service to her customers.  She's asking for your help because she wants to borrow the money to make the improvements she's planning.  She's an active member of her community bank.  She will use the one-thousand new soles loan, along with her own savings, to buy a motocarro--a motorized vehicle for transportation and goods deliveries--which will be operated by her husband.

loans.use: to buy a motocarro.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de la commune de PIMPERNA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  KARY 1ère à droite position accroupi de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 142.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 Group are married women, on average 42 years old, have four children, and mostly live in polygamist families in Zerlaba, a village in the district of Pimperna, in the Sikasso prefecture, the third administrative region of Mali.  They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better manage their agricultural businesses during the winter season.  They are on their seventh loan from the institution; all prior loans have been fully repaid.

Kary, the first woman squatting on the right of the photo, cultivates tomatoes and jakatou- a type of small green eggplant.  With this loan, she intends to pay labor wages, purchase seeds and agricultural inputs to work a 1 hectare plot.  After the harvest, the produce is sold within the village and in the Sikasso market to a clientele of men and women.  

She intends to earn an average profit of 142,500 FCFA per year.  This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and help her husband with household expenses.  She hopes to maintain this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make the most of her plot and reap more profit.

loans.use: to pay wages and to purchase seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen is 51 years old, and she is a married mother of 6 children. Four of her children are currently attending school. She has a mixed farm in Kisii town that produces bananas, maize and vegetables. She has been in the farming business for 15 years now and employs 2 farmhands. She sells all her farm produce at the local market. She earns additional income from her shop in the same location.

She has made a loan request of 45,000 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the proceeds that will be generated from the sale of milk will help improve her family's livelihood. She faces the challenges of insufficient capital (to expand her business) and an unstable market (to sell her farm produce). She plans to buy a motorcycle in the future to assist her in transporting her farm produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Djarena

texts.fr: Distributrice ambulante des produits de premières nécessités (huile, tomate…) Djarena est mariée à un sous- marin et a 02 enfants. Elle  veut ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à Lomé. Elle a 33 ans et a démarré en 2008.
texts.en: Djarena  sells basic needs products (oil, tomatoes…) as a street vendor. She is married to a sailor and has two children. She would like to get this loan in order to stock up on merchandise in Lomé Djarena is 33 years old and launched her business in 2008.

loans.use: to buy staple foods (for resale)

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 29 años de edad. Esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Rosa y su familia viven en casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de  Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña y humilde ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad.

Rosa se dedica, desde hace 5 años, a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. Esta actividad la desarrolla en su propio domicilio y cuenta con una gran experiencia y clientela. 

Rosa tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Es por ello que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo  de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir  en la compra de pavos y gallinas y en el alimento balanceado que estos requieren, para poder tener una crianza optima que le permita venderlos a mejores precios y así crecer en su actividad.

Rosa es una clienta conocida para nuestra entidad que ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old. She is married and has two children. Rosa and her family live in their own house in the rural area of the district of Lambayeque, in a small and humble community located 20 minutes from the city.

Rosa has been raising and selling poultry for five years. She performs this work at her own home and has a great deal of experience and many customers.

Rosa has a great desire to improve her family's quality of life. This is why she is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She will invest it in the purchase of turkeys and chickens and to provide them with the balanced diet they need, so that they can have an optimal upbringing that will allow her to sell them for better prices and therefore to grow her business.

Rosa is a familiar client of Edpyme Alternativa who has shown responsibility in making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy turkeys, chickens, and a balanced diet for them

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 36, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Renante, and a mother of two children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rowena operates a barbecue stall near her house. She regularly buys pork, meat and chicken entrails that she prepares to cook and sell in the afternoon at her stall. She also sells dried fish that she orders from her hometown province and mineral water that her husband delivers to nearby apartment units. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 700 in sales every day.

To help continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more meat, dried fish and mineral water. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rowena dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional meat, dried fish and mineral water for her business

loans.name: Aba Ndiaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 12 juin 2008. Il est  composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de l'huile de palme et de jus de citron. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The Aba N. solidarity group was created on June 12, 2008. It consists of 15 women from the same neighborhood who mainly conduct small trade.

Mrs Fatou, standing on the right-hand side of the photo and raising her hand, chairs the group. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of five children. She also takes care of four other children that their parents entrusted to her care. She sells palm oil and lemon juice. After several years in this activity she has a lot of experience. She will use her loan to increase her working capital and develop her business. The profit from her activity will enable her to improve the living standard of her family (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.) and save more money.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and lemon juice.

loans.name: Azizmo

texts.ru: Азизмо проживает в районе Дангары. Ей 38 лет. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. После смерти мужа она занялась бизнесом. Сейчас Азизмо занимается торговлей. Она продает мужскую одежду и парфюмерию. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для покупки парфюмерии и детской одежды.
texts.en: Azizmo lives in the Dangara district.  She is 38 years old, a widow and has two children.  After her husband's death, she started her own business.  Currently, Azizmo is involved in retail sales.  She sells men's clothing and perfumery.  She has been in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of perfumery and children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase perfumery and children's clothing

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and lives in the village of Panduman, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.  She is widowed with 4 school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Cecilia has a business selling salted fish and dried fish. She has been renting a space in the town market for over five years. She wakes up early in the morning to start the business operations. She treats her customers very well.  She earns about PHP 8,400 each month for her work. 

Cecilia has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional stocks of salted and dried fish to sell.

Cecilia has been a member of GDMPC since 2008.  This is the fourth loan transaction made in GDMPC. She has successfully repaid all the previous loans taken out from the cooperative. In the future, Cecilia would like to expand business outlook to obtain more income and to improve the general living condition of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of salted and dried fish  to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 53-year-old married woman with one child. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for six years. Juana sells items like canned goods, eggs and spices to the people in her community. She is also a rice retailer.

Juana has requested this loan to purchase five sacks of rice to sell. Juana hopes to continue earning from her store. She also hopes to be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Munduzkhan's Group

texts.en:
On one of the typical days of spring, the family of Munduzkhan opened a tiny shop for food retail. It was the idea of Munduzkhan’s eldest daughter to invest the long-kept family savings in a start-up of such a small but profitable business. As for any business, the location was very important. After spending a certain amount of time in search of the place, Munduzkhan finally found a nice spot in a local train station, because it is often full of passengers ready to get some food. 

After seventeen years of running the business, the family purchased an automobile and arranged wedding ceremonies for the daughters. Munduzkhan wishes to expand her business into a big grocery store in the future. Now she asks Kiva lenders for funds which will be invested in broadening the goods circulation. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase macaroni, sugar, oil and beverages.

loans.name: Gloria Zenaida

texts.es: L. Sra. Gloria es una mujer separada tiene 2 hijos, elL. es muy  trabajadora y luchadora por lograr el bienestar para toda su familia; elL. se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes y bebidas (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y gaseosas etc.), ya tiene 3 años en el negocio, gana aproximadamente S/180 nuevos soles semanales. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en L. compra D. una congeladora y L. compra D. más mercadería para su tienda. Sus sueños D. L. Sra. Gloria es poder darles una buena calidad D. vida a sus hijos y darles una buena educación y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria is separated and has two children.  She is very hard-working and tenacious in order to achieve the well-being of her family.  

She sells groceries and drinks (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and soft drinks, etc.).  She has had the business for three years, and she earns approximately 180 soles a month. 

She will use the loan she was given to buy a freezer and more merchandise for her store.

Gloria’s dreams are to be able to give her children a good quality of life, a good education, and that they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Diana Verónica

texts.es:
Diana Verónica tiene 24 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 8, 3 y 1 año de edad en el Catón ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Diana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. 
El sueño es comprar terreno y hacerse una casa 
En los tiempos libres le gusta leer y escuchar las noticias.
texts.en:
Diana Verónica is 24 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children. She lives with her husband and children (ages 8, 3, and 1) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “Dulce Sentimiento” (Sweet Feeling) is located in the Caimito II neighborhood in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This Communal Bank consists of farmers who grow short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Diana engages in farming by growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Her purchases and sales are conducted in the canton of Ventanas. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and farming supplies such as urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer so that she can keep her crops in good condition.

Her family relations have improved because she can now provide a little more support toward the well-being of her family. In addition, her work will greatly improve because she can increase production. As a result, she can obtain a much better income because the sale of her products will lead to more profits.

Diana’s dream is to buy land and build a house. In her free time, she enjoys reading and listening to the news.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, herbicide, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Norovsuren

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Norovsuren lives with her daughter and disabled brother in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Having started her garment-retailing by selling socks in the streets in 1999, she now owns two counters in the province's biggest market.

Well-known and well-experienced, Norovsuren is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I started my business from scratch. I worked hard to go this far." Now that winter is approaching, she needs warmer clothes to sell and is requesting 2,500,000 to buy more garments.

loans.use: to buy more garments.

loans.name: Mujeres En Esperanza 3, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Teresa is just 32 years old and is a young businesswoman. Her family is comprised of her long-term partner and three children living in her simple-structure home. She is one of the members in this group called Mujeres en Esperanza 3, 6 & 7 (Hopeful Women).

Teresa prepares food to be fried and sold to her clients. She cooks fried foods like Empanada (dough made of flour filled with meat and vegetables) and many other meals like fried plantain, chicken, beef, etc. She is currently receiving her second loan. She is very grateful for the loans because she has been able to advance and invest in her business, which she started around 5 years ago. She will use her new loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, fruit, plantain, chicken and disposable plates.

This group, Mujeres en Esperanza 3, 6 & 7 Group, is comprised of 15 members. Each one of them works day-to-day in their business activities in Santo Domingo. It is one of the communities with scant resources located to the north of the city.

Teresa and her group are thankful for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, fruit, plantain, chicken and disposable plates

loans.name: Elizabeth Rosse Mary

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth tiene un alojamiento que ella administra,   es una cliente nueva que necesita  el crédito para compra de colchones y sabanas para su alojamiento que esta cliente es separada tiene un hijo en la edad escolar que esta a su cargo  y su señora madre es de edad avanzada, la Sra. Elizabeth con esta actividad mantiene su hijo y a su mama ya que es su única fuente de trabajo, la Sra. es una persona amable y trabajadora que sola sale adelante por el bienestar de su hijito, su deseo es ver a su hijo profesional y de esta manera ella se sentirá feliz ya que su sacrifico valió la pena, la Sra. se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación de crédito.
texts.en:
Elizabeth has a rooming house that she runs. She is a new client who needs the loan to buy mattresses and sheets for her rooming house. She is separated and has a school-aged son who she cares for, as well as a mother who is advanced in age. 

With this business, Elizabeth supports her son and her mother, as it is her only source of employment. She is a friendly and hard-working person who is moving forward on her own, for her dear son's well-being.

Her wish is to see her son become a professional, and in this way she will feel happy and that her sacrifice was worth it. She feels happy and thankful for the opportunity she has been given through the granting of the loan.

loans.use: To buy mattresses and sheets.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 48 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy emprendedora, es una mujer que no tiene miedo a las dificultades que le pone en destino, ya que pudo criar sola a su única hija y le dio educación ya que esta separa de quien fue su conviviente y desde ese momento se hizo cargo del hogar sola, vive junto a su única hija y su nieto en su casa propia, en donde todos los días comparten juntos las ganas y entusiasmo de salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Juana consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, se encarga de realizar sus propios diseños, además realizar la costura de sus clientes, quienes la buscan siempre para que con sus mágicas manos les haga su costura ya que confían en que ella los hará un muy buen trabajo, ella tiene una taller pequeño en su casa y es desde ahí que ella realiza todo su trabajo, se inicio en su trabajo hace 20 años, inicio haciendo cosas simples y con el tiempo y la experiencia se decidió realizar cosas maá complicadas hasta lograr un buen acabado como el que tiene ahora, trabaja sola y esta mas que contenta de hacer lo que le gusta. Le esta yendo muy bien, ya que tiene muchos clientes quienes la buscan muy a menudo, además cuando no hay clientes, ella realiza su confección y así, puede vender en su tiempo libre, al principio se sentía de poca utilidad en su casa, ya que solo esperaba del dinero que ingresaba con el trabajo de su conviviente, pero se decidió hacer algo y desde entonces está mas que contenta de poder realizar este trabajo que le ha permitido realizar su vida con cierta tranquilidad, ahora desea trabajar mas y mas para así, poder seguir creciendo con este trabajo. Este será el primer préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un respaldo económico a través del préstamo que le otorgaran ya que así podrá concretar algunos planes que tiene para su negocio, por otro lado se compromete a ser una socia cumplida y a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que quiere compenetrarse rápido a su banco comunal del cual tiene buenas referencias que son muy solidarios y puntuales. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará materiales para poder seguir con su trabajo, entre las cosas que comprará serán, telas, hilos, elásticos y moldes, para así poder confeccionar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Juana, age 48, is a good, kind, and very enterprising woman.  She is a woman who is not afraid of the difficulties encountered along the way to her destiny.  She was able to raise her only daughter by herself.  She gave her daughter an education.  She separated from her live-in partner, and from that time on she has been in charge of her household.  She lives with her only daughter and her grandson in her own house.  Every day they share the desire and enthusiasm of getting ahead and having a better quality of life.

Juana makes clothes.  She makes her own designs, and she makes clothes for her customers.  They always seek her out so that her magic hands will make their garments.  They have faith that she will do a very good job.  She has a small workshop in her house where she does all of her work.

She started her work 20 years ago.  She started making simple things.  With time and experience she decided to make more complicated things until she managed the good finishing touch that she now has.

She works alone, and she is more than happy to be doing what she likes.  Things are going very well for her.  She has a lot of customers who ask for her very often.  Also, when there are no customers she makes her designs.  That way she is able to sell in her free time.

In the beginning she felt of little use in her house.  She only waited for the money that her live-in partner earned from his work.  But, she decided to do something.  From then on she is more than happy to be able to do this work.  It has allowed her to live her life with a measure of comfort.  She now wishes to work more and more in order to be able to continue growing with this work.

This will be her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support through the loan that she was granted.  This way she will be able to firm up some plans she has for her business.  She pledges to be a responsible member and to make her payments punctually.  She wants to work well with her communal bank, where there are good references about being supportive and punctual

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy materials to be able to continue with her work.  Among the things she will buy are fabric, needles, elastics, and patterns.  This way she will be able to sew in greater quantity.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, elastics, and patterns.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.ru:
Антонина живет в Мелитополе вместе со своей дочерью Анастасией. Она занимается торговлей женской одеждой на центральном рынке своего города. В бизнесе не первый год, у нее хорошее торговое место и приемлемые цены. За 15 лет работы в этой сфере Антонина смогла увеличить свой доход, который сейчас составляет 7 000 гривен в месяц. В целом в товаре у нее на данный момент 50 000 гривен. 

Антонина обратилась к КИВА за кредитом с целью закупить дополнительную партию товара к зимнему сезону. Она планирует вложить 12 000 гривен в закупку партии брюк для женщин. Широкий ассортимент разнофактурных брючек разных размеров сможет удовлетворить самые разнообразные вкусы и предпочтения клиенток Антонины, тем самым давая ей возможность подзаработать перед праздниками. Получив дополнительную прибыль, Антонина надеется приобрести новую бытовую технику в дом.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Antonina lives in Melitopol together with her daughter, Anastasia.  She is involved in selling women's clothing at her town's central market.  This is not her first year in this business, and she has a good retail location and affordable prices.  Over the 15 years of work, Antonina was able to increase her income, which now amounts to 7,000 hryvnia per month.  All together, her merchandise is currently worth 50,000 hryvnia.  Antonina requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase an additional inventory of merchandise for the winter season.  She plans to invest 12,000 hryvnia into a purchase of an inventory of trousers for women.  A wide selection of multi-fabric trousers of various sizes would please many different tastes and preferences of Antonina's customers; thus, giving her an opportunity to earn more before the holidays.  After making an additional profit, Antonina hopes to purchase new household appliances for her house.

loans.use: to purchase an additional inventory of merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Jubbo Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 14 femmes de la même localité. Elles ont solidairement organisé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Khady est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis son inauguration et elle appartient au groupe de solidarité Jubbo qu'elle dirige.
Elle debout à l extrême gauche de la photo.

Elle pratique le commerce par la vente de chaussures et d'encens. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Elle a bénéficié d'un nouveau crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter de la marchandise (chaussures encens).

A l'aide de ses bénéfices elle va aider son mari dans la gestion des besoins alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 14 women from the same village. They organized their solidarity group based on personal affinities and neighborhood ties. Their main business is retail.

Khady, age 30, is married and the mother of three children. She's been a member of the Banc Villageois since its inauguration. She's a member and the leader of solidarity group Jubbo. She's standing on the far-left in the photograph.

She sells shoes and incense. She has a good experience in her domain, due to the fact that she's been running this business for several years.

She obtained a new loan that will help her buy new supplies (shoes, incense). With her profits, she will help her husband take care of the food and school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy shoes and incense

loans.name: Señor Del Calvario De Huariquiña Group

texts.es: Jannina  tiene 34  años de edad es madre soltera con dos hijos dependientes. Ella trabaja en su bodega que apertura hace varios años. Con la finalidad de mejorar su economía familiar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de toda variedad de abarrotes y menestras.  Ella participa en el grupo “SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO DE HUARIQUIÑA”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jannina es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Jannina is 34 years old single mother with two dependent children. She works in her store which opened several years ago, with the intention of improving her family's finances. She will invest the loan in the purchase of all kinds of groceries and vegetables. 

She is participating in the group "Señor del Calvario de Huariquiña" ["Lord of the Calvary of Huariquiña"]. The group appreciates the KIVA investors for the loan offered. Jannina is the first on the left.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groceries of all kinds.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 45 years old and married with four children.  With one child in school, Edith works very hard to provide for them.

Edith has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Edith has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Edith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Homnaka

texts.en:
Mrs. Homnaka A. is a woman born in 1953 in Niamtougou, in the prefecture of Doufelgou in Northern Togo. She is married and the mother of four (04) children, and also has two (02) nieces in her care. Her husband, retired for 15 years with a meager and irregular pension, does not contribute productively anymore to household expenses. Thus, to deal with school fees and the teaching of the children, Mrs. A., in addition to her principal business - the sale and storage of cereals (millets, corn, and beans) - has added the preparation of ’Tchoukoutou,’ a millet-based drink which is very popular with the local population. However, her limited financial mans do not allow her to develop and enlarge her business. Still, she is a confident woman with a good sense of managing the gifts of others, which has translated into two previous loans of $350 and $650, repaid without any problems whatsoever. Seasoned and committed to her business, she deserves to be supported financially in her activities.

So, she is asking for a loan of $950 to obtain a stable stockpile of cereals and to resell these in times of scarcity. This will help her prepare the local drink and augment her income to tend to the needs of her family, who count solely on her for their survival.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Homnaka est une femme née en 1953 à Niamtougou dans la préfecture de Doufelgou au Nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants et a à sa charge deux (02) nièces. Son mari, un retraité depuis plus de 15 ans avec sa maigre pension encore irrégulière ne contribue plus pratiquement aux charges de la famille. Ainsi, pour faire face aux frais de scolarité et d’apprentissage des enfants, Madame A., en plus de son activité principale qui est la vente et le stockage des céréales (mil, maïs, haricots), y associe la préparation de « Tchoukoutou », une boisson locale à base de mil qui est très apprécié par la population. Toutefois, ses moyens financiers limités ne lui permettent pas de développer et d’accroître ses activités. Pourtant, elle est une femme de confiance ayant le sens de la bonne gestion des biens d’autrui, cela s’est traduit à travers des deux crédits respectifs de $350 et $650 obtenus et parfaitement remboursés sans incident. Très expérimentés et dévouée dans son commerce, elle mérite d’être soutenue financièrement dans ses activités.

Aussi, sollicite-t- elle un crédit de $950 pour faire un stockage consistant des céréales et revendre en période de pénurie. Cela pourra l’aider dans sa préparation de boisson locale et à augmenter ses revenus au besoin de sa famille qui ne compte que sur elle pour sa survie.

loans.use: To stockpile cereals and to resell in times of scarcity

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Hello, my name is Marina. I am a merchant, and I own a grocery store called “Pulpería MANI” (Grocery Store MANI). I have been doing this type of work for several years, and it allows me to take care of my family and earn an income to help cover the household costs. Due to the location of my business, sales have increased. However, I don’t have the capital to increase my inventory to be able to offer my customers a greater variety of products.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, butter, corn, beans, rice, flour, chicken, dairy products, deli meats, beverages, candy and various brands of juice.

loans.name: Gonchegul

texts.en:
Gonchegul wants to improve her sheep breeding.
She has been in this business for 4 years. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region,  Gayidish village, on the front line. She is married and has 2 children.
Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy 15 sheep.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Mrs. Houn L. S. is 27 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband, their 2 children, and her mother.  Mrs. Houn sells Khmer cake and earns $0.70/day.  Her husband is a horse-cart driver and he can earn $3/day.  This loan will be used to purchase one more horse for her husband's business and the rest will be used to purchase tools for making cake.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and more tools for her business

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en: Uktam N. is 41 years old. He is married and supports his three children. Currently he rents a small space at the market, where he sells foods. His shop is on a busy street, and he is the only food vendor in the area. Utkam will use the $1000 loan to expand the range of foods he can offer to his customers and give local habitants the opportunity to obtain quality foods close to home. Mr. N. will pay off the loan over a twelve month period.

loans.use: increasing turnover, to buy foods

loans.name: Jelssi

texts.es:
Jelssi is a young mother of two, one is two and the other one is about to be born. She wishes the best for her children and even though she is at the end of her pregnancy she is still feeding her cows and bulls, procuring the growth of her animals both big and small. Three years ago she got together with her spouse and formed a family full of love. She fattens her animals and sells them afterwards at a cattle fair, with the profits she saves and she has the dream of buying their own home. Currently she lives with her in-laws. Her husband also is a farmer; although they have been through some hardships they will keep doing this activity because they still have some good economic times when they get large sums of money. She wishes to buy a bull to fatten it and sell it, this is why she wants the loan for. Let’s help this young mother to form a solid with her effort.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Jelssi, es una joven madre de 2 hijos uno de dos años y otro que está a punto de nacer, su condición la llena de muchas satisfacciones y quiere darles lo mejor, a pesar de su estado de embarazo terminal ella sigue trabajando en la alimentación para el engorde de sus vacas y toros, procurándoles sustento también a sus animalitos pequeños.Hace 3 años decidió unirse a su pareja y formar una familia llena de afecto y hasta ahora siguen trabajando y lo seguirán haciendo porque fruto del amor que se tienen mantiene a sus pequeños en el seno de su hogar.Ella engorda a sus animales y luego los vende en una feria ganadera, con las ganancias que obtiene puede ahorrar y tiene el anhelo de tener una casa propia ya que ahora vive en casa de sus suegros, por otra parte su esposo también se dedica a las labores agrícolas y a pesar de que en algunas ocasiones, Jelssi, perdió en la venta de animales seguirá dedicándose a esta actividad porque de todas maneras existen buenos tiempos en los que obtiene considerables sumas de dinero.Desea comprar un toro más para engordarlo y luego venderlo y por ello solicita un préstamo.Apoyemos a esta joven madre que quiere formar un hogar sólido con su esfuerzo.

loans.use: Compra de un pequeño torito.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia O. is Nicaraguan, 53 years old, married and has one child. She supports her family with her grocery store and video game rental business in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. At the moment, her house does not have any doors separating the bedrooms and would thus like to purchase them to divide the rooms. She would thus be able to improve the quality of life and the home's presentation for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Julia O. es Nicaraguense, tiene 53 años, casada, con 1 hijo. Ella tiene una pulpería y un negocio de alquiler de video juegos en el barrio Laureles Norte, con los cuales sostiene a su familia. Actualmente su vivienda no cuenta con puertas de separación en ninguno de los cuartos de habitación por lo que requiere comprar puertas para así poder separarlos e ir mejorando la calidad de vida y mejorar también la presentación a sus clientes.

loans.use:
Purchase bedroom doors for her home.

Compra de Puertas para los cuartos de habitación de su vivienda

loans.name: Thi Hong

texts.vi: Chị Hồng, 27 tuổi, đã có 2 con đang học cấp I. Chị đi chợ bán hoa quả. Chị thường đi mua ở các chợ trung tâm và bán lẻ ở chợ gần nhà. Chồng chị làm mộc, chuyên đóng các đồ nội thất. Chị chưa từng tham gia vay vốn ở tổ chức chính thức nào mà chỉ vay chị em, họ hàng. Lần này, chị mạnh dạn vay vốn của chương trình tài chính vi mô Bình Minh vì thủ tục vay mượn đơn giản, được làm ngay tại thôn không phải đi đâu xa, rất thuận tiện.

loans.use: Đi chợ bán hoa quả

loans.name: Dionisia's Group

texts.en:
Nancy and Dionisia have been members of the “Aleli” community bank for four months. In that time, they have learned the importance of responsibility, punctuality, and friendship.

Nancy is 32 years old. She lives with her partner and three-year-old daughter. Nancy works with her husband driving a motorcycle taxi, doing construction work, and making furniture. They have been working in construction for five years and driving a taxi for one year.
