Dionisia is 32 years old. She lives with her partner and has five children between the ages of two and ten. Like Nancy, Dionisia and her partner do construction work and make furniture. They have been working together for four years.

Nancy and Dionisia each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy replacement parts for the taxi, as well as wood, nails, varnish, and paint.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Nancy and Dionisia plan to use their savings to buy a computer and to make more capital available to their businesses. Their dreams are to eventually own a home and a car, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: Nancy and Dionisia each need loans of 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy replacement parts for the taxi, as well as wood, nails, varnish, and paint.

loans.name: Namayemba East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace A.. She is currently in the business of buying and selling produce and is requesting a loan to increase purchases. Grace is 32 years old and is married. She has 2 children ranging from age 4 to 7 and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy building materials Grace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Veronica N., Zaria Biribawa, Ali K., and Grace A.. Veronica N. has a business in fish selling and wants to re-invest in business. Zaria Biribawa is currently operating a business in matooke selling and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Ali K. operates a business of restaurant and wants to purchase more utensils and raw foods. Grace A. is currently in the business of fish selling and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To add working capital in produce business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. prepares food for sale. She is single and focused on expanding her business. Demand for her food has increased and she wishes to increase production.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more raw materials for her food production.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more raw materials for her food production.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs.  Stella O. is 48 years of age and  lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria.   She is married with 6 children.  She sells beans and rice in the market, a business that she learnt from her brother.  She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her buy more inventory. She is a trader and has been in LAPO for the past 7 years as a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Madame Yawavi A. is 29 years old, married with two children. She grows vegetables in a small village close to Adéta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. In particular she specializes in cultivating eggplant (the vegetables shown in the photo). She has difficulty providing for the needs of her family as land suitable for cultivation is becoming more and more scarce and less fertile. With this loan, her second from FECECAV, Yawavi wants to buy equipment and lease more land suitable for cultivation in order to increase her production. As a result of the profit she will make, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Yawavi A. est âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est une cultivatrice dans un petit village qui est proche d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Elle est spécialisée dans la production des aubergines (les légumes qu’on voit dans la photo.) Elle subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille puisque les terres cultivables deviennent de plus en plus rares et moins fertiles. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, Yawavi espère acheter des équipements et bailler d’auutres surfaces cultivables afin d’augmenter sa production. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager, elle peut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy equipment in order to increase production

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita emigated with her entire family to this border due to the danger of her home land. On arriving at the border, her husband began looking for work, which he found, but the income was low and was not enough to meet their basic needs. So, Margarita decided to start up a business which would bring in a bit more money to cover costs. She started the grocery business in her home, where she paid the rent, and built up her stock bit by bit. As profits generated by the business grew, the business itself grew bit by bit, as did the number of customers visiting her. This led to a higher income which helped her family economically. With time, and the money generated by this business, she bought a premises where she now is, and a piece of land at the back, where she is now building a premises for her business.

She is requesting a loan of $975 which she will pay in 6 months, to redesign the premises and buy stock, in order to increase sales. With your help, Margarita will be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Margarita emigro con toda su familia a esta frontera por la necesidad precaria de su tierra natal. Al llegar a la frontera su esposo empezó a buscar trabajo, el cual encontró, pero su ingreso era poco, y no alcanzaba para solventar las necesidades económicas. Entonces la Sra. Margarita decidió iniciar un negocio que le dejara un poco mas de ingresos para poder cubrir todos los gastos. Inicio el negocio de abarrotes donde ella vivía, el cual pagaba renta, fue surtiendo mercancía poco a poco, en la medida que con la utilidad que le generaba el negocio, ella fue creciendo poco a poco y haciéndose de más clientes y por lo tanto tenia mas ingresos para poder satisfacer todas las necesidades económicas. Con el transcurso del tiempo y con los ingresos que este negocio generaba compro el local en el que estaba y un solar en la parte de atrás en el cual hoy en día construyo un local para su negocio.

Ella esta solicitando de un crédito por $975 que pagara en 6 meses, para la remodelación del local y compra de surtido de mercancía, para incrementar sus ventas. Con tu poyo Margarita hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To redesign her premises

loans.name: David Concepción

texts.es:
David, 26, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality. He is married and has one son, age 3. His wife is a storekeeper and helps pay household expenses. David works as a waitor and also sells tortillas. He has eight years of experience running this business, which he began with his own money. The money he is applying for will go towards improving construction of the tortilla-selling business so that it is more welcoming and can provide better service. His plan is to pay for his son's education and create a more decent life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

David tiene 26 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, es casado y tiene un niño de 3 años de edad, su esposa es comerciante y ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Don David trabaja como mesero, y también se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene ocho años de experiencia en este negocio e inició con fondos propios. El dinero que está solicitando es para mejorar la construcción del local donde tiene el negocio de venta de tortillas para estar más cómodo y dar un mejor servicio. Sus planes son poder brindar ecuación a su hijo y tener una vida más digna para su familia.

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of his tortilla-selling business

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
La Señora Maria, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del pilar”, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Zapatero y caserío de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la venta de granos como café, cacao y frijoles que cosecha de su chacra, los productos los vende en la ciudad de Tarapoto.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará abonos para  asegurar una buena producción, también comprará cerdos para engordar y vender, también pagará la mano de obra de los peones que trabajan en su chacra tanto en el cultivo como en el cuidado de las plantas.

María vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. Su familia la apoyan en casa y en las actividades de la chacra para asegurar una buena cosecha. Su meta es cultivar tomate y vender en cantidad.
texts.en:
Señora María, member of the community bank "Virgen del Pilar," lives in the region of San Martín, province of Lamas, district of Zapatero and the neighborhood of Nuevo Celendin. She sells the grains such as coffee, chocolate and beans that is harvested from her farm. She sells in the city of Tatapoto. With her $350 loan, to be paid in six months, she will buy fertilizer to guarantee good production, and will also buy pigs to fatten up and sell. She will also pay the farmhands that work on her land, cultivating and taking care of the plants. María lives with her husband and her four children that still depend on her. Her family helps her out in the house and in the farm's labor to assure a good harvest. Her goal is to grow tomato and sell in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy fertilizers and pigs, and pay for labor in her farm.

loans.name: Ilhomuddin

texts.ru: Зарипов Илхомуддин житель района Джиликуль.Возраст  35 лет,женат,имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-техническое ,по специальности  шофер.Клиент занимается животноводством.Имеет опыт  6 лет.Помогает ему его жена. Она реализует на рынке  молоко и кисло-молочную продукцию.В данный момент вырос спрос на ее продукцию.Поэтому Илхомуддин решил купить еще одну дойную корову.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ilhomuddin Z. lives in the Djilikul region. He is 35 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary technical education and is a driver by profession. He also does animal husbandry and has six years of experience. His wife is also helping him. She sells milk and other milk products on the market. At this time the demand for her products has increased. This is why Ilhomuddin has decided to buy another milk cow. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on in Rong Village in Takeo Province. In this plantation, she now has an obstacle because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Mom C. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to amend her field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Arth Rith, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Mom C. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer  to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. DesD. hace más D. 15 años trabaja en sus tierras D. cultivo, sembrando todo tipo D. productos D. su zona, también se dedica a la crianza D. animales, para los cuales prepara  cada día alimento concentrado. Sus cosechas las lleva a la feria comercial D. su ciudad para luego venderlas, generalmente son los granos D. maíz. Año tras año trabaja con mucha dedicación para que pueda tener una buena producción, D. esta manera obtiene con su trabajo, lo necesario para los gastos D. su hogar. Es la quinta vez que Julia está solicitando un préstamo en MFP. Julia solicita este dinero para invertir en la compra D. abono para sus tierras D. cultivo, ya  ha  hecho los surcos, solo falta depositar el abono y la semilla.
texts.en:
Julia is 48 years old, and she lives with her husband and children. She's been working as a farmer for more than 15 years, planting all types of local products. Julia also raises animals, preparing concentrated food for them every day. She brings her harvests, such as corn, to the commercial market in her city in order to sell them. Year after year Julia works with a tremendous amount of dedication so that she can have a good harvest and earn enough to cover the costs of keeping a home. This is the fifth time that Julia has asked for a loan with MFP. Julia would like this money to invest in fertilizer for her fields. She has already plowed and now she only needs to spread the fertilizer and plant the seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Francisa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca tiene 27 años de edad, habita del barrio Waspan Norte, en la capital de Managua, estado civil casada, tiene un hijo de 1 años de edad, los planes para su familia es terminar la construcción de su casa, algunas mejoras  en parte de la viviendas y cambiar el nivel de vida. Doña Francisca posee su  pequeño negocio de variedades como ropa, zapatos y otros con la experiencia de dos años   de comercialización, sus metas a largo plazo es expandirse a otras regiones del país. Gracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra la compra nuevas y mayores cantidades de mercadería como. Zapatos, ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, prendas interiores, prendas de plantas y otros productos. El incremento de su inventario generara mayores utilidades, lo cual se beneficiara para dar sus abonos en tiempo y forma de pago
texts.en:
Francisca is 27 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Waspan Norte in the capital of Managua, is married, and has a one-year-old son. For her family, she plans to complete the construction of her home, make improvements on part of the house, and change her quality of life. Francisca owns her own small variety store which sells clothing, shoes, and other items. With 2 years of experience running her business, her long-term goal is to expand to other regions of the country. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she will be able to purchase new and greater quantities of merchandise such as shoes, women's, men's and children's clothing, undergarments, and other products. The increase in her inventory will generate greater profits, which will benefit her by increasing her time and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget I. is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She hopes to increase her profit margin by stocking her shop with more goods. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, drinks, and provisions to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Alice A. est une couturière redoutable à Lomé. Elle exerce ce métier de puis 5 ans et y tire bien de profits. Pour professionnaliser son activité et offrir un service de qualité à sa clientèle, elle souhaite avec ce crédit acheter une machine à coudre électrique et un appareil à broderie.
texts.en:
Alice A. is a formidable dressmaker in Lomé. She has been working at this trade for five years and is deriving a profit from it. To professionalize her work and to offer quality service to her customers, she would like to use this loan to buy an electric sewing machine and embroidering equipment.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine and embroidering equipment

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn C., 44, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She is a rice miller and makes around US$ 2.50 every day. Her husband is a construction foreman and is able to earn US$ 8 per day. This couple has six children, two of whom are construction workers and two who are in school.

Mrs. Lorn C. would like to take out a loan to purchase a rice mill and a stock of rice so that she can take off rice husks with the intention of re-selling the rice and turning a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buying rice and rice mill

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Боймуродов Шерали проживает  в районе Гиссаре. Возраст 36 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет среднее образование . Уже 20 лет занимается производством национальных сундуков. Дело дает неплохой доход, а теперь наступает сезон , поэтому Шерали решил получить кредит , чтобы закупить запас материалов.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sherali B. lives in the Gissar area. He is 36 years old, is married and has four children. He has a high school education. For 20 years now he has been making traditional chests. His business provides profits that are not bad, the high season is starting and this is why Sherali decided to take out a loan in order to purchase a supply of materials. He will be able to pay back the loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: Née en 1967 à Tsévié, mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Mme Félicité A. est une charmante femme qui a depuis son jeune age du penchant pour le commerce. Ainsi, lorsque l’occasion s’est offerte à elle, Mme A. n’a pas hésité à embrasser le commerce de vente de chaussures et sacs pour femmes avec détermination dans le marché de sa localité. Grâce à sa clairvoyance, elle gère bien cette activité avec la collaboration de son mari qui n’a pas un emploi stable. Elle sollicite un financement pour louer un grand magasin, varier ses gammes de produits et élargir son étalage. Les bénéfices tirés de son commerce contribueront à renouveler régulièrement son stock et à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Tsévié, married and the mother of 3 children, Mrs. Félicité A. is a charming woman who, since her youth, has had a taste for commerce. Thus, when the occasion presented itself, Mrs. A. did not hesitate to take up selling shoes and women's handbags with determination, in her local market.

Thanks to her clairvoyance, she has been managing this business well, with the collaboration of her husband who does not have a steady job. She is requesting a loan to rent a big store, vary her assortment of products, and expand her shelving. The profit from her business contributes to regular renewal of her inventory and to improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes and women's handbags

loans.name: Sayad Ashar Group

texts.en:
S. Ashar is the group leader of S. Ashar group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for her or his business to purchase more materials for their business and make a good income for their family in future.

S. Ashar wants to take a loan for his business of fresh fruit product and he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Jamelah wants to take a loan for her hairdressing business. Samera wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business. M. Mabeyn wants to take a loan for his general store. They are very happy with this loan in Afghanistan.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Moturiayo

texts.en:
Moturiayo is 40 years old. She is a fish vendor, selling stockfish, and she has been in this business for a long time. She is married and has four children.

Moturiayo hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more stockfish to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stockfish to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther C. is fifty years old, married, and has given birth to three children:  two sons and a daughter. According to her, all are still in school: one is in the junior high while the others are in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Esther works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a trader, and runs a provisions store in her community. Her shop is on one of the streets. She buys the groceries from Accra and other big shops in her community.

Esther has been in business for sixteen years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk so that she can increase her stock. She is hopeful to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris le métier de la soudure,  il est marié et père de 03 enfants, il a ouvert son atelier dans lequel il exerce son activité en 1999. Il ne dispose plus suffisamment de matériaux pour exercer son activité, ce qui a réduit ses recettes journalières, il veut acheter de nouveaux matériaux c’est pour cette raison qu’il s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir un crédit afin d’acheter 8 feuilles de tôles, 15 tubes carrés, 12 baguettes  et 07 boîtes anti-rouille.
C’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who learned the trade of welding. He is married and the father of three. In 1999, he opened his own workshop in which he operates his business. He no longer has sufficient supplies and equipment to operate, and this has reduced his daily income. He wants to buy new supplies and equipment. For this reason, he is inquiring with WAGES to obtain a loan, so as to buy 8 sheets of metal, 15 square tubes, 12 welding rods, and 7 cans of anti-rust. With the revenues from his business, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for welding

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina A. lives in the village of Tuod, Manticao Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling a variety of different products. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for her work.

In 2009, Marcelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has applied for a new loan of $125 to buy additional products to sell. This loan will be the first taken out by Marcelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 38-year-old mother of six who owns a chemist shop (pharmacy) called Stewards Medical Care in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi. Margaret began her business hawking medicine (going door-to-door) for three years before opening her shop.

Margaret has requested a loan of Ksh 20,000 to increase her stock of medicines. She hopes to one day open another pharmacy. She dreams of educating her children, owning her own home, and learning to drive a car. Margaret describes herself as hard-working and jovial.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase her stock of medicines

loans.name: Prisea

texts.es:
La señora Prisea es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 03 hijos.  Ella estudió educación superior, vive en el Barrio Bellavista.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir ropa americana.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar variedad de ropa americana.  Ella adquiere sus productos en Bolivia por fardos y a menor precio y luego los vende en Puno.

Su deseo es poner una ferretería.

A ella le el compañerismo que hay entre sus compañeras.

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda A., from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur, is a 50-year-old married mother of three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a food market whose main source of income comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Florenda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Florenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional vegetables to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This will be her second loan GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dilma

texts.en:
Dilma A. owns and operates a a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Dilma has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Dilma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mr. Choeun T., 64, and his wife, Mrs. Kim Oem, 54, were married in 1969 and have one son who works in the Department of Social Affairs. They live on an island in Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Choeun has been a wooden house constructor for 2 years, a skill he learned from his brother. For work, he travels to other provinces far away from his house. His wife has been selling groceries since 1980. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market, for resale in her village. Choeun is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase more grocery items for his wife to sell, and to buy construction cranes for his wooden house construction business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for his wife to sell, and to buy construction cranes for his wooden house construction business.

loans.name: Sumini

texts.en:
Sumini is a 45-year-old married woman with ten children between the ages of 4 and 20 years. She owns a four-room house where she lives with twelve people. Sumini takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

She owns a stall where she sells chapati (flatbread) and other samosas (filled pastry). Sumini doesn’t pay for transportation costs to and from shopping because she works in the same market where she does her shopping. On average she receives 40 customers a day. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. Sumini has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for five years, now servicing her tenth loan, and working with the same group mates. Sumini uses public transport to and from home to work. Her challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of baking powder and cooking oil.

Sumini wants to use this loan to buy more baking powder and jerrycans of cooking oil. She is hopeful of seeing her business grow stronger, and she would like to start selling chapati to different areas, as well as employing four people.

loans.use: To buy more cooking ingredients

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 48-year-old single mother of four children between the ages of 15 and 20 years. All her children go to school. She owns a three-room house where she is staying with six people. Rose takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  She incurs additional transport costs to and from Nakawa market to buy bananas. She has a stall selling bananas to all categories of people. Rose works seven days a week. On average, she receives two customers a day. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her 10th loan. Her monthly expenses include school fees for her children and feeding the family. Rose hopes to see her business grow stronger and she hope to buy directly from the farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a thirty-five year old married mother of three children.  All three of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Felicia is a trader. She deals in hardware materials, such as cement, nails, paint, iron rods, etc. She sells in a shop by the road side in her community. She buys the goods from nearby towns. Felicia has been in business for four years and requests a loan to procure all kinds of goods to scale up her business.

loans.use: To buy hardware

loans.name: Ana Yenny

texts.es: Ana, comerciante, esta conviviendo con el señor Honoratito, tienen tres hijos pequeños, la señora Yenny anteriormente trabajaba en una casa como empleada domestica, es allí donde vio que la señora de la casa se dedicaba al negocio de traer ropa, sabanas, edredones y otros productos de la ciudad de Oruro, le nació la inquietud de entrar en el negocio donde recibió ayuda de la dueña de casa, llevándola a los viajes para traer los productos como la distribución en los mercados de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. Hace 3 años que se independizo y  trae todo lo anteriormente mencionado actualmente tiene su casa propia heredada tiene una pequeña construcción que lo levanto con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y el de su esposo. Hace 6 meses que nació la última de sus pequeñas, por lo que dejo de viajar y su capital fue acortándose. El crédito que saco en nuestra institución le será de muchísima ayuda para poder volver a viajar y crecer nuevamente en capital. Actualmente estaba comprando poca mercadería pero acá en Santa Cruz para distribuirlo de forma unitaria en las instituciones con  ganancias poco alentadoras. El sueño que tiene es el de poder traer mucha mercadería como lo hacia la dueña de casa y esta manera terminar la construcción de su casa como el de comprarse su propio vehículo.
texts.en:
Ana, a business woman, lives with Señor Honoratito and they have three small children. Mrs. Yenny used to work as a housekeeper and it was there that she first saw that the woman she worked for brought clothes, sheets, quilts and other products from Oruro as her business. This sparked her interest in the business and, with the help of her employer, she began to drive her on the trips to distribute the products in the markets in Santa Cruz. Three years ago she became independent and brings all the before-mentioned products to her home, which she inherited, where she has a small building she and her husband worked to put up. Six months ago her youngest child was born and, because of this, she stopped traveling and her resources have begun to decrease. The loan she would like to receive from this organization would be of much help to allow her to start traveling and begin to increase profits once again. Lately she is buying very little merchandise, but here in Santa Cruz she could distribute it all at once to the businesses with encouraging profits. Her dream is to be able to bring a lot of merchandise like her former employer did and, in this way, finish the construction of her home and buy her own vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased Resources

loans.name: Komla

texts.en: Mr. K. is a trained carpenter. Currently, he prepares wood for resale. His products can be used for construction or carpentry. He has been running his business from home since 1997. He is divorced and has two children. This will be his second loan with WAGES, which he will use to buy the supplies necessary to make additional wooden poles used for construction.

loans.use: Construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group No. 3

texts.en:
Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood.  The aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities.  Today, the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with UIMCEC.  Groups of five are financed through 10-month loans in which each member receives an equal amount.  On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments.  Currently, there are 14 groups of women financed through UIMCEC.  Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. CoumB. Faye, the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer.  

Awa B. heads group No. 3.  She has been selling perfumes and cosmetics for about four years.   Awa chose perfume sales as they sell quite quickly - currently, the Casablanca and Aqua de Gio scents are the best sellers, she says.  Awa is married and the mother of two children, aged 2 and 6.

The other groups members are: Mareme D., who sells detergents and soaps; Gnangna D. who has a small kiosk selling small items from perfumes to candies; Maimouna F. who has a small vegetable stall in the market of Grand Thies; and Aly T. who sells marmite cooking pots in the same market.  Each group member receives 100,000 FCFA in loan financing to bolster her respective activity.  This is the second loan for the group.

loans.use: To finance each member's small business

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.ru: Шомуродов Кахрамон проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Шомуродов Кахрамон занимается растениеводством более 5 лет. Он обрабатывает почву и сажает растение. Целью кредита является закуп семян.
texts.en:
Kahramon S. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 31 years old, married and has 3 children. Kahramon has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He treats the soil and plants plants. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Ndiaye née Seynabou Guèye  est commerçante de pagnes et de draps, une activité qu’elle a embrassée depuis 2008 après la retraite de son mari.  Elle vend dans sa maison et fait aussi le marchand ambulant. Elle est à sa deuxième demande de crédit  et sollicite 150 000 FCFA pour acheter des tissus et accessoires nécessaires à la confection des pagnes et draps. Mère de 4 enfants, Madame Guèye âgée de 48 ans veut grâce à son  commerce, subvenir à tous ses besoins, sortir de la précarité  et devenir une très grande commerçante dans les plus brefs délais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndiaye, born Seynabou Guèye has been selling pagnes (robes) and sheets since 2008 after her husband retired. She sells from her home and also as an itinerant merchant. This is the second time she is requesting a loan - this time for 150,000 FCFA - to buy fabric and the accessories necessary for the confection of pagnes and sheets. 48 years old and mother of four children, Mrs. Guèye would like to see her business answer all her financial needs, help her rise above subsistence level and become a great merchant in a short period of time.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and accessories

loans.name: María De La Concepción

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo en Managua, la señora María U. ha sobresalido por ser una excelente comerciante de ropa ofreciéndola en su localidad y siempre velando por el bienestar y sustento de su negocio que tanto le ha costado desarrollar.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa en especial ropa de interior y por este motivo ella espera que el crédito le sea otorgado porque le es de suma necesidad el invertir en la ropa para su respectiva venta en el mercado.
texts.en:
María U. is an outstanding clothing merchant in Managua's Mayoreo market; she is always looking to her business's wellbeing and support because it was such a struggle to develop it. Currently, she is asking for funding to buy clothing, especially underwear. She hopes the loan will be granted because it is of utmost necessity to invest in the clothing for its eventual sale in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en:
Myagmar is 48 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have two children who live near their home. Myagmar's daughter and son help a lot with their parent's business. Generally, they have a great family atmosphere.

Myagmar operates a dairy trading business from a rental counter at a local trading center called Saruul. She sells eggs, ham and dumplings. Myagmar moved to Ulaanbaatar from the countryside in 2003 and has been running her dairy business since 2008.

Recently, Myagmar has started operating a grocery store and has been working hard to accumulate enough money to buy a retail space of her own. She is a very hardworking person who has great communication skills.

Myagmbar is focused on the future and says, “My dream is to purchase an apartment for my family.” She is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase a variety of food products for her grocery store business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products for her grocery store

loans.name: Selah Atieno

texts.en:
Selah Atieno A. is 45 years-old. She is married and the mother of five children. She also takes care of two orphans left behind after the death of her daughter. With her husband not having a stable job, Selah works hard to be able to help her husband in supporting their family. She operates a hotel (a type of basic restaurant) based at Nyamasaria, Kisumu, Kenya where the family also stays.

To be able to expand her business, Selah would like a loan of Ksh. 20,000 to boost her business and to be able to increase her income. Her goal is to see all the seven children under her care get an education that will guarantee them a bright future.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema I. is a small-scale businesswoman. She runs a grocery business in the Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of goods, including soft drinks and beer. She purchases the goods from suppliers and local shops. She plans to expand the business as she generates more customers. She is requesting a loan of 700,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy business goods

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe is a mother of three children. Her eldest is aged 14 and goes to school. She married her husband, Ruben, in 1994. Mariafe got involved in rice farming in 2000 and continues to farm today. The rice farm provides food for her family and it is also how she generates income.
A few years back, Mariafe was also able to open a sari-sari store. She now focuses on running the store and taking care of her children, while her husband mostly maintains their rice farm. She hopes to succeed in her ventures.
Mariafe would like to request a loan of 7,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She will also add merchandise to her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario J. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la venta de muebles de madera por la ciudad.
Le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacer el pedido necesario y tener suficiente inventario ya que sus clientas le están solicitando diferente muebles y mas modernos.
Planea pagare el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario J. has already been selling wooden furniture around the city for more than two years. He's lacking sufficient variety of merchandise, and he doesn't have the money he needs to request it to have the inventory he needs for his clients, who are asking him for different and more modern pieces of furniture. He plans to repay the loan with part of the profits from his business, which is his family's source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres De Debora 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Debora (Debora's Women), and her story is representative both of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, an area whose economy is dependent on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children.

Maria is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having fully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling underwear by purchasing bras, undershirts and underwear to sell. She will use the profits to save toward building a location for her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: Panties, brassieres and undershirts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on millet and sugar to make beverages
